story:
We are Ted and Stacy Anderson; parents to two boys, ages 4 and 6.  We have felt the need for an indoor play option in the west Metro.  So began our journey to create InnerActive, an outdoor playground brought inside.  

We have signed our lease at 131 Cheshire Lane, Minnetonka, and would love your help to get us up and running!  We are planning to include a separate area for toddlers, with a generous space for them to play.  Also included will be a large playground, a jumper, creative play areas, and sports fields.  To make this the perfect place for your next birthday party, we have included a party room.

InnerActive’s basic focus is children’s play and fitness for 1 to 12-year old children. We are providing a parental-supervised safe, clean, climate-controlled environment for children to exercise and have fun while stimulating their imagination and challenging them physically.  The indoor playpark is based on the premise that if you set a large number of children inside a safe, imaginative play area, they are going to have fun.  They are also going to develop basic motor skills, social skills, muscle tone and self-confidence.  Parents can also enjoy hours of close interaction with their children in a safe, secure, and stimulating environment.

We will base InnerActive’s appeal on providing a stimulating indoor environment for children to play in, while adhering to the strictest quality control standards emphasizing excellence in service, safety, security, sanitation, cleanliness, and creativity.  Furthermore, we are dedicated to the continual development of creative themes and interactive designs that have entertainment and educational value which will ensure our competitiveness and success in the family entertainment market years into the future.

InnerActive will consist of:

· A play structure for children ages 2-12

· A padded tiny-tots area for children 3 and under

· A kangaroo jumper

· A half size basketball court 

· A turf lined ‘soccer field’ 

· An area for building blocks and imaginative play. 

Also included will be cafeteria-style seating with a variety of vending machines.  Food will be welcomed in this area, from outside sources, or from available vending machines; but will be restricted throughout the rest of the park.  All areas will have flooring recommended for the play structure. 

For family celebrations, such as birthdays and special occasions, we will offer a private party room. This room will be available for our customers as a self-serve party room.  They will be able to bring in the items they would like for their event.  If a pre-planned party is preferred, we will have birthday party packages available at a per-head cost, which will include decorations, food and beverages, cake, and entrance fee into the park.

story:
FEATURED IN

  

 

OUR LEATHER CRAFTS

 

Our products are uniquely crafted from premium goat leather.

Unlike other leather bags, ours is 100% handcrafted and vegetable tanned. It is an old artisanal process which has no harmful chemicals . It is biodegradable and has significantly higher durability compared to synthetic materials. We offer responsible consumerism to our customers as our vegetable-tanned leather product enables you to cut your environmental footprint.

 

Moksha bag

 

Artha bag

 

Kama bag

 

 

HOW WE TRANSFORM COMMUNITIES 

 

NOMAD is a Social Enterprise committed to alleviate poverty faced by underprivileged communities in developing countries. We help artisans to build a sustainable income by helping them to design products and providing them access to new markets. Profits from the sale of each bags will largely be used to support children education in the villages.

With this crowdfunding campaign we will be able to impact the lives of 140 children and 25 artisans in Roopsi Village, India, as soon as December 2016. We will be going there for a month to implement the upgrades you will have enabled us to make thanks to your contributions. On top of providing children with school materials, we hope to sponsor children education fees, supply each class with a fan, build the school's first toilets, build a roof and provide the school with a water filter system. The size of our action depends on your generosity!

You will be able to follow our daily actions through social medias and weekly mailing updates.

 

 

CURRENT SOCIAL PROJECT

 

Based on our year long experience in travelling India , we decided to first focus on one rural community.

We engaged 25 artisans in Roopsi Village, Rajasthan, and launched our first bag collection. Majority of the villagers are Dalits who are seen as members of the lowest caste in Indian society and face various aspects of discrimination.

With the first batch of bags sold, we drew capacity to deliver sweaters for 140 children who are unable to afford warm clothes in winter, build a temporary toilet and provide book supplies.

With the launch of Nomad, we are aiming at:

  • Increasing Dalits artisans' standard of living and more than double their initial income through an increase in sales volume
  • Improving education quality in the village’s school 

During our visits, we identified 3 key issues which need to be addressed promptly to enable children to learn in appropriate conditions. 

1. Target children’s more pressing needs: 

  • Provide daily meals and writing materials,
  • Support their tuitions fees to enable every child to go to school

 

2. Build a more conducive schooling environment by developing infrastructure:

  • Build sanitation facilities that the school is lacking 
  • Build a roof
  • Provide a fan for all classroom
  • Provide a water filter to ensure drinkable water.

3. Improve the school syllabus:

  • Enriching the curriculum with talent exposure modules and programs

Throughout this project in India, we are projecting to help a minimum of 25 artisans and 140 children.

 

WHY DO WE NEED YOU?

 

Social Impacts

With this campaign, not only will you help NOMAD to fund its business development and ensure its lasting social action, you will also directly impact the school in Roopsi village and the working conditions of our partner artisans. 

With your contribution each child will be provided with:

  • Adequate writing materials
  • Improved school facilities
  • Drinkable water
  • Alleviated tuition fees

Artisans will:

  • Receive increased incomes through the purchase of bags
  • Be provided with proper working tools to improve their working conditions

 

Business Development

Fund our operations in the following areas :

  • Shipping costs and inventory stocks
  • Prototyping of our upcoming products
  • Engaging new artisans within Asia

 

OUR VISION

By 2020, Nomad envisions to impact up to 10 communities within Asia and to contribute to the United Nation Goals of poverty eradication and education improvement.

Our ultimate goal is to promote equality, provide people from underprivileged communities with enhanced opportunities and enable new generations to escape the clutch of poverty cycle.

 

DON’T STOP HERE, JOIN US!

 

 

SPREAD THE WORD: Add us on our Facebook, Instagram and Twitter !

The more engaged people join us, the stronger we will be!

 

PERKS

 

 

FAQS

 

1. When can I choose the bag/colour/sizing that I want?

After the campaign ends, you'll receive a survey to submit all information needed to deliver your reward (mailing address, choice of bag, size and colour of t-shirt, etc).

2. How are we handling local and international shipping?

For specified perks shipping fees is not included. The shipping fees are at a reduced rate and calculated according to the destination. Unfortunately, custom or duty fees are not included in the cost. If any of such fees is incurred, you will have to bear the cost.

story:
Our culinary and entertainment lounge started about 6 years ago in New York. With a new city, we have been in development for the last 6 months. We offer a varied live entertainment lounge with an upscale menu that appeals to the epicurean, foodie, and artist.

Many people are interested in going to a venue where they can experience live music, as well as have great food. Too many times you can have one and not the other. Our lounge puts both in the same place. 

Our lounge tackles this need by taking a management team with experience in the culinary and music industries and creating a one of a kind experience. Opening the lounge for nightly entertainment of all kinds, private events, as well as catering are our main short term goals.

Our location is already secured, along with some of our equipment and appropriate licensing. This money would be used for more equipment, advertising, and giving the space extra touches so it can be what we've envisioned even faster than just our capital will take us. We'd *love* to raise anywhere from $5,000 to $15,000, but we believe with all of our powers combined, we can get there and beyond.

Entertainment is an industry that goes back to early mankind. From the games, to the gladiators, people have wanted to be entertained. In the now, we have hibachi grills, cinema and bistro concepts, live dinner theatre, and the like.

While the culinary scene continues to emerge and thrive, fast food has taken over many of our beloved pastimes, making it nearly impossible for people to be entertained and fed well in an ambient atmosphere.

Over the last few years there has been a marked incline and market presence for older music, as well as live content. With the overrun of pop music and catchy tunes on the airwaves, true aficionados find themselves with limited space to hear quality content, and artists find themselves with nowhere to perform.

With the culinary industry, you find the main staples of the American diet in play, and have to travel and/ spend major capital in order to enjoy an experience. While everyone may not be interested in a gastropub, others are tired of the same old food day after day.

We believe that our lounge could reinvigorate the marketplace and provide somewhere for talent and foodies alike to dwell. We have located the perfect space, in a great area to reach the target market.

Our team has over 20 combined years in startups, small businesses, and the culinary industry. We have worked with leaders in all of these sectors, and have gleaned their methods for success. 

We appreciate you taking a look and if there's a support level or perk you'd like to see, let us know!
***A peek at our business plan is also available upon request!***

story:
​

 

The Future of Tsunami Books:

Tsunami Books has been at 2585 Willamette Street in beautiful South Eugene for 21 years. Tsunami has often been called “an Institution”; certainly the 3500+ events we’ve hosted, all surrounded by books shelved on precious recycled lumber, have created an exquisite patina,   “A big umbrella for the arts, and the human heart."  Last year at this time we signed a two-year lease-extension after completing a Crowd-funding Campaign (take a look at last year's crowdfunding video we produced. The truth remains the truth) that allowed us to cover a part of the increased costs of keeping this working-class bookstore alive and healthy. Recently we were informed that sometime soon after July 1, 2017 there are plans to level this building, tentatively replacing it with a two-story retail building, with rent at approximately double the present rate.

This news saddens a lot of good people. Regardless, for now, we simply must do everything possible to thrive. One thing is absolutely certain:  the retail sales, the events, the hearts touching hearts--between now and July 1, 2017 need to be the best ever here at the Bookstore. If they are, opportunities for a future life may likely materialize.  Not to go out in a blaze of glory, but to continue the blaze of glory, and see where it leads.

Thanks!  

 

What We Need & What You Get

We Want to Sell at Least 200 Giftcards this Month to Raise $5000 for the Restocking of Our Shelves.   Drop on by the store, or use this handy Tsunami Books Indiegogo Crowdfunding Campaign to purchase Giftcards (Gift Certificates) for your friends or family to use anytime in the next year, on anything in the store, including entrance to our popular music, theater, and poetry performance events.  The Perfect Gift for Lovers of All Things Tsunami!

 

Risks & Challenges

Tsunami Books has always worked under the assumption that Human Energy Equals Capital.  In this modern world, however, the power of the people too often takes a seat in the back, while the big capitalists are hogging the trough.  By combining the Tsunami Staff's stellar work ethic to an unending creativity, for 21 years we have been an example of what human heart,  guts, mind and muscle can do, regardless of the corporatists' relentless push for more.

That being said, without an increase in cash flow, the stress of running this business on a shoestring could well overwhelm the opportunity for a great memorable year to come.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you very much for your continued support over the years, particularly regarding the kindness of heart this Community has always shown.  Please feel free to share with your friends all over the world that Now is a great time to do a little early holiday, or just special shopping.

story:
Giving Through Gifting: Revolutionizing the Art of Gifting.

Packed with Purpose is a specialty gifting company that curates gifts comprised of products with a social impact. We discover and showcase items produced by social enterprises and purpose-driven companies across the country. We thoughtfully curate our collection of products into individual boxes that you will love to give and to receive.

Our collection of products creates social impact across US communities. We believe in causes that all humans can relate to and get behind.

For example, one of the products we feature, and the organization behind it, provides disadvantaged individuals with workforce development opportunities to break the cycle of poverty. Another of our partner organizations empowers teens to develop their leadership and entrepreneurial skills.

Packed with Purpose gift boxes can be purchased on a one-off basis or as a seasonal subscription (4 boxes per year). In addition, for larger orders, we customize and personalize boxes for corporate and event gifting needs. At launch we will feature one curated gift box. Starting in early 2017 we will offer a variety of gift box options for you to choose from online.

Packed with Purpose was created with a desire to infuse social good into gift giving. Have you ever wished you could send a gift that was unique, reflected your values, and also delivered social impact? I did. And that’s why I’ve created an alternative to the gift options currently available. With Packed with Purpose, I’ve married my passion for social impact with my desire to find thoughtful, unique gifts. 

In my own gift searching and gift giving efforts, I have learned about countless organizations across the US who create beautiful products that have a profound impact on people’s lives. I want to increase the impact of these organizations by creating gifts that consumers like yourself can enjoy- both for the products themselves, and for the impact they have on individuals’ lives.  

We believe in the power of surprise so we’ve decided not to fully reveal the items in our gift box. But rest assured you will be delighted with a beautifully designed box that we’re sure you’ll love. Once you peel your eyes from the box itself you’ll be thrilled to discover an assortment of high-quality products produced by socially conscious companies and organizations across the US.

Every product in your box is packed with purpose. We really mean that – each and every product has a positive impact on society in its own unique way. So, as you enjoy some rich honey, delicious chocolate, or a fragrant candle you are not only treating yourself, but are also making a positive impact on society. Our gift boxes offer true meaningful indulgence.

Through all this, we never lose sight of the joy gifts are meant to bring forth. We believe in stimulating all your senses, so some products will appeal to your taste buds, some to your smell, and others to your touch. The social impact of your gift is just the cherry on top of a joyful experience.

You’ll be able to order Packed with Purpose gift boxes in the following ways:

1. Corporate & Event Gifts

Looking for a great end-of-year employee recognition gift, a unique gift to send clients for the holidays, or a memorable event gift? If you’re interested in customizing Packed with Purpose gift boxes for your specific needs contact us directly (via our website) so we can talk to you about our custom gift box options.

2. One-off Gifts

We will offer distinct Packed with Purpose boxes for different occasions (i.e. birthdays, a new baby, house warming) and across themes (i.e. for the Midwesterner, for the chef). New options will be available every month, so be sure to sign up for our updates. One-off gifts enables you to select the perfect gift for your friend or loved one. 

 3. A Subscription Model 

By signing up for a subscription, you will receive a Packed with Purpose box once a season, (4 boxes a year) filled with a curated assortment of products. Each box is different and you’ll never be bored with our changing assortment of goods.

 

All the products that will be featured in this launch Packed with Purpose box have already been selected and we’ve developed a strong relationship with the suppliers behind them. So, rest assured, you’ll receive a fantastic gift box.  

Plus, we’ve already secured a top-quality fulfillment center who will work to assemble and ship our gift boxes to you.  We’ve done our best to think through all the details around the handling, shipping and logistics so that all you need to do is to kick back and await your unique gift boxes in the mail.  Our promise: if any hiccups arise, we will be sure to address them asap.

Each box is different and you’ll never be bored with our changing assortment of goods. All the products that will be featured in this launch Packed with Purpose box have already been selected and we’ve developed a strong relationship with the suppliers behind them. So, rest assured, you’ll receive a fantastic gift box.  Plus, we’ve already secured a top-quality fulfillment center who will work to assemble and ship our gift boxes to you.  We’ve done our best to think through all the details around the handling, shipping and logistics so that all you need to do is to kick back and await your unique gift boxes in the mail.  Our promise: if any hiccups arise, we will be sure to address them asap.

story:
Short Summary

LeafyGills is an Aquaponics Cannabis/Food production brand that is motivated to educate people on how to create and build their own Aquaponics Cannabis system through various grow coaching videos in addition to leveraging the corporate world for small business owners and women entrepreneurs. The donations will go towards building our website and the editing and production of our grow coaching videos for the public to invest in. For every $50 donation received our contributors will receive 50% off any one course they choose. This wealth of knowledge is a valuable resource to those looking to set up a grow for the first time, build up a small businesses, growing without chemical pesticides & fertilizers, education on live microbiology and/or  expand your skills in the agricultural industry. The educational  videos will also help shift the mindset of mom and pop business owners on how to leverage the corporate paradigm to protect their assets and build their businesses safely and successfully.

  • Our Executive Team (https://leafygills.com/executive-member/)
  • Our Core Team (https://leafygills.com/core-member/)
  • About Us (https://leafygills.com/company-bio/)

Why This Project is Important

Because this industry has been in the hands of the Mom and Pop farmers for almost a 100+ years and if they don't learn the Corporate Methodology then this industry will quickly be absorbed by Large Corporations  

  • Watch this Video from Ted Talk to lear more (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0M4Fse1Ioaw&feature=youtu.be)

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need $30,000 to finish 150 educational videos focusing on the production and education of Medical Cannabis. After Shooting the Raw video we out source the raw video to an editing team that charges $25 hour and takes 5-7 hours to finish each video. We then pay a graphics designer to create Graphics to make the videos more pleasing. 
  • This company is the 1st Aquaponics woman's owned and operated Cannabis Brand. These corporate development videos and Cannabis Growing videos cover everything need to teach people how to create their own income in this early industry. 
  • The funds will only be used to finish the videos and if extra funds are collected we will use them to finish the website and create more quality content
  • For contributing we will give you 1 free month to access the courses without pay and give you the course half off after the 1st trial month is complete.

The Impact

  • This project is valuable to the world because of the techniques that are used to grow Cannabis being green Friendly and that this video supports women in the cannabis industry 
  • I would recommend reviewing the bio of our team. The team of Leafy Gills has a long history of picking winners

Risks & Challenges

  • We are shooting film in a 100% legal Cannabis Garden in Co. 
  • We have already shoot the entire raw footage from start to finish and now all we need left is a little capital to finish the video production.
  • Our main challenge like so many others is to stick to the game plan. Although, we are very conscious of this being the main problem and review our top Priorities as a team Weekly

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If possible even if you can not donate will you please share the link to friends and family and ask them to donate.
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Introduction

By owner, Christine Brenner

For as long as I can remember, I have loved words and the beauty and power they hold. Whether it was poems, short stories or diary entries, I was always writing and absorbing every book I could get my hands on as a child. But my first “true love” moment happened when my fourth-grade teacher gave me The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe by C.S. Lewis. I fell in love with the language, the story and the adventurous hero, Lucy, who was the same age I was. The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe helped to break down the barriers and limitations in my head as a young girl and made me unafraid to open new doors.

I was fortunate to have teachers who inspired me and to have a family that valued reading and always made sure I had access to books. My early experiences with literacy helped to shape my career and my life, first as a teacher, then a school librarian, then a stay-at-home mom and now the owner of a children’s bookstore.  I want to share my passion for children’s literature and the importance of early literacy. I envision Read With Me, A Children’s Book & Art Shop as a place where everyone is welcome and where visitors feel inspired to meet a new friend — real or imagined.

Clifford showing me some love

About Read With Me

Read With Me was conceived because we saw the need for a place in downtown for families to experience together. Read With Me will be a place for us all to share our love of children’s books — a place where you can find a great book to read, join a book club or be inspired to write your own story in our workshop space. In picture books and graphic novels, illustrations are vital to storytelling. Read With Me will have an exhibit featuring illustrators and host illustration classes. We will celebrate all things related to the art of creating and sharing stories.

The family outside of Read With Me

We are all well aware of the importance of literacy for a child’s academic success. Our name, Read With Me, highlights the No. 1 way to encourage your child to value reading: by reading “with” rather than “to” your child. Reading should be a shared, engaging experience between adult and child that is an open interaction of sharing thoughts and asking questions.

Reading with Dad (4 months; 5 years)

Above all, reading should be fun. Yet I understand that, at times, it can feel like a chore. The best way to make it fun is to read books that you find enjoyable, and not everyone has the time to find those perfect books. At Read With Me, we sift through the thousands of children’s books published each year and carefully curate a diverse collection that kids will love and parents will love to read with them. When kids see us enjoying reading, they will internalize a love for reading also.

Reading under the covers; Reading with a friend

What's our Budget?

Shops are built with money, not just dreams. So here is where your contributions can help. Read With Me's flexible goal is $50,000. While that is only half of our start-up expenses, it is an essential part. Here is our budget so you know exactly where your funds are going.

Outdoor event space; inside the store

  • Inventory- A carefully curated inventory of high-quality, diverse, engaging children's books, from board books to young adult: $20k
  • Furnishings- Lots of safe and stylish bookshelves, tables and chairs: $25k
  • Design- Hiring design services from locally owned businesses, including interior and exterior signage, interior layout, logo, website, print materials: $15k
  • Equipment- Computer & POS system, lighting, security, sound system: $15k
  • Rent, deposits, fees, improvements: $15k
  • Marketing- Grand opening and other promotions: $5k
  • Supplies: $5k

Grand total for opening: $100,000!*

*These numbers are based on industry averages and area estimates. We have a complete business plan, including 5 year financial projections and budget.
Even if we reach our goal, please keep donating. Every dollar we receive will help make Read With Me a truly unique place for families to experience together in downtown Raleigh.

What are your perks?

Read With Me's campaign perks are truly unique. Everyone who donates to this start-up campaign is directly helping to open its doors and welcome new friends. We wanted to give everyone the chance to leave a mark on the shop. Whether you help us to buy some quality graphic novels or have a plaque with your child’s name added to our Creativity Corner, we sincerely appreciate your support.

  • All pledges- Download a "Read With Me" bookmark.
  • All pledges- Names of everyone who pledges will be added to our book "Read With Me Friends & Family" on display at our downtown Raleigh shop and listed on our website.

BONUS: If we reach our $50,000 goal, we will donate 500 books to a local literacy non-profit that puts books in the hands and homes of children who need them.

Our fundraising goal may be flexible, but our gratitude is firm. Thank you so very much for supporting our dream of bringing more cultural experiences for kids to downtown Raleigh.

Where to Find Us

Read With Me, A Children's Book & Art Shop will be located in the heart of downtown Raleigh, North Carolina's State Capitol at 111 E. Hargett Street, Suite 110. Within just three blocks of us are: Marbles Kids Museum, Wells Fargo IMAX Theatre, Moore Square Park, ArtSpace, North Carolina State Capitol, NC Museum of Natural Sciences,  and several kid-friendly restaurants, ice cream shops and coffee spots. There are plenty of easily accessible and inexpensive parking garages nearby (Wilmington Street Station, Moore Square Public Parking, Alexander Square), as well as street parking. With First Friday Art Walks and festivals, there is always something fun going on.

We’re online

  • Facebook: Read With Me, A Children’s Book & Art Shop @ReadWithMe.NC
  • Twitter: ReadWithMe.Raleigh @ReadWithMe_NC
  • Instagram: ReadWithMe_Raleigh
  • Website: www.ReadWithMe.us (with online ordering and blog under construction)

Media Mentions

  • Shelf Awareness: http://www.shelf-awareness.com/issue.html?issue...
  • WRAL Go Ask Mom: http://www.wral.com/children-s-bookstore-to-ope...
  • Triangle Business Journal: http://www.bizjournals.com/triangle/news/2017/0...
  • News & Observer: http://www.newsobserver.com/entertainment/books...
  • Facebook: Downtown Raleigh Alliance @downtownraleigh
  • Facebook: New Raleigh @newraleigh
  • Twitter: Children's Bookshelf ‏@PWKidsBookshelf Jan 12

Risks & Challenges

You may have heard some bleak reports about the future of printed books and physical bookstores over the past several years. The triple threat of e-books, Amazon sales and the recession certainly hit the book market hard. However, printed books have proven they are here to stay, especially with children. The children’s book market has grown to a third of the entire book market. And people all over the country are realizing the power of shopping local and importance of supporting small businesses. New bookstores are opening, and the survivors are thriving!

All new business ventures have obstacles. Here are some of ours:

  • Cost to open: Opening a new retail store is an expensive venture, but we have a very thorough expense report and projections. Margins are low and profits are slow for books. But with the help of this campaign and owner financing we will open!
  • How to shine: With many places to buy children’s books and with thousands of children’s books published each year, we have to reflect a special glow. Read With Me will carefully curate a collection of the best children’s books that your kids will love and you will love to read with them. Our Creativity Corner workshop space will inspire your budding writer or illustrator. And our book clubs for kids and adults will connect you with new and fictional friends.
  • To prosper and grow: Raleigh is experiencing impressive growth, and we want to grow along with it. In order to make sure Read With Me is here for the long term, we will focus on smart marketing to find our customers and stay connected. Read With Me will actively seek and value customer input and feedback. We will build strong relationships within the community and with those passionate about children's literacy and literature.

Our support system is strong and always growing, thanks in part to this campaign. We are lucky to have friends and family to support us, and to have a very strong small-business-friendly community in downtown Raleigh and the greater Triangle region.

Other Ways You Can Help

    Share the love of reading by sharing our Read With Me campaign and, of course, reading with a child every day and everywhere!

    Follow the campaign for updates on all the exciting things happening before the grand opening.

    Thank you so much and we look forward to seeing you at Read With Me!!!!!

story:
We are Kerri and Numahka.    
 

                                     Kerri Hartman                                    Numahka Swan

Kerri is a natural hostess and net worker. She is friendly, engaging, and passionate about the mental health benefits of slowing down to learn a handcraft. She is an avid, skilled knitter, and is all about exceptional customer service.

Numahka is the reason people gasp when they open our doors. Her vision creates the flavor of our emporium. She’s the bookkeeper, ask her anything about the shop, and she will pull the file. She is also the reason our website is full of life. Numahka’s home, and by extension our shop, is where many of the teenagers in town come for a word of encouragement, and a place to feel at home.

We met 12 years ago while caring for an elderly man who lived to be 92. After 7 years of working together for Bob, he passed, and we wondered what to do next. We both care about people and the state of the world, and we wanted to make a difference in peoples’ lives. Both of us had realized that we all have the power to create with our choices, actions, hands, hearts and minds. We sought out an outlet to empower and inspire others to become master creators in their own lives.  We believe that a healthier world can be created one handcraft at a time.

An Unexpected Opportunity

 

We said yes when asked if we wanted to take over a small existing yarn shop, and although we’ve always had a grand vision, we didn’t expect the need to grow so rapidly. Soon after our first year in business, everyone in our building was given 3 months notice. We weren’t quite ready to expand, so we took a moment and asked ourselves - do we change or end? Our locals encouraged us to move forward because in our short life, the shop had already become a vital thread in the community.

…. and then we found the perfect location.

                                                                                          

                      First days at the new location.            Filling the space.

                                                      

Our veranda then.

Our Mission

Our vision has always included supporting people who seek to make a living through their craft - whatever their craft may be. We’ve collaborated with artists from every aspect of the fiber industry, as well as potters, metal and wood workers, animators, and musicians.

Our mission includes changing the way commerce works by shortening the gap between product and customer. Buying locally is not just good for the economy, it also benefits the environment and connects us to our neighbors in a meaningful way.

What Bazaar Girls Yarn Shop offers that sets us apart is the space itself. Not the building, but the space we have created to hold the Marketplace, the Classroom, the Retreat, and Community Outreach.

A Crafting Community, crafting community.

What we have done and are doing.

Our Shop.

Children's corner.

A collection of hand dyed yarn & fiber.

Examples of other locally made items we sell.

 

Our veranda now.

 

Natural dye workshop with Emily from 'Local Color' and a student from

Natalia's 'Prayer Flag' needle felting class.

 

Spinning workshop with Lauralee Deluca.

Kerri teaching beginning knitting.

Field trip with students from O.C.E.A.N.

 

Crafting For A Cause

100 hats for 25,000 Tuques

 

Coffee Cozies for  the 'Boiler Room' & making blankets for the 'Linus Project'.

The 'Mother Bear Project'.

Knitted Knockers

    

 

                                                       
Getaway Retreat 2017
 

Our shop fulfills needs that are bigger than either of us alone. Bazaar Girls and boys everywhere have come out of the woodwork to join in on this crafting revolution. We are at another precipice, and we find ourselves asking once again: Change or end?

The demand for our goods, the space, and classes is expanding so rapidly that we cannot maintain it on our own. In order to grow to meet the demand, it is vital that we bring in more people to help maintain and fine tune our systems, as well as make the push to bring the next phase of our vision into fruition.

 

Sustainable Growth & The Grander Vision

What we want to do.

A $100,000 will give us the start up capital to set up systems in all three major areas of our business. Once set up, these systems will grow and be able to sustain themselves.

The initial main goals for our Marketplace are:

  1. To purchase and set up a POS system which will save us time and money by helping us manage and replace our inventory more accurately and efficiently.
  2. Add the yarn lines from 6 of our most loved & 'unique to us' companies to our on-line store. We know these yarns will sell and these small companies will be given a substantial boost from our initial purchases. We'll reinvest the money from the yarn sales to replace inventory and to continue to add companies to our on-line store.

$57,500 invested in our Marketplace would be used as follows:

  • $1200 for our POS system.
  • $1000 to pay for help in adding our inventory to new system.
  • $8000 for 8 weeks of photographing, editing, and adding inventory to on-line store.
  • $47,300 to purchase inventory and rent a small heated space to store it.

 The initial main goals for our Classroom are:

Our beautiful classroom has never met its full potential. Doing so would require the focused attention of an employee who thrives on community outreach and is not involved with the daily workings of the shop.

$15,000 invested in our Classroom would be used as follows:

  • $10,000 to hire a part time Classroom Coordinator - up to 68 hours a month for a year with the objective being, that at the end of the year the classroom would begin to pay for itself, and we will be able to keep the Coordinator on staff.
  • $2500 for advertising, printing and other promotional costs.
  • $2500 for website maintenance, updating, and continued development.

If we go beyond our $100,000 goal, we will immediately begin the process of turning our classroom into a nonprofit.

 

The initial main goals for our Retreats are:

  1. Raise enough money to pay for our 'Getaway Retreat' in April 2018, and save the money brought in from this retreat to pay for the next one. As word spreads about how fun these are, and they grow, we will expand to two retreats a year.
  2. Develop our 'Build your own Retreat' for individual groups throughout the year.

$27,500 invested in our Retreats would be used as follows:

  • $25,000 for 'Getaway Retreat'
  • $8154 - Teachers: includes teaching fees, travel, a place to stay, and some meals.
  • $2534 - Marketing: The more people we reach, the more people will sign up!
  • $4500 - Event Coordinator: She is invaluable in making our retreat run smoothly. She handles the details.
  • $4360 - Classrooms & event rooms at the Maritime Center
  • $3500 -  Caterer
  • $1452 Goody Bag Fillers and Door Prizes
  • $500 Bags
  • $2500 for development of 'Build Your Own Retreat'
  • $2500 for web development. We want people to be able to customize their retreat on-line.

Every penny we raise through this campaign will not only keep our community space and shop open, but will allow us to create sustainable systems to continue to offer our charity knits, free events, and community support. Thank you to everyone for joining this Crafting Revolution!

We sought out an outlet to empower and inspire others to become master creators in their own lives.  We believe that a healthier world can be created one handcraft at a time.
An Unexpected Opportunity
 
We said yes when asked if we wanted to take over a small existing yarn shop, and although we’ve always had a grand vision, we didn’t expect the need to grow so rapidly. Soon after our first year in business, everyone in our building was given 3 months notice. We weren’t quite ready to expand, so we took a moment and asked ourselves - do we change or end? Our locals encouraged us to move forward because in our short life, the shop had already become a vital thread in the community.
…. and then we found the perfect location.
                                                                                            
                      First days at the new location.            Filling the space.
                                                       

Our veranda then.
Our Mission
Our vision has always included supporting people who seek to make a living through their craft - whatever their craft may be. We’ve collaborated with artists from every aspect of the fiber industry, as well as potters, metal and wood workers, animators, and musicians.
Our mission includes changing the way commerce works by shortening the gap between product and customer. Buying locally is not just good for the economy, it also benefits the environment and connects us to our neighbors in a meaningful way.
What Bazaar Girls Yarn Shop offers that sets us apart is the space itself. Not the building, but the space we have created to hold the Marketplace, the Classroom, the Retreat, and Community Outreach. 
A Crafting Community, crafting community.
What we have done and are doing.



Our Shop.

Children's corner.

A collection of hand dyed yarn & fiber.

Examples of other locally made items we sell.
 

Our veranda now.

 
Natural dye workshop with Emily from 'Local Color' and a student from 
Natalia's 'Prayer Flag' needle felting class.
 

Spinning workshop with Lauralee Deluca.

Kerri teaching beginning knitting.

Field trip with students from O.C.E.A.N.
 
Crafting For A Cause

100 hats for 25,000 Tuques
  
Coffee Cozies for  the 'Boiler Room' & making blankets for the 'Linus Project'.

The 'Mother Bear Project'.

Knitted Knockers
    
  
                                                       

Getaway Retreat 2017
 
Our shop fulfills needs that are bigger than either of us alone. Bazaar Girls and boys everywhere have come out of the woodwork to join in on this crafting revolution. We are at another precipice, and we find ourselves asking once again: Change or end?
The demand for our goods, the space, and classes is expanding so rapidly that we cannot maintain it on our own. In order to grow to meet the demand, it is vital that we bring in more people to help maintain and fine tune our systems, as well as make the push to bring the next phase of our vision into fruition.
 
Sustainable Growth & The Grander Vision
What we want to do.
A $100,000 will give us the start up capital to set up systems in all three major areas of our business. Once set up, these systems will grow and be able to sustain themselves.

The initial main goals for our Marketplace are:

To purchase and set up a POS system which will save us time and money by helping us manage and replace our inventory more accurately and efficiently.
Add the yarn lines from 6 of our most loved & 'unique to us' companies to our on-line store. We know these yarns will sell and these small companies will be given a substantial boost from our initial purchases. We'll reinvest the money from the yarn sales to replace inventory and to continue to add companies to our on-line store.

$57,500 invested in our Marketplace would be used as follows:

$1200 for our POS system.
$1000 to pay for help in adding our inventory to new system.
$8000 for 8 weeks of photographing, editing, and adding inventory to on-line store.
$47,300 to purchase inventory and rent a small heated space to store it.


 The initial main goals for our Classroom are:
Our beautiful classroom has never met its full potential. Doing so would require the focused attention of an employee who thrives on community outreach and is not involved with the daily workings of the shop.
$15,000 invested in our Classroom would be used as follows:

$10,000 to hire a part time Classroom Coordinator - up to 68 hours a month for a year with the objective being, that at the end of the year the classroom would begin to pay for itself, and we will be able to keep the Coordinator on staff.
$2500 for advertising, printing and other promotional costs.
$2500 for website maintenance, updating, and continued development.

If we go beyond our $100,000 goal, we will immediately begin the process of turning our classroom into a nonprofit. 

 
The initial main goals for our Retreats are:

Raise enough money to pay for our 'Getaway Retreat' in April 2018, and save the money brought in from this retreat to pay for the next one. As word spreads about how fun these are, and they grow, we will expand to two retreats a year.
Develop our 'Build your own Retreat' for individual groups throughout the year.

$27,500 invested in our Retreats would be used as follows:

$25,000 for 'Getaway Retreat'
$8154 - Teachers: includes teaching fees, travel, a place to stay, and some meals.
$2534 - Marketing: The more people we reach, the more people will sign up!
$4500 - Event Coordinator: She is invaluable in making our retreat run smoothly. She handles the details.
$4360 - Classrooms & event rooms at the Maritime Center
$3500 -  Caterer
$1452 Goody Bag Fillers and Door Prizes
$500 Bags
$2500 for development of 'Build Your Own Retreat'
$2500 for web development. We want people to be able to customize their retreat on-line.

Every penny we raise through this campaign will not only keep our community space and shop open, but will allow us to create sustainable systems to continue to offer our charity knits, free events, and community support. Thank you to everyone for joining this Crafting Revolution!

story:
DEAR PORTLAND, WE ARE...

 

NOTE: Even if we do not meet our funding goal we WILL be proceeding with this business. So for those of you who do donate, your funds will not go to waste! It will go straight into the business. This funding campaign will determine how many products we can offer to our costumers. For every $1,000 received we will be able to offer 2 more product options to our customers. 

Out of all industries why marijuana?

Well there's many reasons really:

  • We have a passion for cannabis! 

We are absolutely fascinated by the diversity and capabilities of cannabis. The big difference here is that we know how to utilize marijuana as a tool, NOT a crutch. We have the capability to do so because we have  gained the knowledge to identify different varieties, uses and even downfalls to its use. You can call us cannabis connoisseurs. We know what products are good for pain, mind expansion, physical stress relief, mental stress relief, and so much more. It is because of this that marijuana has changed our life and perception of it and we hope to share our amazing experience with others.

  • There are so many first time consumers!

This is exciting news! However, this also means people lack of education about cannabis. We've always been a big fan of growth through education.

We plan to educate a specific niche. If there is one thing that is lacking out there, it is a hands on teaching and interactive learning source that shows consumers how to use cannabis in an effective and safe manner. One of our MAIN goals for this business is to educate our community and we plan to offer consulting in the future to do so.

  • This industry is constantly and quickly changing!

Regulations, products, consumers and so many aspects of the industry are rapidly changing. While others may find this stressful, we thrive off the unexpected change, expansion and flexibility of the industry. Since the state is still figuring out their system to regulate the industry they are actually listening to the people of the industry! Man, is Oregon great! What does this mean for us? It means those of us in the industry right NOW have the capabilities to make an actual impact on the shape of the industry. We have the ability to set the standards and to uphold cannabis in a good name. This means absolute compliance with the law and trust me, we're too chicken to run our business otherwise. 

 

What We Need

We are looking at a start-up cost of at least $65,000. Each Co-owner has invested their own savings equaling to about $15,000. We don't expect the entire rest to be achieved though crowdfunding, So we are asking for a middle range of $25,000 to help us get the equipment, materials and inventory required for our business. 

Here's a breakdown of our expenses:

TOTAL START UP COST = $65,000

 

A BIG Thank You to the Amazing People of Portland!

We had a group of amazing people participate in this video. All of which advocated for the legalization of cannabis and are impacted in such positive ways because of it. We wanted to shoot these interviews casually (it can be really awkward being in-front of a video camera) and comfortably so people could express themselves freely and genuinely. 

We would also like to give a huge thank you to everyone who has supported us and supplied/let us borrow their stuff!  Doing small things that have contributed in cutting small costs here and there. They really do add up!

Last cheers to those who didn't have the money or material items to help us, but instead contributed their physical effort and time. We had a few friends design our logos, website, make small tenant improvement on our building, helped us clean, film, share our videos, and so much more! 

Seriously guys, we wouldn't have made it if it wasn't for you!

 

Song Credit

If anyone is interested in the super catchy song in the background of our video, check it out on SoundCloud or iTunes. The producer and singer (a Portlander as well) of the song are absolutely talented individuals! 

Album: 2226     Artist: sAewoo in YUNHWAY     Title: 밤바다 (Bambada)​     Singer: YUNHWAY

YouTube Channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC-fmwoADQdVkGhmrTc-xJDw

 

 

Want to see more and keep up with our progress?

 

Website: http://www.kush-cart.com

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/kushcart/

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/kush.cart

Twitter: https://twitter.com/KushCart_OR

YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC3HP0UpeE61CwJd__s0bmqA

Google+: https://plus.google.com/104934792111488995659

story:
Who Are Roses and the Stars?

After becoming an auntie for the first time as a 10-year-old girl, founder Rosie Jones has had 20 years of shopping for the perfect baby gift. Now after becoming an aunt to 11 nephews and nieces (and still counting!), as well as working for some of the world's top childrenswear stores, Rosie decided to set up Roses and the Stars, an online store selling gorgeous gifts for babies and their wonderful mums, a long-held dream and ambition.

Inspired by her own childhood in the English countryside, Rosie sources products which are reminiscent of the simpler childhood of times gone by, whether that be sourcing handmade teddy bears from the last remaining manufacturer in the UK, or creating clothing collections of classic designs, made of Liberty Print heritage fabrics.

Most importantly our products are sourced from sustainable sources and are produced by fair trade factories, cottage industry artisans or are made using items otherwise headed for the dump. At Roses and the Stars, we believe that the most important gift you can give a child is a future filled with hope where our responsibility to the Earth and it's people are taken seriously and are protected.

The 'doors' to our online store opened in September 2016 and now we are looking to build upon our initial success by popping up at as many events, markets and fairs as possible, so we can meet our customers and introduce them to the beautiful brands and services we provide through the website.

How Can You Help Us?

Firstly and most importantly we encourage you to share our story in any way you can, whether that be through social media or through chatting about our shop with others at the school gates. We know that it is not always possible to donate to these campaigns, even if you'd like to, but the power of word of mouth is truly amazing so we hope that you'll be able to do this even if you're unable to help in any other way.

Of course, we'd be delighted with any donations you can give to our cause! A full list of our donation gifts are on the side and explained below.

£20 - We will send you a personalised hand written thank you card with some branded stickers so you can help spread the word even further and be forever reminded of your good deed! We'll also send you a sweetie bag in one of our Roses and the Stars fabric bags. Perfect for munching at your desk or in the car!

£30 - as well as the gifts from the £20 donation, we'll also be giving you 10% off your next shop (even valid during sale time!) and a lifetime of free gift wrapping (normally £4 per order).

£50 - pick a silver necklace from our Rachel Jackson initials collection (Letters available on a first come first serve basis). 

£50 - pick a scented candle from our collection as well as get 10% off your next shop with us (again this is also valid during sale time!).

£100 - we'll give you £50 to spend in store, a lifetime of free gift wrapping AND a lifetime of free shipping on your orders.

£500 - we'll give you a Roses and the Stars baby bundle £100 credit to spend in store, with a lifetime of free gift wrapping and free shipping on your orders. The baby bundle is made up of your choice of:

Baby Record Book

Merrythought Teddy Bear

Muslin Swaddle

Hooded Towel

Scented Candle Gift Set

Organic Soap Bar

Organic Bath Salts

Press

story:
Veteran Owned Small Business

My name is David Qualls, and I am a Disabled Iraqi Freedom Veteran, I have spent over half  my life in the US Army, and now am attempting running a small CNC and Design Business.

My livelihood depends on my machines, the roof over my family's' heads, the food on our table, the heat in the winter.  They all depend on my ability to produce items in my shop with the machines; without which, we cannot pay our bills.  

The CNC Machine I use, is home made, and has served me well for quite a  few years, but as with many home made items, it has met it's shelf life.  The laser, was constructed using plans from Instructables, and has reached the end of it's life.

Your $10 or more contribution combined with the generosity of others, will allow me to purchase a new Laser Cutter.  I am not asking for a handout, but a hand up.  Your $10 will buy you a professionally made name plate for your desk, or your door.  These plates are much more expensive at your local trophy shop.  I use only the finest quality materials, and make sure that any work that comes from my shop is 100% professional and perfect.  If my name goes on it, you know the quality is second to none.

If you choose to make a larger donation, of course the product you are purchasing becomes larger.  With a CNC Laser, I can produce just about anything, if you can find a picture on Google Images, I can engrave it for you.  I use a mix of Corian, Acrylic, Wood, and High Density Urethane Foam.  The quality of the substrate is key to a professional product.

I have a choice of two quality industrial cutters. the AKJ6040 Laser which is an 80 watt laser, with a total working area of 600*400mm, that equals about 23 x 15 inch actual cutting area, for a list price of 2750.00, or the AKJ6080 Laser which is also an 80 watt laser, it just has a larger 600*900 or  23 x 35 inch working area, for 2950.00.

WHAT'S IN IF FOR YOU?

I can think of no better Christmas presents than personalized gifts.  I can engrave on stemware, Mugs and Drinking Glasses, Jewelry, Wooden Toys, Kitchenware, Tools, even customized iPhone and iPad cases, the list is infinite.

 

The Impact

Once again, without help to purchase a new machine, my business and income will be gone, every dime I get will go toward the purchase of the new equipment. 

Unable to give?

I understand times are tough, I am living proof of that.  But do not give up hope, you can help by spreading the word, maybe there is someone out there needing  a tax write off, it is that time of the year, or there is someone who is just feeling generous.  

Let everyone know  a Disabled Army Veteran needs a hand up.

Thank you for reading this, I hope I have convinced you that I am a hard working person who has fallen on a bit of bad luck, and I will continue to be a hard working person, one way or another.

Best wishes, 

CW2 David Qualls (ret.)

story:
Disclaimer: We are actually much goofier than we appear in the above video. (smiles)

We are Kasia Lojko and Sonia Farris. We started All Real Meal three years ago and over the years our team has expanded to include four employees, our husbands, Chip and Todd, and our six children, Luke, Ryan, Juliana, Nicholas, Jacinia, and Isabelle. We provide locally sourced, farm-to-table, real food to our community, and we're happy to present our super food creation: One Crust™ cauliflower pizza crust! 

One Crust™ is a 'first to the market' cauliflower pizza crust, developed using nutrient dense superfoods and locally sourced super fresh cauliflower. Produced from just cauliflower, flax, chia, almonds, coconut flour, olive oil, and our blend of seasonings. This crust is mega delicious, low carb, and super packed with Omega 3’s, phytonutrients, superior plant based protein, and fiber! One Crust™ has less than 4 carbs and only 207 high energy calories per serving. VEGAN . PALEO . GLUTEN FREE

  • Created by award-winning New Hampshire mompreneurs, Sonia Farris and Kasia Lojko, as part of their ALL REAL menu. One Crust™ is a SCRUMPTIOUS plant-based, low carb alternative to traditional pizza crust. 
  • After 3+ years bringing All Real Meal to New Hampshire, through our successful and self-funded start-up, we're ready to bring our MEGA YUMMY crust to everyone in the US (then global) market! 
  • WE NEED YOUR HELP to secure eco-friendly packaging, defray initial ingredients costs, hire a new All Real team member to help with shipping and production, and to assist with other start-up costs associated with moving into the nationwide home delivery and supermarket scene. 

Why One Crust™?

NOURISHMENT: The food that you eat is the most divine and basic self-care. We are providing high vibing food that will ENERGIZE you and help your body remain in harmony.

CREATIVITY: This crust is a blank canvas for your culinary creation! The process of preparing food promotes mindfulness, imagination, and bliss. We get you started, but ultimately you’re going to choose the fresh organic toppings to really bring this to life and design your own meal.

GIVING: Every crust is going to give back 10% to charities which benefit at-risk women and girls. YAY! We believe that determined women can become powerful agents of societal transformation within their communities when they are supported by strong ethical businesses, and we will build One Crust™ around giving back.  

Cauliflower crust is absolutely scrumptious and super good for you (less than 4 net carbs and only 207 calories per serving) but it is also difficult and time-consuming to prepare. With One Crust™ we take care of  the hard part and lovingly prepare your cauliflower crust, then you get a nourishing blank canvas for creating a superb meal! 

Customers of our little conscious company in New Hampshire LOVE this crust, but we NEED YOUR HELP to bring it outside our local delivery area and EVERYWHERE IN THE US!

BE ONE OF THE FIRST to try our high vibing flavorful VEGAN, PALEO, KETO, and GLUTEN FREE crust, then add your toppings and create the meal that YOU want, according to the way YOU eat.

Inspired by the passionate food communities that made our meal delivery business a success, One Crust™ is the star of your real food pizza party! Whether you’re vegan, paleo, keto, don’t eat gluten, don’t eat dairy, don’t eat GMO’s or just don’t eat anything that isn’t super yummy and satisfying…you will LOVE this crust! It is TRULY ‘One Crust’ for ALL. (oh and by the way, WE LOVE YOU!)

The 'ALL REAL' Movement + Conscious Entrepreneurship

We like to say, One Crust™ is for ALL OUR FELLOW HUMANS. Because everyone needs to eat. Right? Food is SOOOO IMPORTANT, and providing incredibly tasty fare, made of the best raw ingredients on earth is WHAT WE DO! We’ve been doing it for three years, and every day we hear from our customers how eating REAL is changing their lives.

With All Real Meal, we've committed to giving back to our local food bank, worthy charities, and nonprofits, from day one!  Even before we were making a profit, we found ways to use our little conscious company to give back. (PURE JOY!) We want to replicate what we've done so far, and use One Crust™ as a vehicle to give generously, and encourage others to do the same.

Image: Sean Hurley, NHPR

This isn't just about pizza. One Crust™ is about conscious eating AND conscious giving. How many people (or animals, trees, etc) will benefit when you purchase this pizza? The sky’s the limit! The more responsibly sourced vegan food (that is universally appealing) we can bring to the market, the better it is for the WHOLE PLANET. And our long-term vision is to help MILLIONS of people eat like they love themselves! Because when you EAT CONSCIOUSLY it trickles down into everything else you do and MAKES YOU BETTER. 

Our Goals

The next 3 months: In the 90 days following the close of the campaign we will continue securing the freshest naturally grown cauliflower, secure responsibly sourced packaging, and work with a local university to ensure crusts are preserved and super fresh upon delivery. We will hire a new team member or two to help us execute this launch flawlessly. We will create an effective packaging and shipping process, and Indiegogo pre-orders and perks will be fulfilled.

The next 12 months: In the next twelve months we will secure large-scale orders for our crust with local and nationwide grocery stores. We won't sleep until this happens! We will donate proceeds from the sale of One Crust™ as well as continue to research how to positively impact both our local and global community. 

The next 3 years: In the next three years we plan to expand beyond pizza crust and create similar All Real Meal™ products which follow the same formula: scrumptious, plant-based, grain free, high energy, and nutrient dense.  We are already experimenting with zucchini, spaghetti squash and sweet potatoes! We will continue to expand our ‘first to market’ creations and distribute with a commitment to provide funding to important charities, to source ingredients from small non-commercial farms, and to provide an envied and ethical work culture for our staff.

Current Progress

We have put a great deal of work into this project already, but WE NEED YOUR HELP TO TAKE THE NEXT STEP. We have the recipe perfected, the eco-packaging picked out, and our beautiful and fully licensed kitchen secured. In addition, we have had the crust available to our local meal delivery customers for several months. This has given us the opportunity to get loads of feedback and tweak the recipe a couple of times for optimum deliciousness. 

Risks & Challenges

It's ALWAYS a risk to start a new food business, and with this new direction will come new demands. We feel qualified to take on this challenge. 

Here's why:

All Real Meal™ started out as nothing more than an idea. The idea was that moms like us needed an affordable and convenient option for beautiful, non-GMO, fully cooked, meals delivered to your home. We had no culinary training, no funding, six children, husbands and day jobs to juggle while getting our company off the ground in an industry where most businesses fail. Three years later we've created an award-winning sustainable business that is debt free, gives back considerably to our local community and inspires conscious eating. How did we do it? We FELL IN LOVE with the demanding, exciting, educational, philanthropic life of entrepreneurship. Real food is our passion, but our MISSION is building a good-for-the-planet company in alignment with our values, unique gifts, and vision. One Crust™ is the next step! 

Your backing our campaign will provide us the capital to purchase responsibly sourced ingredients, to hire some more helpers and provide a proper wage, workman’s comp and insurance for said helpers, purchase packaging, pay for the testing necessary to provide accurate nutritional info, certifications for packaging, and to expand our web and e-commerce platform. In addition, it will help us to get professional assistance with accounting and legally protecting our company.

GET HOOKED UP!

As a thank you for backing our campaign, we're rolling out loads of fun perks! Be the first to get hooked up with One Crust™ and snag some 'REAL FOOD'  gear.  We have tees, tanks, aprons and bumper stickers, depending on your level of support. There are All Real Meal™ coupons for locals and shipped One Crust™ for those of you further away. Inspired by this campaign, we're even putting together an exclusive cookbook chock full of inspired recipes from our REAL FOOD kitchen. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We could really use some help to spread the word about All Real Meal™ and One Crust™. There are still a lot of people in the state and our local region who don’t know there’s a New Hampshire company making gluten free, mostly organic, locally sourced meals, desserts, and cauliflower pizza crust that can be delivered right to your door.

If you’re interested in finding out more information about All Real Meal we’re super easy to find online. If you type “real food New Hampshire” into google, we're the first to come up! We have been featured on NHPR, Business NH Magazine, New Hampshire Magazine, The Hippo, and more. 

Like 'allrealmeal' on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter for campaign updates. Better yet, come visit us in our commercial kitchen in Derry!  We’re so proud of it, and we love to show it off.

Thank you for purchasing, eating, cooking, and sharing our pizza crust and for your continued support. And thank you to all of our All Real Meal™ customers who have helped us get this far. We absolutely wouldn't be here without you!
story_txt:
Disclaimer: We are actually much goofier than we appear in the above video. (smiles)
We are Kasia Lojko and Sonia Farris. We started All Real Meal three years ago and over the years our team has expanded to include four employees, our husbands, Chip and Todd, and our six children, Luke, Ryan, Juliana, Nicholas, Jacinia, and Isabelle. We provide locally sourced, farm-to-table, real food to our community, and we're happy to present our super food creation: One Crust™ cauliflower pizza crust! 

One Crust™ is a 'first to the market' cauliflower pizza crust, developed using nutrient dense superfoods and locally sourced super fresh cauliflower. Produced from just cauliflower, flax, chia, almonds, coconut flour, olive oil, and our blend of seasonings. This crust is mega delicious, low carb, and super packed with Omega 3’s, phytonutrients, superior plant based protein, and fiber! One Crust™ has less than 4 carbs and only 207 high energy calories per serving. VEGAN . PALEO . GLUTEN FREE

Created by award-winning New Hampshire mompreneurs, Sonia Farris and Kasia Lojko, as part of their ALL REAL menu. One Crust™ is a SCRUMPTIOUS plant-based, low carb alternative to traditional pizza crust. 
After 3+ years bringing All Real Meal to New Hampshire, through our successful and self-funded start-up, we're ready to bring our MEGA YUMMY crust to everyone in the US (then global) market! 
WE NEED YOUR HELP to secure eco-friendly packaging, defray initial ingredients costs, hire a new All Real team member to help with shipping and production, and to assist with other start-up costs associated with moving into the nationwide home delivery and supermarket scene. 



Why One Crust™?
NOURISHMENT: The food that you eat is the most divine and basic self-care. We are providing high vibing food that will ENERGIZE you and help your body remain in harmony.
CREATIVITY: This crust is a blank canvas for your culinary creation! The process of preparing food promotes mindfulness, imagination, and bliss. We get you started, but ultimately you’re going to choose the fresh organic toppings to really bring this to life and design your own meal.
GIVING: Every crust is going to give back 10% to charities which benefit at-risk women and girls. YAY! We believe that determined women can become powerful agents of societal transformation within their communities when they are supported by strong ethical businesses, and we will build One Crust™ around giving back.  
Cauliflower crust is absolutely scrumptious and super good for you (less than 4 net carbs and only 207 calories per serving) but it is also difficult and time-consuming to prepare. With One Crust™ we take care of  the hard part and lovingly prepare your cauliflower crust, then you get a nourishing blank canvas for creating a superb meal! 
Customers of our little conscious company in New Hampshire LOVE this crust, but we NEED YOUR HELP to bring it outside our local delivery area and EVERYWHERE IN THE US!
BE ONE OF THE FIRST to try our high vibing flavorful VEGAN, PALEO, KETO, and GLUTEN FREE crust, then add your toppings and create the meal that YOU want, according to the way YOU eat.
Inspired by the passionate food communities that made our meal delivery business a success, One Crust™ is the star of your real food pizza party! Whether you’re vegan, paleo, keto, don’t eat gluten, don’t eat dairy, don’t eat GMO’s or just don’t eat anything that isn’t super yummy and satisfying…you will LOVE this crust! It is TRULY ‘One Crust’ for ALL. (oh and by the way, WE LOVE YOU!)

The 'ALL REAL' Movement + Conscious Entrepreneurship
We like to say, One Crust™ is for ALL OUR FELLOW HUMANS. Because everyone needs to eat. Right? Food is SOOOO IMPORTANT, and providing incredibly tasty fare, made of the best raw ingredients on earth is WHAT WE DO! We’ve been doing it for three years, and every day we hear from our customers how eating REAL is changing their lives.
With All Real Meal, we've committed to giving back to our local food bank, worthy charities, and nonprofits, from day one!  Even before we were making a profit, we found ways to use our little conscious company to give back. (PURE JOY!) We want to replicate what we've done so far, and use One Crust™ as a vehicle to give generously, and encourage others to do the same.


Image: Sean Hurley, NHPR
This isn't just about pizza. One Crust™ is about conscious eating AND conscious giving. How many people (or animals, trees, etc) will benefit when you purchase this pizza? The sky’s the limit! The more responsibly sourced vegan food (that is universally appealing) we can bring to the market, the better it is for the WHOLE PLANET. And our long-term vision is to help MILLIONS of people eat like they love themselves! Because when you EAT CONSCIOUSLY it trickles down into everything else you do and MAKES YOU BETTER.

We will hire a new team member or two to help us execute this launch flawlessly. We will create an effective packaging and shipping process, and Indiegogo pre-orders and perks will be fulfilled.

We will continue to expand our ‘first to market’ creations and distribute with a commitment to provide funding to important charities, to source ingredients from small non-commercial farms, and to provide an envied and ethical work culture for our staff.

Current Progress
We have put a great deal of work into this project already, but WE NEED YOUR HELP TO TAKE THE NEXT STEP. We have the recipe perfected, the eco-packaging picked out, and our beautiful and fully licensed kitchen secured. In addition, we have had the crust available to our local meal delivery customers for several months. This has given us the opportunity to get loads of feedback and tweak the recipe a couple of times for optimum deliciousness. 

Risks & Challenges
It's ALWAYS a risk to start a new food business, and with this new direction will come new demands. We feel qualified to take on this challenge. 
Here's why:
All Real Meal™ started out as nothing more than an idea. The idea was that moms like us needed an affordable and convenient option for beautiful, non-GMO, fully cooked, meals delivered to your home. We had no culinary training, no funding, six children, husbands and day jobs to juggle while getting our company off the ground in an industry where most businesses fail. Three years later we've created an award-winning sustainable business that is debt free, gives back considerably to our local community and inspires conscious eating. How did we do it? We FELL IN LOVE with the demanding, exciting, educational, philanthropic life of entrepreneurship. Real food is our passion, but our MISSION is building a good-for-the-planet company in alignment with our values, unique gifts, and vision. One Crust™ is the next step!

story:
What Is Impact Hub Harare All About

So you’ve heard all the stories about Zimbabwe, right? Bond notes... The ridiculously high inflation from the years passed…and the unstable political situation of course. Not to mention all of the usual chatter about how it was once the bread basket of Africa and became a basket-case just a couple of decades later.

Well…this is a different story. This is one about the people and the incredible resilience they have. It’s about their creativity, their drive and their passion. It’s about a small group of Zimbabweans who see the negative headlines as a call to action. For this group the status quo is no longer a comfort zone but a burden.

Impact Hub Harare is the oasis. This is where the change-makers of Zimbabwe are coming together to build the entrepreneurial ecosystem from the ground up. However, in order for that to happen Impact Hub needs a little nudge to kick it into the gear of sustainability.

Help us to launch Impact Hub Harare!

Why Do We Need The Money 

We need your help to "hack the hub". We will use the money to find a new and unique space for social entrepreneurs, intrapreneurs and changemakers to get the support they need to get their initiative to the next level. We plan to make sure that everyone in Zimbabwe hears about the hub and knows that they can go there if they want to make a difference. We will be visiting the highlands and lowlands of the country to see what the change-makers of Zimbabwe need and how the hub can help them to achieve their goals. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Help us to get the word out about Impact Hub Harare and the oasis that is being created. Share the campaign video and ask your networks to visit our website: www.impacthubharare.net

story:
About Spendefy: 

Spendefy is an Atlanta-based tech company founded by Antwon Davis and Eldredge E. Washington. We’ve built a platform to leverage the power of consumerism for economic and social good. After observing the ongoing lack of support for black-owned businesses in Atlanta and around the country, our team began to erect a plan to build solidarity between black-owned businesses and conscious consumers. We believe supporting local black-owned businesses is one way we can all contribute to making our communities better. We believe Spendefy will bring awareness and exposure for amazing black-owned businesses around the US.

 

 

What People Are Saying:

I can't say it enough: Spendefy @Spendefy https://t.co/uEhV7qfc5a. SPENDEFY!!!!! https://t.co/Coiex8FiDy

— Karen Hunter (@karenhunter) August 8, 2016

#BuyBlack ? Spendefy will help you do just that! Check it out! #blackbusiness #finances #money #spendefy #blackout https://t.co/EEU0FFFEji

— MadameNoire (@MadameNoire) August 17, 2016

I am thankful for @Spendefy today!

— Dr. Hadiyah Green (@drhadiyahgreen) November 24, 2016

Virtual Black Wall Street! I am in! https://t.co/yBpOSVyuAw

— Connie Moran (@Csmoran378) November 21, 2016

Christians are needed more than ever at the epicenter of economic development. @AntwonDavis @Spendefy #gdesummit #entrepreneur

— Gospel Driven Ent. (@gospeldrivenent) September 22, 2016

 

 

Why We Need Your Help:

Since January 1, 2016, Spendefy has been able to help thousands of people discover, connect and support amazing black-owned businesses in their city. Although we have been recognized on several national platforms - including, but not limited to, CNN, Black Enterprise, Ebony, Rolling Out Magazine, and many more - we are still only available in Georgia and New York. In order for us to go to the next level and truly begin to make an economic impact in our community, we must expand immediately. 

As a black-owned tech startup, much like many black-owned businesses, it has been a challenge to gain capital/funding. We are asking you if you would like to be part of the collective to help us succeed the same way we want all black businesses to succeed. $55,000 will not only help us expand nationwide, but it will also help us finalize and release our app. The app will be released on the iPhone first and then Android.

 

 

Two of the biggest requests we receive every day from business owners and consumers are:

#1. When will the Spendefy App launch?

#2. When will Spendefy be nationwide?

Well, we are officially prepared to make both of those requests happen in 2017. But we cannot do it without YOUR help! We are crowdfunding to develop and launch our app, and to expand Spendefy to cities across America.

 

 

What Happens When We Win?

Once we reach our goal, the wait will finally be over!  No longer will you have to struggle to find black-owned businesses in your city. We are going to create technology that will bridge the gap and connect local black-owned businesses to consumers all over America. Starting February 2017, we will launch our new app and make Spendefy available in a new state every month. This cannot happen without your contribution. You can see what cities we will be expanding to in 2017 below. 

 

2017 Expansion: 

Miami, FL

Orlando, FL

Charlotte, NC

Washington DC

Memphis, TN

Newark, NJ

Philadelphia, PA

Boston, MA

Detroit, MI

Chicago, IL

St. Louis, MO

Dallas, TX

Houston, TX

LA, CA

Oakland, CA

San Fransisco, CA

 

 

3 Ways To Get Involved! 

 

1. Make a Financial Contribution! There is no contribution to small. Collectively, we can reach our goal in no time. Please consider backing us by choosing to be a Fan, Supporter, Friend, Family, Advocate, Partner or Honorary Founder - and in return, we will give you some cool perks to show our appreciation. 

 

2. Spread The Word! This is something that EVERYONE in the community can be a part of. Please share this campaign with all of your friends, family, co-workers, church members, classmates, etc. We are asking that everyone commit to getting at least 3 people to contribute with you! 

 

3. Contribute Again! After you give your contribution, please check back in and see how we are doing. If possible, please consider giving again to help us reach this goal. Failure is not an option because together, NOTHING can stop us.
