The T-Shirt!

(Contribution of $50 or more.  Choose standard or girly-cut.)

story:
OUR CAMPAIGN ENDS TOMORROW! EVERY BIT COUNTS! ANY AMOUNT MAKES A DIFFERENCE!

Women on the Rise Needs Your Help! 

Women on the Rise has been helping new immigrants in the NDG community for almost twenty-four years.  Our mission is to help mothers to help themselves by providing educational and female empowerment programs to help women succeed.

Our clients are single parent families where the mothers are vulnerable and/or lacking in financial resources and who possess a limited formal education. Some of our mothers have been in abusive relationships, have endured traumatic experiences or have mental illness  our families are in need of our support.
We work with the mothers to rehabilitate them back into the work force or return to school. The children aged newborn to five partake in a structured program that prepares them for kindergarden. 

L'Envol des Femmes à besoin de votre aide!

L'Envol des Femmes aide les nouveaux immigrants dans la communauté de Notre-Dame-de-Grâce (NDG) depuis presque 24 ans. Notre mission est d'aider les mères à s’aider soi-même en offrant des programmes éducatifs et d'autonomisation pour aider ses femmes à réussir.


Nos clients sont des familles monoparentales où les mères sont vulnérables et/ou manquent de ressources financières et qui possèdent peu d’éducation. Certaines de nos mères ont été dans des relations abusives, ont enduré des expériences traumatisantes ou ont une maladie mentale - mais toutes nos familles ont besoin de notre soutien. Nous travaillons avec ces mères afin qu’elles puissent réintégrer le marché du travail ou retourner aux études. Les enfants âgés de zéro à cinq ans participent à un programme structuré qui les prépare à l'école maternelle.

Help Us Keep Our Doors Open!

Women on the Rise makes a difference to over forty families every year, and now we need your help. Presently operating in a deficit we need $5,000 to bridge a funding gap and keep our doors open. Our vulnerable clients would be devastated and suffer the most if we had to close our doors due to lack of funds. 

In addition to attending workshops on parenting, our families receive a hot nutritious meal and for some this is their only hot meal of the day. The children attend classes in school readiness by our dedicated staff of Early Childhood Educators.

Help us help every mother and child who enters our doors to have a hot nutritious meal and provide the skills they need to succeed. A recent survey revealed that 30% of families in NDG are living below the poverty line. Scientific research shows that the lack of provision not only negatively impacts physical development but also emotional and educational health.

When a child is being given a meal, he or she is being given an opportunity to be nourished, to feel safe and focus on learning. Our children only have one chance at their early education. It is all our jobs to ensure they get the best chance.

Aider nous à garder nos portes ouvertes! 

L'Envol des Femmes apporte une différence à plus de quarante familles chaque année, et maintenant nous avons besoin de votre aide. Nous fonctionnons actuellement avec un déficit et nous avons besoin de $5000 afin de combler ce déficit de financement et ainsi garder nos portes ouvertes. Nos clients vulnérables seront dévastés et souffriront le plus si nous devons fermer nos portes à cause des manques de fonds.

En plus de participer à des ateliers sur le rôle parental, nos familles reçoivent un repas chaud et nutritif et pour certains, il s’agit de leur seul repas chaud de la journée. Les enfants sont éduqués comme dans les enseignements préscolaires par notre personnel dévoué d’éducateur de la petite enfance. 

Aidez-nous afin d’aider chaque mère et chaque enfant qui entre dans nos portes afin qu’ils puissent avoir un repas chaud et nutritif pour ainsi avoir les compétences dont ils ont besoin pour réussir. Une enquête récente a révélé que 30% des familles de NDG vivent en dessous du seuil de pauvreté. Cette recherche scientifique montre que l'absence de provision a non seulement un impact négatif sur le développement physique, mais aussi sur la santé émotionnelle et éducative.

Quand un enfant reçoit un repas, il ou elle à l'occasion de se nourrir, se sentir en sécurité et de se concentrer sur l'apprentissage. Nos enfants n’ont qu'une seule chance à leur éducation préscolaire. C’est notre devoir de nous assurer qu'ils obtiennent les meilleures opportunités.

story:
Who We Are

After almost a two month battle in the hospital, Faith Anne Imfeld passed away on December 23rd, 2012 due to complications from Cystic Fibrosis. She was only 13 years old. Faith's aunt, Audrey, and her cousin, Lauren, (both digital artists) were asked to create a slide show of Faith to play at her memorial service. While working late into the evening to prepare for the service, they wondered how they could use their creative talents to help the family in their grieving process. This is when the idea behind Faith's Gift was born. They worked to portray an image of Faith in eternity, with Jesus, pictured below.


Faith's family was filled with many emotions upon viewing the portrait of Faith with Jesus. The strongest emotion that came over them was hope...thus, Portraits of Hope.

Faith's Gift is owned and operated by Audrey Imfeld and Gretchen Imfeld, Faith's mom and Audrey's sister-in-law. A couple years of healing from the loss of Faith, Audrey and Gretchen were discussing ways to help other families in their grieving process. After a lot of prayer and contemplation, the decision was made to create Faith's Gift, which is a digital drawing or painting of Jesus embracing anyone who has passed on, in His arms.

Our mission is to reach the hearts of those that are grieving, and help provide a vision and portrait of hope of their loved one.

What We Need and What You Get

Our goal is to raise enough funds to promote Faith’s Gift to the nation and eventually the world.  Part of every offering will go toward our "pay it forward" fund for those that cannot afford a portrait on their own. 

*Perks: All contributors will be recognized on our sponsor page.

*With a $25.00 donation, receive a "Faith's Gift" window cling


*With a $50.00 donation, receive a "Faith" hand made bracelet.


*With a $100.00 or more donation, receive a custom Faith's Gift  T-shirt. We are proud to announce that we have a very talented local artist who has created a limited edition design for us!  Please specify style you would like.

Impact

Your contribution will go toward helping  grieving individuals or families in a new and creative way that has never been offered before. 

We all have personally experienced, or know someone who has experienced loss and the magnitude of grief that can overwhelm those left behind. Your contribution will help us promote an art piece that will provide comfort to those in the midst of their grief.

Risks and Challenges

We have studied the obstacles and the inability others have had to fund their marketing needs, however, within our circles of influence, we have had nothing but positive feedback about the idea of Faith’s Gift. 

Audrey is a successful small business owner, with over 10 years experience of a profitable photography studio. Gretchen brings years of successful experience in development and marketing to the team.  With the combination of our team and your contributions, we can obtain our initial and long term goals.

Other Ways You Can Help:

If you like our vision, but can not contribute financially, we would still appreciate your prayers and sharing our idea with others. Check out our website and Facebook page listed below, and point others in our direction. Don’t forget, you can share our campaign through our share button on Indiegogo. 

| www.faithsgift.com | https://www.facebook.com/faithsgifts2?fref=ts&n...

Who We Are
After
almost a two month battle in the hospital, Faith Anne Imfeld passed away on December 23rd, 2012 due to complications from Cystic Fibrosis. She was only 13 years old.
Faith's aunt, Audrey, and her cousin, Lauren, (both digital artists) were asked to
create a slide show of Faith to play at her memorial service. While
working late into the evening to prepare for the service, they wondered how they
could use their creative talents to help the family in their grieving process. This

story:
Click here for the English version of our pitch text!

        "La démocratie est le pire des régimes à l'exception de tous les autres!"

Winston Churchill devant la Chambre des Communes le 11 Novembre 1947.

Mais la démocratie suppose un processus électoral qui respecte les cinq éléments essentiels que sont 

                             la confidentialité, 

                                       l'anonymat, 

                                                 la sincérité, 

                                                            l'unicité 

                                                                      la transparence. 

Il faut que l'électeur ait confiance dans le mode de scrutin. Que celui-ci ne semble pas entaché d'irrégularités, de fraudes, d'erreurs. Que le délai entre la fin du scrutin et la proclamation des résultats soit le plus faible possible afin de couper court à d'éventuelles rumeurs de manipulations. 

Nous sommes des citoyens, de simples électeurs comme vous. Nous sommes choqués par les fraudes avérées ou suspectées qui apparaissent à chaque élection, quel que soit le pays, ou par les délais nécessaires pour compter et recompter encore des bulletins dont le nombre ne correspond pas au nombre de votes émis...

Nous avons inventé HANNIBAL® pour offrir à chacun un outil fiable, économique et rapide, pour que chacun ait confiance dans le scrutin. 

HANNIBAL® utilise la technologie mondialement éprouvée de la lecture des codes barres. Un flash code QRCode est un langage universel, un alphabet lisible par n'importe quel lecteur de code barres. 

HANNIBAL® va simplement lire le code barres imprimé au verso du bulletin, l'enregistrer pendant que le bulletin est stocké dans l'urne et donner un résultat ordonné à l'ouverture de l'urne en réalisant un véritable dépouillement automatique. 

Sans intelligence, sans programmation, ne délivrant qu'un résultat brut sans transformation, le système ne peut être piraté. 

Sa simplicité le rend extrêmement robuste et fiable. 

Il est le pilier sur lequel peut se construire une véritable démocratie.

Nous avons besoin de chacun de vous pour nous aider à fabriquer et distribuer ce nouveau concept, mais surtout pour le promouvoir. Parlez en autour de vous. Interpellez vos représentants, les responsables politiques, professionnels, syndicaux. 

Hannibal® est également utile dans les élections professionnelles.

Cet outil ne change pas les habitudes de vote, mais est une telle innovation, et dans un domaine tellement sensible, que seul le nombre de citoyens intéressés pourra le faire adopter par les organisateurs. 

D'avance Merci.


HANNIBAL® repose sur trois éléments principaux:

1- LE BULLETIN DE VOTE

Un bulletin de vote normal, uninominal, sur lequel est écrit en toutes lettres le nom du candidat ou de la liste candidate au recto.

Ce bulletin est pré-plié afin de faciliter sa bonne introduction dans l'enveloppe par l'électeur.

Au verso est imprimé le code barres que l'urne va enregistrer comme étant un vote pour Victor HUGO. Le nom est noyé dans le nom des autres candidats afin d'obtenir un code barres peu identifiable à l'œil nu pour préserver la confidentialité du vote au cas où le code barres était subrepticement aperçu par un observateur.


                                                                      


2- L'ENVELOPPE

De taille adaptée au bulletin plié en deux, elle présente une fenêtre masquée par un volet sur sa face avant.

                      


L'enveloppe ne permet pas de connaitre son contenu et donc respecte la confidentialité du vote.

En relevant le volet, on aperçoit le code barres du candidat choisi par l'électeur:

                        


3- L'URNE:

Elle se présente comme une urne traditionnelle, dans ses dimensions et son apparence. En France, la transparence en est un caractère obligatoire depuis le 1er Janvier 1991. Pour d'autres pays, la couleur est codifiée ainsi que son opacité: Hannibal est facilement adaptable aux contingences locales.
Nous avons travaillé son design afin d'essayer de transmettre une idée de force, de stabilité mais également de dynamique. Nous espérons que c'est ainsi que vous la percevez!

                                                                   Urne de profil

                                                                 Urne de face
Sous le couvercle est fixé une boite contenant un lecteur de code barres, un système de rouleaux asservis, une mémoire permanente, un écran supérieur indiquant le nombre de votes enregistrés par l'urne (et donc le nombre d'enveloppes présentes dans l'urne), une zone résistive sur le dessus permettant d'enclencher l'avancement de l'enveloppe et un écran tactile en dessous, accessible uniquement quand l'urne est ouverte.

Urne en début de scrutin, mémoires vides, prête à recevoir les votes, vue du dessus


DÉROULEMENT DU SCRUTIN

L'électeur prend les bulletins présentés pré-pliés au bureau des scrutateurs qui contrôlent son identité et son habilitation à voter.
Dans le secret de l'isoloir, l'électeur choisit son bulletin, le plie en deux, codes barres à l'extérieur et l'introduit dans l'enveloppe.

                                               

Il introduit son enveloppe dans l'urne. Le scrutateur enclenche, par contact sur la zone résistive, l'admission de l'enveloppe par les rouleaux.

                           


                           


Un système mécanique simple soulève le volet juste avant son admission dans l'urne, découvrant ainsi le code barres visible à travers la fenêtre de l'enveloppe.
Le lecteur de code barres lit ce code et enregistre le ou les noms compris entre deux signes. Si jamais il n'arrivait pas à les lire pour une quelconque raison, l'enveloppe serait recrachée et le scrutateur devrait la rendre à l'électeur et inviter ce dernier à recommencer le processus de vote.

                                    


L'enveloppe poursuit sa route et est stockée pour un éventuel comptage manuel ultérieur (suite à une défaillance technique par exemple). Le compteur supérieur s'incrémente d'un.
A la clôture du scrutin, décidée par le président du bureau de vote, l'ouverture de l'urne bloque le système et empêche tout traitement ultérieur de bulletins de vote pirate.
L'allumage de l'écran interne permet d'accéder aux résultats, c'est à dire au nombre de fois que le lecteur a pu enregistrer chaque série de caractères. Les résultats sont présentés sous forme d'un tableau.

Le résultat est disponible immédiatement, sans doute ni erreur possibles!


Un lecteur avec écran  et sortie audio est en cours de développement. 

Tout électeur n'ayant pas de smartphone équipé d'une application de lecture de code barres peut ainsi vérifier que le code barres imprimé au verso correspond bien à son choix écrit au verso et empêche une tricherie éventuelle à l'impression des bulletins. 

Il est également équipé d'une sortie audio (casque) dont l'utilisation éteint l'écran. Ainsi, il permet aux citoyens ayant des difficultés à lire (mal-voyance, illettrisme etc...) de pouvoir choisir son bulletin en toute confidentialité. 

Même si son handicap l'oblige à recourir à une aide extérieure, celle-ci ne connaitra pas le choix du votant. 

L'handicapé est enfin traité avec le même respect que le valide. 

Sa dignité et sa liberté sont respectées.


English

HANNIBAL, 

the ballot you can trust !



'Democracy is the worst form of government, except all those other forms that have been tried from time to time.'

-Winston Churchill to the House of Commons,11th November 1947

But a prerequisite of democracy is an electoral process which safeguards the essential elements of the ballot.

It must be

              Confidential

                     Anonymous

                            Tamper-proof

                                      Transparent

                                                'One man, one vote'.

The voter must have confidence in the count. It should not be tainted with irregularity, error or fraud, and should minimise delay between the close of voting and the declaration of the result to prevent rumours of manipulation.

 We in 2Blokes are appalled by stories of actual or suspected irregularities which can occur in elections in any country, and by the delays caused by the need to count and recount ballot papers which do not correspond with the number of votes cast. We have invented HANNIBAL to provide a reliable, fast and economic means of ensuring confidence in the ballot.

HANNIBAL uses worldwide approved barcode reading technology. QRCode is a universal barcode language recognised by all barcode readers. 

HANNIBAL simply reads barcodes printed on the ballot-paper, records them as the ballot-paper is inserted into the ballot-box, and delivers the required result when the ballot-box is opened – true automatic scrutiny! 

The system can't be interfered with – no skill, no programming, delivering only the raw result without frills. Its very simplicity makes it both robust and reliable.

We need all of you to help us manufacture and distribute this new concept, and especially to promote it. 

Discuss it amongst yourselves, talk to your parliamentary representatives, to people involved in politics, to professional organisations, to trades unions. HANNIBAL doesn't change voting patterns, but it's such a new concept in such a sensitive area that only demand from those involved can bring about it's adoption.

Thank you in advance!


HANNIBAL is comprised of three main elements

1.  The ballot paper

A normal ballot paper, on the front of which is printed a single candidate's name with his corresponding barcode on the back

                   

It is pre-folded for ease of insertion by the voter into an envelope which contains a window corresponding to the barcode on the ballot paper.

                                                                     

The barcode which the ballot box will read contains all the candidates' names or a long sentence. The selected name barcode is thus not distinguishable to the eye of a surreptitious observer, and preserves the confidentiality of the ballot. Only the selected candidate being identified by a # sign before, and a * sign after the name will be recorded by Hannibal.

  2. The envelope

The envelope is large enough to take the ballot paper folded in half and contains a window in front protected by a flap, so that its contents are kept confidential. 

                               

When the flap is lifted the barcode of the selected candidate can be read.

                               


  3. The ballot box

Its shape, size and aspect are made similar to the ones used in the country. For example the french model, in which transparency is obligatory since 1991.

 

                                Ballot box in profile

                                                           

                                                                                         Ballot box from the front

Under the cover is a box containing the barcode reader, a system of driven rollers, a permanent memory, an upper screen indicating the number of votes cast and thus the number of envelopes contained by the box, a resistive area on the top enabling the envelope to be drawn into the box, and a touch screen below which is only accessible when the box is opened.

Ballot box from above: at the start of voting, memories clear, ready to receive votes.


Ballot procedure

The voter is given pre-folded ballot papers by the scrutinizers who check his identity and that he is registered to vote. In the privacy of the voting booth, the voter selects the ballot paper containing the name of the candidate he wishes to vote for, folds it in two with the barcode on the outside and places it in the envelope.

                                                 


He inserts the envelope in the ballot box. The envelope is drawn into the box by a scrutinizer using the resistive area to activate the rollers.

A simple mechanical system raises the window flap as the envelope is drawn into the box, revealing the barcode now visible through the window.


The barcode reader reads the code and records the name or names marked by the # and * signs.

If the reader can't read the barcode, the envelope is regurgitated, and the scrutinizer returns it to the voter so that he can repeat his vote.

The upper screen records an increment of one vote, and the envelope is stored in case a physical count is required later (for example in the case of a technical breakdown).

                                     

When the ballot closes and the box is opened the system is automatically blocked, and cannot accept further ballot papers i.e. irregular votes.

The activation of the lower touch screen gives access to the results, that is the number of times that the barcode reader has recorded each series of characters. The results are displayed in tabular form


The result is immediately available, incontestable and free from error.


A barcode reader equipped with a screen and headset 

is in course of development to enable a voter who has not got a smartphone equipped with a barcode reader app, to check that the barcode registered by the box truly corresponds with his choice of candidate(s). This controls and should avoid the possibility of fraudulent printing of the ballot paper. It will also be equipped with an audio socket, and when the earpiece is plugged in, the screen will switch off. Thus voters who are illiterate or have difficulty reading can make a completely confidential choice.

Even if the voter requires assistance from a third party, the voter's choice will not be disclosed. 

The disabled are treated with the same respect as the able-bodied.

Their dignity and their liberty are safeguarded.


The Team:


 Franck PROUX, DVM, Inventor, co-designer

I was awarded my doctorate in veterinary science by Toulouse university in 1990,and for the last 25 years have practised veterinary medicine and surgery, most recently close to Rouen (France, 76). As was the case with Docteur Klein, famous french Doctor in Veterinary Medicine, “animals made a man of me”. I'm father to four boys, a man of tomorrow's world, and it was with their future in mind that I invented Hannibal with the aid of my colleague and friend Pascal MARALDO, in the hope that it would standardise the democratic process the world over. Thank you for your support!


 Pascal MARALDO, co-designer

I am graduated from the "Trade Chamber of Paris", manager of several compagnies since 1988, I work now near Blois (France, 41). I have invented and co-designed the DAPI (Detections of anomaly on lonely work station). I have always been involved in security of goods and people. HANNIBAL is my best project. Like my friend Franck, I am the father of 4 children and I am concerned for the respect of their dreams and convictions. Thank you for becoming with us the guardian of their rights.


This project would have never been able to come to life without our super team of involved and skilled engineers. Thank you

Jean Michel BAERT

 Denis DOUBREMELLE
  Olivier GRENIER

Le résultat est disponible immédiatement, sans doute ni erreur possibles!


Un lecteur avec écran  et sortie audio est en cours de développement. 
Tout électeur n'ayant pas de smartphone équipé d'une application de lecture de code barres peut ainsi vérifier que le code barres imprimé au verso correspond bien à son choix écrit au verso et empêche une tricherie éventuelle à l'impression des bulletins. 
Il est également équipé d'une sortie audio (casque) dont l'utilisation éteint l'écran. Ainsi, il permet aux citoyens ayant des difficultés à lire (mal-voyance, illettrisme etc...) de pouvoir choisir son bulletin en toute confidentialité. 
Même si son handicap l'oblige à recourir à une aide extérieure, celle-ci ne connaitra pas le choix du votant. 
L'handicapé est enfin traité avec le même respect que le valide. 
Sa dignité et sa liberté sont respectées.

English

HANNIBAL, 
the ballot you can trust !





'Democracy
is the worst form of government, except
all those other forms that have been tried from time to time.'
-Winston Churchill to the House of Commons,11th
November 1947

But a prerequisite of democracy is an
electoral process which safeguards the essential elements of the ballot.
It must be 
               Confidential
                     Anonymous
                            Tamper-proof
                                      Transparent
                                                'One man, one vote'.

The voter must have confidence in the
count. It should not be tainted with irregularity, error or fraud, and should
minimise delay between the close of voting and the declaration of the result to
prevent rumours of manipulation.

 We in 2Blokes are appalled by stories of actual or suspected
irregularities which can occur in elections in any country, and by the delays
caused by the need to count and recount ballot papers which do not correspond
with the number of votes cast. We have invented HANNIBAL to provide a reliable,
fast and economic means of ensuring confidence in the ballot.

HANNIBAL uses worldwide approved barcode
reading technology. QRCode is a universal barcode language recognised by all
barcode readers. 
HANNIBAL simply reads barcodes printed on the ballot-paper,
records them as the ballot-paper is inserted into the ballot-box, and delivers
the required result when the ballot-box is opened – true automatic scrutiny! 
The system can't be interfered with – no skill, no programming, delivering only
the raw result without frills. Its very simplicity makes it both robust and
reliable. 

We need all of you to help us manufacture
and distribute this new concept, and especially to promote it. 
Discuss it
amongst yourselves, talk to your parliamentary representatives, to people
involved in politics, to professional organisations, to trades unions. HANNIBAL
doesn't change voting patterns, but it's such a new concept in such a sensitive
area that only demand from those involved can bring about it's adoption.

Thank you in advance! 

HANNIBAL is comprised of three main
elements
1. 
The ballot paper

A normal ballot paper, on the front of which
is printed a single candidate's name with his corresponding barcode on the
back

                   

It is pre-folded for ease of insertion by
the voter into an envelope which contains a window corresponding to the barcode
on the ballot paper.

                                                                     
The barcode which the ballot box will
read contains all the candidates' names or a long sentence. The selected name barcode is thus not distinguishable to the eye of a surreptitious observer, and preserves the confidentiality of the ballot. Only the selected candidate being
identified by a # sign before, and a * sign after the name will be recorded by Hannibal.
  2. The envelope

The envelope is large enough to take the ballot paper folded in half
and contains a window  in front protected
by a flap, so that its contents are kept confidential. 

                               
When the flap is  lifted the barcode of the selected candidate
can be read.

                               

  3. The ballot box


Its shape, size and aspect are made similar to the ones used in the country. For example the french model, in which transparency is obligatory since 1991.

 
                                Ballot box in profile

                                                            
                                                                                         Ballot box from the front
Under the cover is a box containing the barcode reader, a system of
driven rollers, a  permanent memory, an
upper screen indicating the number of votes cast and thus the  number of envelopes contained by the box, a
resistive area on the top enabling the envelope  to be drawn into the box, and a touch screen below which is only
accessible when the box is  opened.


Ballot
box from above: at
the start of voting, memories clear, ready to receive votes.

 Ballot
procedure
 The
voter is given pre-folded ballot papers by the scrutinizers who check his
identity and  that he is registered to
vote. In the privacy of the voting booth, the voter selects the ballot  paper containing the name of the candidate he
wishes to vote for, folds it in two with the  barcode
on the outside and places it in the envelope.

                                                 
He inserts the envelope in the
ballot  box. The envelope is drawn into
the box by a scrutinizer using the resistive area to activate  the rollers.
 A
simple mechanical system raises the window flap as the envelope is drawn into
the box,  revealing the barcode now
visible through the window.





The barcode reader reads the code and
records the name or names marked by the # and * signs.
 If
the reader can't read the barcode, the envelope is regurgitated, and the scrutinizer
returns it  to the voter so that he can
repeat his vote.
 The
upper screen records an increment of one vote, and the envelope is stored in
case a  physical count is required later
(for example in the case of a technical breakdown).

                                      
 When
the ballot closes and the box is opened the system is automatically blocked,
and  cannot accept further ballot papers
i.e. irregular votes.
 The
activation of the lower touch screen gives access to the results, that is the
number of  times that the barcode reader
has recorded each series of characters. The results are  displayed in tabular form




 The
result is immediately available, incontestable and free from error.

 A
barcode reader equipped with a screen and headset 
is in course of development to enable a
voter who
has not got a smartphone equipped with a barcode reader app, to check that the  barcode registered by the box truly corresponds
with his choice of candidate(s). This controls and should  avoid
the possibility of fraudulent printing of the ballot paper. It will also be
equipped with  an audio socket, and when
the earpiece is plugged in, the screen will switch off. Thus voters  who are illiterate or have difficulty reading
can make a completely confidential choice.
 Even
if the voter requires assistance from a third party, the voter's choice will
not be  disclosed. 
The disabled are
treated with the same respect as the able-bodied.
 Their
dignity and their liberty are safeguarded.

The Team:



 Franck PROUX, DVM, Inventor, co-designer
I was awarded my doctorate in veterinary
science by Toulouse university in 1990,and for the last 25 years have practised
veterinary medicine and surgery, most recently close to Rouen (France, 76). As was the case
with Docteur Klein, famous french Doctor in Veterinary Medicine, “animals made a man of me”. I'm father to four boys, a man
of tomorrow's world, and it was with their future in mind that I invented Hannibal
with the aid of my colleague and friend Pascal MARALDO, in the hope that it
would standardise the democratic process the world over. Thank you for your
support!



 Pascal MARALDO, co-designer

I am graduated from the "Trade Chamber of Paris", manager of several compagnies since 1988, I work now near Blois (France, 41). I have invented and co-designed the DAPI (Detections of anomaly on lonely work station). I have always been involved in security of goods and people. HANNIBAL is my best project. Like my friend Franck, I am the father of 4 children and I am concerned for the respect of their dreams and convictions. Thank you for becoming with us the guardian of their rights.

This project would have never been able to come to life without our super team of involved and skilled engineers. Thank you

Jean Michel BAERT
 Denis DOUBREMELLE


  Olivier GRENIER

story:
I am an inventor with two UK patents. I hold a PhD in Industrial and Business Studies from the University of Warwick Businesss School, Coventry, United Kingdom. I am seeking $100,000 to manufacture and sell my innovative wheelchair invention that doubles as a commode with flushable toilet. The product has a built in flushable toilet and lifting mechanism, with a privacy curtain for outdoor use incorporated as an accessory. A prototype of the product has been built with both manual and electric versions envisaged. Several organisations for the disabled based in the UK like AssistUK, have expressed interests in retailing this product once its manufactured. My company, Rose of Sharon Innovations Limited, is currently working with a UK-Based company that networks with manufacturers in China to commence manufacturing.

I have passionately worked on developing this product for over ten years following an incident I witnessed involving a disabled young man who needed to use a toilet in Manchester City Centre some years ago. Unfortunately, the key to the disabled toilet had been misplaced, leaving the young man rather distressed as he could not used other available toilets as they were not adapted for use by the disabled.

By funding this product, you will help elderly and disabled members of society live their lives in dignity both indoors and outdoors. This product, when manufactured, will help to promote the dignity and independence of the elderly, the disabled and hospital patients and reduce the risks of injury and infection associated with conventional wheelchairs and commodes as well.

By contributing as little as one USD or more, you will also be indirectly contributing to improving the lives of vulnerable people in several countries as Rose of Sharon Innovations Limited plans to invest twenty percent of its profits in a charity it plans to establish for promoting the well being of vulnerable members of society. The $100,000 funding is required to enable us commence manufacturing and sale of manual and electric versions of this innovative wheelchair product.

Rose of Sharon Innovations Limited will send the every contributor to this fund a thank you email while a keyholder with a picture of the product as logo will be sent to the first 50 contributors within three months of manufacturing commencing.

Should this funding pitch not reach the our entire goal, my company will scale down on the initial numbers of products to be manufactured and recycle the proceeds into further manufacturing in order to built up our capital base.

We are aware there are risks involved in getting this product to the market. We aim to make collaborate with reputable Chinese manufacturers in order to manufacture good quality products at affordable prices. We are passionate about seeing this product make a difference in the lives of vulnerable members of society, particularly the elderly and the disabled most of who are currently unable to enjoy lives indoors and outdoors. That passion and our experience while working on developing the product and and working with the 

product's intended client groups, our understanding of the product market and collaboration with reputable manufacturers and established wheelchair marketing companies will help us overcome envisaged obstacles.

I value your contribution to this project. I would equally forever appreciate your help in getting word about my funding campaign out to your friends, families, acquaintances, organisations, groups and social networks you belong to. Please remember to use the Indiegogo share tools.

story:
Short Summary

I am a qualified, professional Make-up artist and Tutor of make-up. I have been involved in the industry for almost 15 years. Having worked with various large cosmetic companies/brands I've always been aware of the mismatched creations for the darker skin types. It is my passion to provide the darker skin with make-up that looks natural when it is worn. Not just to provide this make-up, but to also teach wearers about make-up selection, suitability and application.

PerfectFaces is in the process of creating cosmetic make-up that is actually suitable for Ethnic skin tones. Realistically the market is swamped with options, but 94% of the available options do not actually satisfy the cosmetic and knowledge needs of Ethnic women.......this is where PerfectFaces fits into the 'square peg'.

Creating products that are Paraben-free, suitable, durable and sustainable.

This project is one that envisions providing make-up that actually complements and is affordable and sharing knowledge to those that are without the valuable information for their skin through workshops.

  • €56.000 is needed for this project
  • The funds would be allocated to mass production of the cosmetics, distribution via Ethnic supply shops in The Netherlands, Germany, France, Belgium and possibly Spain and to also have them available online worldwide.
  • These products are really specific to the skin and look quite natural. But most of all they are Paraben-free!!!!!!!!
  • If we do not raise all of the money, whatever is raised will go towards priorities: 
1. Mass production of the range 
2. Clearing customs, taxes and EU regulations. 
3. Offering the products to consumers by whatever legal means afforded.

The Impact

The struggle for good make-up in the Ethnic community has been on-going. To create make-up for darker skin tones is time consuming and an expensive venture. Most companies either don't have the in-depth knowledge of the skin needs or refuse to invest much as it would cut into profits.

We do need to make a profit as a business, but our drive is not the money; the satisfaction on the faces of users that know 'this company really got it!' Someone really understood.

Risks & Challenges

In any business there are risks. PerfectFaces faces two major risks; not receiving the needed finances for this project to succeed and not having products available in time (due to customs, EU regulations, etc.)

Completing Business Management Studies, has opened my eyes to the ups and downs of a business and most importantly how to manage and overcome them.

In-depth market research(micro and macro) has prepared the company for delays and humps on the way. We are aware of our threats and weaknesses, but also know how to use our strengths and opportunities to overcome.


Other Ways You Can Help

This is more than the money. Profits to keep us afloat is fine, but affordable make-up and satisfied customers knowing how to apply, what to apply and when is the meest belangrijk (most important). I want the world to know this.........please spread the brand; PerfectFaces.

story:
40 years of tradition

From the first days of its establishment SC Vračar was meant to be the place where kids were going to love swimming and we have succeeded in preserving that spirit ever since. Managed and funded by the parents, with no support from any big sport association, nobody thought it would become what it has - one of the most successful trophy-winning swimming clubs in Serbia today.

 the begginings

SC Vračar was founded on the 15th of October 1975. The first goal was to attract as many school and preschool children as possible and teach them how to swim. By the end of that year we counted 250 members!

The golden age of SC Vračar began in 1980 when Bojana Radosavljević broke the Serbian record in 100m breaststroke for 12-13 year-olds. In the next 12 years, numerous national and regional records were broken, some of them still unbeaten today.

youth team 2014

With the new millennium and crises of the 90's behind us, we’ve opened a new era for our club. In the last 10 years we became widely recognized as the one of the best clubs for younger categories. Over a thousand medals won in domestic and international meetings and dozen of our swimmers as members of Serbia swimming team have proved that.

In 2014 SC Vračar organized the International Meeting for young swimmers for the 23rd time, winning more than 100 medals, while breaking national records in all backstroke disciplines (50m, 100m, 200m) in the 12-13 years old boys category... but our mission is not complete yet!

The statistics say that more then 70% of kids in the 3rd grade of primary schools in Serbia are non-swimmers and by the end of high school that percentage drops to a sad 56%. It is for this reason that we have re-established our swimming school for the youngest (4-6 years) but have also decided to search for help to promote swimming in every way.

Why do we need help?

Although swimming is, together with athletics, considered to be a basic sport for the development of a child, it has not proved to be a profitable sport in small communities. All our activities are based on the ability of the parents to provide for the needs of their kids. Very often, talented children suffer because of a gap between these two points. This is where we, as a club, as a community and as human beings must intervene and help.

Since the official institutions have failed to recognize this need we have decided to become pioneers of this noble idea and do whatever we can to make a long term sustainable strategy that will not only attract but also keep children in this wonderful sport.
 


How can you help?

The first and most important way to help us is to spread the word! Help us to raise awareness of how sport activity, especially swimming, can be important for children in the period of their intensive physical development. Obesity, cardiovascular problems, high blood pressure have all became common phenomena for adolescents and all that can be prevented through adequate physical activity. Help us to reach as many children as we can and motivate them not only to learn to swim but to regularly practice and enjoy it.

Like and share our facebook page and ask your friends to like and share it too and we'll do our best to find plenty of interesting and educational material for everyone.

If you are in a position to donate any amount we will truly appreciate it and use it adequately, in accordance with the plan that we are here presenting.

We have prepared a lot of interesting perks that, we hope, will help you feel the passion and devotion that we live every day - and if you feel it too and think you can contribute through the promotion of this idea, you are more than welcome to join our campaign team.



The tools!

We have defined 6 funding areas that we are certain will help us achieve our goal. We would like to present these to you in order of priority:


The goals!


For the community:
- by the end of 2015 establish intensive cooperation with preschool institutions and educate 100 young swimmers of 6-7 years of age;
- use the web and social networks to provide parents and children with long-term education on the importance of sports activities;
- fully develop a swimming program for persons with developmental disabilities - at this moment we have two young boys undergoing the basic program of training.

For the club:
- double the number of kids in the pre-competitive group through a scouting programs in primary schools and organic growth from our own swimming school;
- by the end of 2015 complete the teams in all age categories;
- by the end of this year attend three international swimming meetings with first team cadets (5 girls and 5 boys, age 15-16);
- have representatives in all national swimming meetings in all age categories.
- have at least one swimmer in the national team cadet category by 2016
- organize a summer camp
- develop and implement the system of quantitative and qualitative monitoring of each individual swimmer in the competitive age categories (11-12, 13-14, 15-16 and 17-18 yr.)

The timeline!


Stretch goals!

Of course, we are not going to stop here. We have already sketched future goals that we will aim to achieve. If these can be developed throughout this campaign we will make sure to present them to you before the campaign ends:

- In 2017: 1 national youth team member, 2 national cadet team members

- Number of kids in the swimming school: 250 

- Set up our own small gym within our premises

- Organise two season camps (1 summer, 1 winter) for the first teams in all categories

- Build a team in the absolute category (18+) from organic growth
- Establish cooperation with the National Paralympic Committee with the purpose of helping disabled persons.

of each individual swimmer in the competitive age categories (11-12,
13-14, 15-16 and 17-18 yr.) The timeline!

goals!


Of course, we are not going to stop
here. We have already sketched future goals that we will aim to achieve. If these
can be developed throughout this campaign we will make sure to present them to
you before the campaign ends:
- In 2017: 1 national youth team member,
2 national cadet team members
- Number of kids in the swimming
school: 250 
- Set up our own small gym within
our premises
- Organise two season camps (1
summer, 1 winter) for the first teams in all categories

- Build a team in the absolute category (18+)
from organic growth - Establish cooperation with the National Paralympic Committee with the purpose
of helping disabled persons.

story:
It has been almost 10 years since Katrina, a lot of ups and downs but I never stop believing in my vision for my business. I kept trying. Now God has open up doors and I am in a major grocery chain and we need to ramp up to supply the of the demand of the product and I need your help. We need commercial equipment, hopper, mixer, labeler and inventory items.

Linda “GG” Gibson,
Founder of GG’s Fine Foods and
GG’s Real New Orleans Creole Cuisine
Woodstock, GA

click here to see me on CNN

Cooking with GG, Bringing family and friends back to the table!

Biography
 
“It’s time to start bringing people back to the table,” says GG. “That’s where your heart is—with family and friends. Good food shared with people you love nourishes your soul.”
 
Linda “GG” Gibson has been on a lifelong mission to help bring people together around good food, the kind she remembers from her childhood. As a child in her grandmother’s kitchen, GG learned how to cook generations-old Creole recipes. Although her grandmother, Ella D. Smith, didn’t have a lot, she never skimped on flavor or presentation, taking great pride and pleasure in presenting fabulous meals. This passion for food continues to inspire GG.
 
GG’s flair for culinary art developed into a career. GG owned and operated GG’s Coffee and Café, a thriving restaurant and catering business in New Orleans, featuring her original Crawfish Pie and Signature Seafood Gumbo. After Hurricane Katrina left her business and home in ruins, GG, her husband and three children found themselves in Georgia. The family endured a very difficult period of several years. GG overcame many hardships to establish GG’s Fine Foods in Woodstock, Georgia. Through her faith, her sweet personality and a giving spirit, GG has made many friends in Georgia and now considers herself a local. 
 
GG’s Fine Foods produces all of GG’s most popular recipes in a commercial production kitchen in Woodstock, Georgia. Under the label “GG’s Real New Orleans Creole Cuisine,” selections include GG’s Signature Seafood Gumbo, soup bases such as Gumbo and Roasted Corn Chowder, Famous Crawfish Pie, Crawfish Finishing Sauce, Signature Spice Blend, Remoulade Sauce and more—all infused with GG’s “rockin’” flavors: never too hot, perfectly spiced.
 
A stickler for quality ingredients, GG uses only natural, sustainable products like pure butter, Georgia Grown farm-fresh cream, organic vegetables and never any additives or preservatives. Everything is made completely from scratch, using the same slow, time-honored methods her grandmother taught her.
 
GG’s products can be found in grocery stores, natural foods stores, institutional dining facilities and restaurants.
story_txt:

Now God has open up doors and I am in a major grocery chain and we need to ramp up to supply the of the demand of the product and I need your help. We need commercial equipment, hopper, mixer, labeler and inventory items.Linda “GG” Gibson,Founder of GG’s Fine Foods andGG’s Real New Orleans Creole CuisineWoodstock, GAclick here to see me on CNNCooking with GG, Bringing family and friends back to the table!Biography “It’s

story: .

The veterinarians words rang loud and clear that first time I stepped foot in her office – some of my friends and family members have dogs with conditions like diabetes and other health issues or allergies, and I remember it being a time when I would see articles every few weeks in the news about deadly dog food and treat recalls. When I did additional research, the vet’s advice for my newly adopted Miniature Schnauzer, Sargent Pepperoni, was spot-on. The quality and origin of the ingredients going into commercially-available dog food just isn’t what I wanted to feed Sarge (and now his sister, Sweetie). My dogs are members of my family, and I’m often times more concerned about what I feed my dogs than what I feed myself! So I started researching the right ingredients for dog treats, developing recipes, taste testing with Sarge and his neighborhood buddies, and eventually selling my human-grade dog treats at our local farmer’s market in Buffalo, New York.

The dog treats that I make at Fetch! are the highest quality treats available on the market. They’re filled with clean, wholesome ingredients; like the house made peanut butter that is ground fresh in the bakery weekly, no additives. Some of our other ingredients are things like pure pumpkin puree, sweet potato, and oat flour, and I even add nutritious fats like wild Alaskan salmon oil to the treats to help with things like keeping  your dog’s coat shiny and healthy. With flavors like Peanut Butter Goodness, Scrumptious Pumpkin, and Cheesy Bacon, your dog is bound to have a favorite (Sarge is partial to anything Peanut Butter!), and I believe that the love that I pour into baking each treat shows on the face of every dog who eats one.


What had started out as a desire to feed my pup a high-quality and safe treat has turned into a passion for bringing all dogs joy through delicious treats. If other people love their dogs the way I love Sarge and Sweetie, they’ll want to feed their dogs the very best treats, too. I know each fur customer that comes by the market, and I love seeing the joy in their faces when they take a bite. We don’t cut any corners when it comes to quality, and it shows in the excitement of each dog that gets a Fetch! treat. Our mission is to provide treats that taste delicious to our (fur) customers, and are so high-quality that parents feel good about giving our treats to their dogs. The joy that we have been able to provide to the local dogs of Buffalo, New York has fueled our passion for making all dogs happy, which is why we are so excited about this campaign: if fully funded, this campaign will allow us to expand nationally and bring these treats to dogs all across the country!



I have grown Fetch! out of a tiny residential kitchen, into and out of a church kitchen, and into a small production and retail space, as well have delveloped a website where our treats can be ordered and shipped nationwide, but one thing hasn’t changed: the treats are still handcrafted by me, all while still maintaining a separate full-time job. You see, the demand for Fetch! treats is increasing quickly, and I have had to turn down new business opportunities because my partner, John, and I just cannot keep up with the demand on our own. Given how much our fur customers love our treats; it is disappointing to turn down the opportunity to get our treats into the paws of even more dogs, so we want to make this expansion a reality in the name of bringing happiness to as many dogs as we can. With a little bit of funding to bridge the gap, we can develop this small local business into a large-scale operation, while still maintaining the integrity and quality of the product that our current customers have come to know and love.



We are so excited about bringing these treats to more dogs, and we hope that we’ve convinced you that supporting Fetch! and investing in the nationwide expansion of our high-quality dog treats is worth your dollars! We have already taken a few steps toward expansion: my partner and co-owner John has taken over the day-to-day operations, which allows me the minimal time needed to focus on maintaining our current inventory of treats; we have identified a regional manufacturing partner, who shares our high standards for quality and integrity; and we have developed an expansion strategy, including cost estimates and marketing strategies. If our campaign is fully funded, we will be able to move forward with the remaining elements for expansion:



FIRST, I will be able to contract with our manufacturing partner to produce the bulk of my packaged treats. Get this, a single 4-hour run from our manufacturer produces about the same number of treats that I made and sold LAST YEAR! Here's why you care: My business running more efficiently means less cost. Less cost means more competitive pricing. More competitive pricing means that you save, and when you save....YOU WIN!
 

SECOND, by decreasing the amount of time I spend producing our current treat lineup, I can begin to focus more time on the really fun stuff like researching and developing new flavors, adding functional treats to our offerings and get creative with some really cool decorated cookie treats!
 

THIRD, and most importantly, I will be able to create and continue to support multiple jobs for American workers, which is a passion of mine: I will be able to offer our current part-time bakery help full-time opportunities; I will be able to add seasonal positions; and I will also hire sales reps to increase our footprint now that we have product to sell.



I have fallen in love with my little business and the joy it brings to my dog customers and their owners, and John and I are excited about the future of the company. We hope you’re excited about bringing the joy and wellness of our treats to your pups, too!

If you’re ready to support the mission of Fetch!, please help us fund this campaign! And while you’re here, please follow us on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter, and consider signing up for our mailing list so you can hear updates about the campaign and the expansion. If you can’t wait to get your paws on our treats, feel free to order directly off our website (fetchmeatreat.com), but please consider funding our campaign first, since that will have the greatest long-term impact!

story:
EtchLife is a Christian Lifestyle Brand launched in 2015. We are owned by three women, from three generations using our gifts and knowledge as entrepreneurs, and as professionals in graphic arts, interior design, marketing, and social media, to fill a large gap we found in the marketplace. We are creating beautiful and intentional products to help each of us weave our faith into everyday life.  We want to learn God’s word, live it out daily, and share it with others. (Learn it, Live it, Share It)

Our products are not a perfect solution but rather offer an easy transition, an intentional, real shift in the way we interact with Christ throughout the day.  We are so encouraged and affirmed as we see how God is using our gospel-centered products to plant seeds and to affirm other’s walks with the Lord.

Since our launch, we’ve seen amazing growth in our online and retail sales, we’ve begun to offer our products at wholesale to a few Christian boutiques, bookstores, retail shops.  Even a few national retail chains have found us and placed orders.  Lately, new opportunities have arose for relationships with churches and ministries centered on how we can partner with them to extend their message beyond Sunday mornings.

We’ve begun to feel the Lord leading us to do more!  We’ve prayerfully decided to pursue a campaign on a crowdfunding platform as it beautifully aligns with our desire to share the gospel with others, (what more perfect than a public platform like Indiegogo!) We also love that it offers us a way to invite others to join our community and offer a tangible way to participate in what God is doing through Etch.

Here is what we use these crowd funding dollars to help with:

Expand our Product Offering/New Collections: We have several collections in development phase and with the funds you provide, we want to move those collections off the drawing board and into production to help us maximize fourth quarter selling opportunities.

Leveraging New Wholesale Relationships/Opportunities: We are so humbled to have been invited to present EtchLife: the 'who we are' and our products in development to a private audience of Christian Bookstore Retailers at a national conference this fall. These retailers are looking for companies that can help them deliver intentional and beautiful Christian products in their stores throughout the country. We hope to generate new product samples, gain advise and an understanding of the challenges these retailers face, and partner with them to deliver "next-generation" Christian products for their customers. 

Additionally, we were contacted by one of the largest Christian retailers first quarter this year who expressed interest in several of our products.  We would like to pursue this relationship and will use some of these funds to work toward improved sourcing to be able to accommodate larger wholesale orders. 

Partnership Development with Churches/Ministries: Early 2018 we began more intentionally contacting churches and ministries and asking how EtchLife might help them further their ministry beyond their doors and beyond their Sunday morning offering.  Several churches responded. We've custom designed retreat journals, encouragement art, welcome/guest gift products (like drinkware, tote bags) volunteer gift bags, and designed a whole new line of 16 unique Pastoral Care Art Cards: Touch Collection (link here) and our latest Align Wall Decor (link here) with over 200 custom-sized stretched canvas, framed art, and all types of gospel-based wall decor. 

Lastly, Operational Improvements. We want to begin to prepare operationally to springboard this next phase of growth. We are ready to invest in some key tools and processes to help us build the operational foundation to take this growth step: Improved inventory management programs that incorporate UPC barcodes and scanner hardware and improved Point of Purchase technology for enhance our customer interface.   

So, come along with us. We would love for you to partner with us in our growth. 

We are trying to raise $30,000 to spring board a larger fall line and help us pursue two new opportunities that will directly impact how far our gospel-centered products reach and the number of lives we can touch.

Help us take this next step towards expanding the gospel through beautiful products that help weave God’s word into everyday life.

As part of our journey we take measuring impact very seriously. Understanding how God is using our products to further His kingdom is key to Etch.Life maintaining our intentional focus. We pray daily for God’s guidance to keep us from getting side-tracked with traditional market practices that are simple greed-based objectives that have nothing to do with growing a stable, thriving, gospel-based business.  We truly believe the numerous challenges, hostile secular climate, and fear of these market traps have kept others from attempting to forge ahead with a Christian-based business model. With businesses like Chic-fil-a, and Hobby Lobby as role-models, and countless smaller mom & pop shops blazing new trails, we have humbly navigated our first three years into the marketplace and are being blessed with much success and acceptance from all avenues of support.

We have made a commitment through prayer and diligence to continually ask for feedback and input from our current customers, and to monitoring the basic business metrics of reach, engagement, and transactions to help us make sure we are on target with what Christians of all ages, backgrounds, and denominations need and want on their faith journey. We feel passionate that God has called us to help fill this need in our world, now more than ever.

Additionally, we maintain capture and share stories on our social media platforms about the ways in which our products have been used in the world.  Stories shared that both inspire our own journey and also enlighten and inform us on product use, functional need, and new creative solution ideas. Christ and our customers are our compass.

If there are local Christian retailers, boutiques, bookstores or ministries/churches in your part of the world that you think might be interested in knowing about us, and might be blessed by partnering with us to expand their efforts, we would love to know about them!  Please email us directly at info@etch.life and share their name and contact information with us so we might start a conversation with them.  It’s all about reaching out and connecting!
