story:
-------- 
 

Each giving tier has perks. Click on each to see benefits!

------- 

Anyone can be a climber. But have you felt the delight of climbing outside?

 

Why

There's 99 thousand benefits of climbing. Fitness. More friends. Less stress. The world agrees. Climbing debuts in the Olympics this year! But what’s better than climbing? Answer: Climbing outside. Here’s the problem, outside climbs can be scarce, expensive, exclusive, deserted, and sometimes illegal. Nosotros solves this with an outside rock wall - for all ages and skill levels -  in Westlake’s Crocker Park. This wall is accessible, clean, safe, and affordable. It will definitely send a Clevelandar to the next Olympics! So when someone asks, What have you been up to?  You can say, I've been making history. I helped start Cleveland's first outside climbing wall!  #CLEfirstoutsideclimb #climbcrocker

 

Who

Nosotros Rock Climbing Gym is a charitable 501c3 nonprofit with two locations, Lakewood (est 2018) and Cleveland (est 2020). Nosotros means we because people matter. People thrive on good relationships. We love how climbing is deeply relational. We love the welcoming atmosphere that our customers create - how they make others belong. Our mission is we use rock holds to help households. We give time, money, and service to underserved youth and communities. Nosotros has reunited a father and wayward son, provided field trips to students in poverty and families with cancer, given 100 date nights to local couples, and donated to racial equality. You are making a difference through Nosotros and we’re all having fun while it’s happening. This wall will help us impact more of your neighbors. More at gonosotros.com/mission.

 

What

This outside climbing wall is 24 ft long x 12 ft wide x 15 ft tall. The total footprint is a little larger when rubber mulch padding is added. We've shopped for best prices and applied our nonprofit and military discounts. We’re asking for help because material and labor increases are still challenging. 5K is our primary goal. If we hit our stretch goal of 10K, it'll help us get better climbing holds and all crowdfunding contributors will get a bonus: one month of free climbing at Nosotros Lakewood or Downtown for themselves or another.

 

Climber Details

We understand that there's nothing like climbing real rock. This wall is a step in the right direction. We know there's some free outside public walls - but in those cases, the city funded. Here, Nosotros is fully responsibly for material, labor, insurance, staff, and rent. This wall will raise awareness to the physical, social, intellectual, and faithful impact climbing has on people. Further, it will draw attention to the efforts of organizations like the Ohio Climber’s Coalition who are promoting and protecting outside climbing. This wall will show the viability for more outside climbing walls around Cleveland.

 

Gritty Details

  • Nosotros Lakewood and Downtown Members get free access to Nosotros Crocker
  • We aim to open Nosotros Crocker to the public during the week of Aug 2. Grand opening week will include parties, prizes, and a competition
  • On Oct 18, this wall will be dismantled and removed from Crocker Park, ideally to another venue
  • The success of this wall can determine if Nosotros may be invited back to Crocker next season. Nosotros is qualified to make this wall a success. We need your support to get it off the ground. Thank you so much for your contribution and sharing to help get the word out
  • Email us if you'd like to help further with the following: (1) If you have a future outside climbing wall venue, (2) If you're interested in employment, (3) If you're a skilled carpenter, (3) If you have marketing experience
  • Each giving tier has perks. Click on each to see benefits!

story:
Our Story

Ammonite Yarns is a small local yarn shop in Pontyclun, South Wales founded in 2015 by Ruth and Jenny.  Ruth came from a career in engineering while Jenny's background is in publishing.  Ruth's analytical approach and Jenny's more free-form style perfectly complement each other whether solving problems for customers, running workshops or facilitating drop-in groups.

 

 

We are both passionate about all things yarn.  We have worked hard over the past two years to provide a friendly and relaxing environment for our customers.  As we have increased our range of yarns and accessories, the space available for our drop-ins and workshops has become smaller. We love teaching and sharing our knitting and crochet skills with others but our opportunities to do this are restricted by the space we have.  

Pontyclun is a vibrant village with a thriving high street and a strong sense of community. We believe that improving the facilities at Ammonite Yarns will enable us to offer more workshops, classes and drop-ins, helping us to both build our business and support our village. 

 

 

Our Vision

Our vision is to make Ammonite Yarns a hub for fibre enthusiasts to learn new crafts and skills, share their expertise and meet in a friendly environment within the local community. 

 

Our Challenge

As you can see from our video, we have two small storage rooms separated by a partition wall. Both areas have shelves and worktops inherited from its previous use as a television repair business.  We sometimes use the room for small workshops but it is a cluttered uninspiring space with no natural light, ageing fixtures and sterile decoration. It desperately needs refurbishing!

 

 

Our Plan

The rooms will be opened up into one and decorated to create a bright and inviting workshop with compact concealed storage. Lighting will be improved with, if possible, a natural light source. We will fit a small kitchenette with running water and drainage for a deep sink and worktop dishwasher. This will allow us to extend our range of courses to include messy activities such as dyeing.

We estimate that this will cost around £5,000 to complete the refurbishment to a good standard and also provide equipment for workshops (for example spinning wheels and weaving looms). Any additional funds will be used to subsidise materials and specialist tutors for courses.

We would like the environment for the teaching room to match the enthusiasm, creativity and skills of our students so if we don’t reach our goal the money raised will kick-start the renovation.  

We would love you to contribute towards our goal so please pick a perk!  

 

 

Can't help financially? We're going to need some willing hands, so maybe you could contribute some time to our project. We will reward you with tea and cake and perhaps a little knitting or crochet tuition along the way.

story:
The name Oak & Moss was derived from our family roots in Savannah, GA where the streets are lined with oak trees covered with Spanish moss creating natural awnings on many streets throughout the city. Those trees make us feel at home every time we visit the city, and we seek to create that same warm and fuzzy feeling in our homes, and now hopefully yours. 

Sisters, Candice and Lauren are combining their passions to bring a unique experience to as many homes as they can. Candice, the interior designer and DIYer, enjoys creating beautiful spaces for her clients. Lauren is a creative professional who has a educational background in the arts, but has a passion to work with emerging artists who seek platforms to showcase their art.

As moms and wives, we want the chance to follow our passions and help our customers bring unique decor and original art to in their homes. 

We are looking to raise $5,000 towards the following:

  • Website domain with e-commerce capabilities (Weebly site designed and ready to go!)
  • Digital Camera to capture decor and artwork
  • Printed Materials (business cards and  marketing materials)
  • Storage for artworks and purchased decor
  • Costs for product samples and purchasing decor
  • Design and home office software
  • and many of new business costs that we may not be aware of yet... 

Candice and Lauren hope you will support our drive and dedication to be entrepreneurs. We look forward to sharing our love for home with you.

story:
Short Summary

About Modern Companion

Modern Companion aims to bring the community of pet lovers together one stylish pet product at a time. Modern Companion is currently an online pet accessory company that was created back in January 2019. When you become a part of our community, you become part of our family. Getting to know each pet and their human is something we are passionate about. We try our best to engage with our community through fun blog posts, trivia, contests, and much more on our social accounts.

Supporting our local community and other small businesses has been a central focus for our company. Sixty percent of the materials we use are sourced from small business manufacturers and shops. All our shirts are locally screen-printed here in South Carolina by another small business. We believe in the power of #communityovercompetition and #supportingsmallshops.

Modern Companion's unique modern style and mission to cater to all pets have brought the community of pet lovers together, unlike any other company. We can be seen by our local community often at the Soda City Market in downtown Columbia. 

Over the course of two years, we have created thousands of handmade products out of our home.  We also wholesale our bandanas, scarves, and tees to over 60 small businesses in the United States.

We recently started partnering with other small businesses to create curated boxes full of our products and others that cater to the modern-day pet parent. This was when we started to realize how much passion we have for finding and curating products and supporting others along the way.

Our tiny home office is bursting at the seams! We believe it's time to share our brand and community with our local area and expand our abilities. Therefore, we are looking to open up our first retail location in Chapin, South Carolina.

The Modern Companion store will be an upscale pet boutique catering to all pets. It will feature all of our own products from bandanas, scarves, tees, bowties, and curated products that the pet will love and the pet parent as well. We would also love to stock our store with products created by small businesses and help them grow their brands.

We would love to implement other things into our store like a self-wash station and home-made treat bar. 

We hope to open in early 2021. 

About The Owner

Maddie St. Gelais, originally from Latham, New York, graduated from the State University of New York at Oswego back in December of 2017 with a BFA in Design. She moved down to South Carolina in 2018 and currently works as a full-time web designer aside from running Modern Companion. She is currently going back to school part-time to get her MBA in Entrepreneurship and Innovation from Clemson University.  She is a crazy pet mom that is inspired to put a new spin on pet products. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Starting up a retail location requires many upfront costs that a small business and young entrepreneur can not easily get. We will try to get some small business loans but we wanted to reach out to friends and family first!

What your contribution will be going towards:

  • Signage
  • Displays
  • Renovations within the store
  • Buying inventory
  • Overhead costs
  • Maintenance and Repairs

What your contribution will get you:

We know asking for money during difficult times is a lot to ask, and we truly want to make it feel like our community helped us create our store. We want to feel like everyone "owns" a piece.

Therefore, we have created some perks for every amount you donate!

  • $20 (A personalized thank you email from the owner and be notified first the date and location of our store)
  • $50 ( A personalized thank you email from the owner and a free bandana)
  • $80 (A personalized thank you email from the owner, free bandana, and free tee)
  • $100 (A personalized thank you email from the owner, free bandana, free tee, and personal shoutout when we go LIVE on the first day of opening)
  • $200 (A personalized thank you email from the owner, free bandana, free tee, personal shoutout when we go LIVE on the first day of opening, and VIP access to our store before everyone else)

 

Risks & Challenges

We are aware that we are currently in a pandemic with the current COVID-19 crisis and its effects on small businesses. However, we believe between our online community and in-person community, we will overcome these challenges and offer safe shopping experience for people and their pets.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We totally understand if you cannot donate. The best way to help us is to share this campaign with others to reach our goal!

Our tiny home office is bursting at the seams! We believe it's time to share our brand and community with our local area and expand our abilities. Therefore, we are looking to open up our first retail location in Chapin, South Carolina.
The Modern Companion store will be an upscale pet boutique catering to all pets. It will feature all of our own products from bandanas, scarves, tees, bowties, and curated products that the pet will love and the pet parent as well. We would also love to stock our store with products created by small businesses and help them grow their brands.
We would love to implement other things into our store like a self-wash station and home-made treat bar. 
We hope to open in early 2021. 
About The Owner
Maddie St. Gelais, originally from Latham, New York, graduated from the State University of New York at Oswego back in December of 2017 with a BFA in Design. She moved down to South Carolina in 2018 and currently works as a full-time web designer aside from running Modern Companion. She is currently going back to school part-time to get her MBA in Entrepreneurship and Innovation from Clemson University.  She is a crazy pet mom that is inspired to put a new spin on pet products. 
 

What We Need & What You Get
Starting up a retail location requires many upfront costs that a small business and young entrepreneur can not easily get. We will try to get some small business loans but we wanted to reach out to friends and family first!
What your contribution will be going towards:

Signage
Displays
Renovations within the store
Buying inventory
Overhead costs
Maintenance and Repairs

What your contribution will get you:
We know asking for money during difficult times is a lot to ask, and we truly want to make it feel like our community helped us create our store. We want to feel like everyone "owns" a piece.
Therefore, we have created some perks for every amount you donate!

$20 (A personalized thank you email from the owner and be notified first the date and location of our store)
$50 ( A personalized thank you email from the owner and a free bandana)
$80 (A personalized thank you email from the owner, free bandana, and free tee)
$100 (A personalized thank you email from the owner, free bandana, free tee, and personal shoutout when we go LIVE on the first day of opening)
$200 (A personalized thank you email from the owner, free bandana, free tee, personal shoutout when we go LIVE on the first day of opening, and VIP access to our store before everyone else)

 

Risks & Challenges
We are aware that we are currently in a pandemic with the current COVID-19 crisis and its effects on small businesses. However, we believe between our online community and in-person community, we will overcome these challenges and offer safe shopping experience for people and their pets.
 

Other Ways You Can Help
We totally understand if you cannot donate. The best way to help us is to share this campaign with others to reach our goal!

story:
TEXTE FRANCAIS PLUS BAS

ENGLISH TEXT BELOW

 

Incipit multicultural.

En la cordillera de los Andes, en el pueblo colombiano de Armenia Mantequilla, fue creada "Bonne Nature".

Desde 2014, ayudamos a desarrollar nuestro pueblo gracias a sus vacas de altas montañas, transformando su leche en deliciosos quesos "colombo-franceses", dignos de la tradición francesa y a un precio asequible para la mayoría de la población colombiana.

Hace unos años, razones económicas nos llevaron a transformar la mitad de nuestra casa en una quesería (cuando empiezas toca hacer con lo que hay ¿cierto?).

Pero hoy, nuestro sueño es construir una verdadera quesería, pues se nos volvió imprescindible para seguir existiendo. Esperamos que este financiamiento participativo nos ayude a hacerlo. ¡A cambio de sus ayudas les preparamos varias recompensas que podrán recibir tanto en Colombia, Francia o cualquier otro país!

¡Ayudarnos en este reto es apoyar una globalización que también puede ser movida "desde abajo" participando en una ambiciosa aventura campesina local que cruza fronteras gracias a su multiculturalismo! ¿Vamos?

Salvemos Bonne Nature.

Hola a todos,

Nuestra empresa familiar promueve el mestizaje cultural entre nuestros dos países de corazón - Colombia y Francia - a través de la elaboración de quesos artesanales que mezclan los conocimientos de la quesería francesa y los productos del campo colombiano.

Nuestra familia colombo-francesa, los "MEJÍA MEJÍA", nació de la unión entre Luz Marina y John Jairo, acogidos por Francia en 1991.

Después de casi 25 años en la ciudad de Lyon, Luz Marina decidió aprender el arte de los quesos artesanales franceses y volver a Colombia para montar una quesería ecológica y contribuir al desarrollo de su pueblo natal: Armenia Mantequilla.

Rico en cultura, paisaje y naturaleza, nuestro pueblo prosperó antaño transformando sus materias primas y diversificando sus actividades agrícolas. Infelizmente, la revolución industrial y el éxodo rural del siglo XX complicaron la vida campesina...!

Bonne Nature nació de nuestro deseo de crear una empresa ecológica inspiradora que valorizará los recursos locales y de la que Armenia Mantequilla, Colombia y Francia pudieran estar orgullosos.

Construyamos la "Quesería de mi sin ti".

Nuestra casa improvisada como quesería ya no tiene espacio suficiente para nuestra actividad, ni tampoco cavas para madurar nuestros quesos. Continuar en estas condiciones es extremadamente duro para nuestras queseras y ya no es económicamente viable.

Por eso, nuestro sueño hoy en día es construir una verdadera quesería con cavas para aumentar nuestra producción, eso nos permitirá crecer.

Por qué necesitamos su ayuda y a qué se destinarán sus aportes.

Un préstamo bancario nos permitió comprar una casa con el terreno donde se construiría la nueva quesería. Necesitamos tu apoyo para ayudarnos a financiar la construcción de la quesería (315M de COP) y la compra de equipamiento (104).

Hemos calculado el objetivo de crowdfunding basándonos en el mínimo que necesitamos para empezar la obra. Es importante señalar que de los 67.000 euros del objetivo, en realidad serán 46.255 euros irían directamente al proyecto. 

Para mayor claridad y transparencia, les preparamos un quesito (al fin y al cabo, es nuestra especialidad) que explica a qué se destinará exactamente el dinero:

El dinero llegará a la cuenta bancaria francesa de “FILO”, asociación de solidaridad internacional que creamos para promover lazos multiculturales en Francia y Armenia Mantequilla. Mandaremos la totalidad del dinero enseguida para la construcción de la obra en Colombia.

La quesería.

Nuestra quesería estará compuesta por cavas semienterradas situadas en el sótano, cuyo coste de construcción se estima en 21.500 euros. En el primer piso se construirá un laboratorio de producción con una sala independiente dedicada al empaque de quesos, así como una zona de recepción y venta, con un presupuesto estimado de 25.500 euros.

Los equipos.

Si conseguimos superar el objetivo mínimo, podremos invertir en la compra de equipos para la nueva quesería.

Ya tenemos algunos equipos que hemos comprado reinvirtiendo los beneficios de la quesería a lo largo del tiempo. Sin embargo, el espacio será mayor y nuestra producción también, por lo que será necesaria la compra de equipos para funcionar correctamente.

Entre otros: una lavadora industrial, una prensa de queso profesional, un caldero de leche de 500 litros, mesas de acero inoxidable, muebles de madera para las cavas, moldes de queso...

¿Por qué es importante nuestra quesería?

Nuestro proyecto tiene una fuerte dimensión social, política y ecológica.

Hay que admitir que instalarse en plena Cordillera de los Andes para producir quesos artesanales de leche cruda sin pasteurizar - en un país que no tiene cultura de este tipo de quesos - fue una apuesta bastante loca.

Pero esta valiente idea resultó ser una apuesta ganadora: ¡nuestros quesos son un éxito! Gracias a sus sabores suaves pero pronunciados, por su mezcla con especias colombianas y por su precio asequible.

Llevamos siete años demostrando que es posible trabajar "con y para" la gente del pueblo, al tiempo que se trabaja "con y para" la naturaleza de nuestras montañas.

Hoy pagamos la leche a un precio mejor que el del mercado tradicional y convencemos a los ganaderos para que se pasen a la agricultura ecológica proponiendo una transición ecológica suave y factible. Poco a poco, llegaremos a nuestro objetivo.

En Armenia Mantequilla, optamos por trabajar principalmente con mujeres cabeza de familia, con el fin de proporcionarles independencia financiera. Actualmente Bonne Nature está dirigida por tres mujeres en producción y si continuamos nuestro equipo crecerá.

En el futuro, nos gustaría convertirnos en una cooperativa ecológica y solidaria en la que todos los socios obtengan beneficios en función de su trabajo e inversión.

Si no puedes ayudarnos económicamente, hay otras maneras.

A veces no es posible ayudar dando dinero, lo entendemos perfectamente. Felizmente, una forma muy eficaz es de ayudar es utilizar las herramientas Indiegogo para compartir en tus redes sociales. Lo ideal sería escribir una frase de tu inspiración (interesará más que un enlace solo) explicando por qué crees que es importante apoyarnos.

En estos tiempos de pandemia, las palabras de ánimo, las ideas, los consejos también nos darán fuerzas para seguir adelante.

Le agradecemos mucho cualquier ayuda que nos pueda prestar.

Gracias por su apoyo.

El equipo de Bonne Nature.

 

VERSION FRANCAISE.

 

Incipit multiculturel.

Sur la Cordillère des Andes, dans le village colombien d'Armenia Mantequilla , a été créé  "Bonne Nature".

Depuis 2014, nous aidons à développer notre village grâce à ses vaches de haute montagne, en transformant leur lait en délicieux fromages "colombo-français", dignes de la tradition française et à un prix abordable pour la majorité de la population colombienne.

Il y a quelques années, des raisons financières nous ont amené à transformer la moitié de notre maison en fromagerie (quand on débute il faut savoir faire avec ce qu'on a, pas vrai?).

Mais aujourd’hui, notre rêve est de construire une véritable fromagerie, cela nous est même devenu indispensable pour continuer d’exister. Nous espérons que ce financement participatif nous aidera à le faire: nous avons préparé une multitude de contreparties que vous pourrez recevoir autant en France que depuis un grand nombre de pays!

Nous aider dans ce projet c'est soutenir que la mondialisation peut aussi se faire "par le bas" en prenant part à une ambitieuse aventure paysanne locale qui traverse les frontières grâce à son multiculturalisme! On y va?

Sauvons Bonne Nature.

Hola tout le monde,

Notre entreprise familiale fait la promotion du métissage culturel entre nos deux pays de cœur - la Colombie et la France - via l'élaboration de fromages artisanaux mêlant le savoir-faire fromager français et les produits issus de la campagne colombienne.

Notre famille colombo-française, les “MEJÍA MEJÍA”, est née de l'union entre Luz Marina et John Jairo, accueilli·e·s par la France en 1991.

Après presque 25 années passées dans la ville de Lyon, Luz Marina décide d'apprendre l'art du fromage artisanal français et de rentrer en Colombie monter une fromagerie biologique pour aider à développer son village natal : Armenia Mantequilla.

Riche en culture, paysage et nature, notre village prospérait autrefois en transformant ses matières premières et en diversifiant ses activités agricoles. Mais la révolution industrielle, l'exode rural et une mondialisation effrénée sont passés par là…

Bonne Nature est donc née de notre volonté de créer une entreprise écologique inspirante, qui magnifierait les ressources locales et dont Armenia Mantequilla, la Colombie et la France pourraient être fiers!

Construisons la "Quesería de mi sin ti".

Notre maison improvisée en fromagerie ne possède plus d'espace suffisant pour notre activité, ni de caves pour affiner nos fromages. Continuer dans ces conditions est extrêmement éprouvant pour nos fromagères et n'est plus viable économiquement.

Voilà pourquoi notre rêve aujourd'hui est de construire une véritable fromagerie avec des caves à fromage afin de pouvoir augmenter notre production et croître.

Pourquoi nous avons besoin de votre aide et où iront vos contributions.

Un prêt bancaire nous a permis d'acheter une maison possédant le terrain où serait construite la nouvelle fromagerie. Nous avons besoin de votre soutien pour nous aider à financer le chantier de la fromagerie (73.000€) ainsi que l'achat d'équipements (24.000€).

Nous avons calculé l'objectif de ce crowdfunding en nous basant sur le minimum dont nous aurions besoin pour continuer l'aventure. Il est important de noter que des 67.000€ d'objectif, après le paiement des différents frais, ce seront en réalité 46.255€ qui nous reviendraient directement pour le chantier. 

Pour plus de clarté et de transparence, voici un petit fromage (c'est notre spécialité après tout) expliquant où ira l'argent exactement:

L'argent arrivera sur le compte bancaire de "FILO", association loi 1901 de solidarité internationale, créée pour promouvoir les liens culturels en la France et Armenia Mantequilla. La totalité de la somme récoltée sera ensuite envoyé pour le paiement du chantier en Colombie.

Bonne nouvelle si vous êtes une entreprise :  la tva non applicable sur le soutien financier que vous nous apporterez!

La fromagerie.

Notre fromagerie sera composée de caves à fromages semi-enterrées situées au sous-sol dont le coût de construction est estimé à 21.500€. Au rez-de-chaussée, un laboratoire de fabrication avec un local séparé dédié à l'emballage du fromage ainsi qu'un espace d'accueil et de vente seront construits pour un budget estimé à 25.500€.

Les équipements.

Si nous réussissons à dépasser l'objectif minimum, nous pourrons investir dans l'achat d'équipement pour la nouvelle fromagerie.

Nous possédons déjà du matériel que nous nous sommes procuré en réinvestissant les bénéfices engendrés par la fromagerie au fil du temps. Cependant l'espace sera plus grand et notre production également, l'achat d'équipements sera donc nécessaire pour fonctionner convenablement.

Entre autres: une machine à laver industrielle, une presse à fromage professionnelle, un chaudron à lait de 150 litres, des plans de travail en inox, du mobilier de stockage en bois pour les caves, des moules à fromage…

Pourquoi notre fromagerie est importante?

Notre projet comporte dans ses gênes une dimension sociale, politique et écologique forte.

Il faut le dire, s'installer au beau milieu de la Cordillère des Andes, pour produire du fromage artisanal à base de lait cru non pasteurisé - dans un pays ne possédant pas la culture de ce type de fromage - était un pari un peu fou.

Mais cette courageuse idée s’est révélée être un pari gagnant: nos fromages plaisent! De par leurs goûts à la fois doux et prononcés, leurs mélanges avec des épices colombiennes et leurs prix accessibles.

Sept ans maintenant que nous prouvons qu'il est possible de travailler  "avec et pour" les gens du village, tout en travaillant "avec et pour" la nature de nos montagnes.

Aujourd’hui, nous payons le lait à un meilleur prix que celui du marché traditionnel et sommes en train de convaincre les éleveurs de passer en élevage biologique en leur proposant une transition écologique douce et réalisable. Petit à petit, la vache fait son nid.

À Armenia Mantequilla, nous choisissons de travailler prioritairement avec des femmes cheffes de famille, afin d'apporter une indépendance financière. Actuellement Bonne Nature fonctionne grâce à trois fromagères à la production et à l'avenir notre équipe s'agrandira.

A terme, nous souhaiterions devenir une coopérative écologique et solidaire dont tous les membres tireraient des bénéfices en fonction de leur travail et investissement.

Si vous ne pouvez pas nous aider financièrement, il existe d'autres moyens.

Quelquefois, ce n’est juste pas possible d’apporter un soutien financier, on comprend! Heureusement une manière très efficace de nous aider est d’utiliser les outils de partage Indiegogo sur vos réseaux sociaux. L’idéal étant d’écrire une phrase de votre style (cela intéressera bien plus qu'un lien seul) expliquant pourquoi vous trouvez important de nous soutenir.

En ces temps de pandémie, des mots d'encouragement, des idées, des conseils nous donneront également la force de continuer.

Nous apprécierons réellement toutes les aides que vous pourrez nous apporter.

Merci!

L'équipe Bonne Nature.

 

ENGLISH VERSION.

Multicultural incipit.

In the Andes Mountains, in the Colombian village of Armenia Mantequilla, "Bonne Nature" was created.

Since 2014, we have been helping to develop our village by transforming the milk of the Andes cows into delicious "colombo-french" cheeses, worthy of the French tradition and at a price affordable to the majority of the Colombian population.

A few years ago, for financial reasons we transformed half of our home into a cheese factory (when you start out you have to make do with what you’ve got, right?)

But today, our dream is to build a real cheese factory - it has even become essential for us to continue to exist. We hope that this crowdfunding will help us do it: we have prepared a multitude of rewards that you will be able to receive in France as well as in many other countries!

Helping us in this project means supporting bottom-up globalisation by taking part in an ambitious local farming venture that crosses borders thanks to its multiculturalism! Let’s do this!

 

Help save Bonne Nature.

Hola everyone,

Our family business promotes the cultural mix between our two home countries - Colombia and France - through the creation of artisanal cheeses mixing French cheese-making know-how and products from the Colombian countryside.

Our Colombian-French family, the "MEJÍA MEJÍA" family, was born from the union between Luz Marina and John Jairo, welcomed by France in 1991.

After almost 25 years in the city of Lyon, Luz Marina decided to learn the art of French artisanal cheese and to return to Colombia to set up an organic cheese factory to help develop her native village: Armenia Mantequilla.

Rich in culture, landscape and nature, our village once prospered by processing its raw materials and diversifying its agricultural activities. But the industrial revolution, the rural exodus and unbridled globalisation have all taken their toll...

Bonne Nature was born out of our desire to create an inspiring ecological enterprise that would enhance local resources and that Armenia Mantequilla, Colombia and France could be proud of!

Let's build "Quesería de mi sin ti".

Our cheese factory which is also our home house no longer has enough space for our activity, nor cellars to mature our cheeses. To continue in these conditions is extremely hard on our cheese makers and is no longer economically viable.

That is why our dream today is to build a real cheese factory with cheese cellars so that we can increase our production and grow.

Why we need your help and where your contributions will go.

A bank loan has enabled us to buy a house with some land where the new cheese factory would be built. We need your support to help us finance the construction of the cheese factory (€73,000) and the purchase of equipment (€24,000).

We have calculated the crowdfunding target based on the minimum we need to continue the venture. It is important to note that after payment of the various fees, only 46,255€ of the 67,000€ target will actually go directly to the project.

For more clarity and transparency, here is a little cheese (it's our specialty after all) explaining where the money will go exactly:

The money will go to the bank account of "FILO", a charity under the law of 1901 for international solidarity, created to promote cultural links between France and Armenia Mantequilla. All of the money collected will then be sent to pay for the project in Colombia.

Good news if you are a company: there is no VAT on the financial support you donate!

The cheese factory.

Our cheese factory will be composed of semi-buried cheese cellars located in the basement. The construction cost is estimated at 21.500€. On the ground floor, a production laboratory with a separate room dedicated to packaging of the cheese as well as a reception and sales area will be built for an estimated budget of 25.500€.

Equipment.

If we manage to exceed the minimum target, we will be able to invest in the purchase of equipment for the new cheese factory.

We already have some equipment which we have purchased by reinvesting the profits from the cheese factory over time. However the space will be bigger and so will our production, so the purchase of equipment will be necessary in order to be able to operate properly.

Among others: an industrial washing machine, a professional cheese press, a 150 litre milk cauldron, stainless steel worktops, wooden storage furniture for the cellars, cheese moulds…

Why is our cheese factory important?

Our project has a strong social, political and ecological dimension.

It has to be said that setting up in the middle of the Andes Mountains to produce artisanal cheese made from unpasteurised raw milk - in a country with no culture of this type of cheese - was a bit of a gamble.

But this courageous idea turned out to be a winning bet: our cheeses are popular! With their mild yet pronounced flavours, their mixtures with Colombian spices and their affordable prices.

For seven years now, we have been proving that it is possible to work "with and for" the people of the village, while working "with and for" the nature of our mountains.

Today, we pay a better price for milk than the traditional market price and are convincing farmers to switch to organic farming by offering them a gentle and feasible ecological transition.

In Armenia Mantequilla, we choose to work primarily with female heads of household, in order to provide financial independence. At present, Bonne Nature is run by three women in production and in the future our team will grow.

In the long term, we would like to become an ecological and solidarity-based cooperative where all members receive benefits according to their work and investment.

If you can't help us financially, there are other ways.

Sometimes it's just not possible to give financial support, we understand! Fortunately a very effective way to help us is to use the Indiegogo sharing tools on your social networks. Ideally, you should write a sentence of your own (it will be much more interesting than a link alone) explaining why you think it is important to support us.

In these times of pandemic, words of encouragement, ideas and advice will also give us the strength to continue.

We really appreciate any help you can give us.

Thank you for your support!

The Bonne Nature team.

Gracias a sus sabores suaves pero pronunciados, por su mezcla con especias colombianas y por su precio asequible.Llevamos siete años demostrando que es posible trabajar "con y para" la gente del pueblo, al tiempo que se trabaja "con y para" la naturaleza de nuestras montañas.Hoy pagamos la leche a un precio mejor que el del mercado tradicional y convencemos a los ganaderos para que se pasen a la agricultura ecológica proponiendo una transición ecológica suave y factible. Poco a poco, llegaremos a nuestro objetivo.En Armenia Mantequilla, optamos por trabajar principalmente con mujeres cabeza de familia, con el fin de proporcionarles independencia financiera. Actualmente Bonne Nature está dirigida por tres mujeres en producción y si continuamos nuestro equipo crecerá.En el futuro, nos gustaría convertirnos en una cooperativa ecológica y solidaria en la que todos los socios obtengan beneficios en función de su trabajo e inversión.Si no puedes ayudarnos económicamente, hay otras maneras.A veces no es posible ayudar dando dinero, lo entendemos perfectamente. Felizmente, una forma muy eficaz es de ayudar es utilizar las herramientas Indiegogo para compartir en tus redes sociales. Lo ideal sería escribir una frase de tu inspiración (interesará más que un enlace solo) explicando por qué crees que es importante apoyarnos.En estos tiempos de pandemia, las palabras de ánimo, las ideas, los consejos también nos darán fuerzas para seguir adelante.Le agradecemos mucho cualquier ayuda que nos pueda prestar.Gracias por su apoyo.El equipo de Bonne Nature. VERSION FRANCAISE. Incipit multiculturel.Sur la Cordillère des Andes, dans le village colombien d'Armenia Mantequilla , a été créé  "Bonne Nature".Depuis 2014, nous aidons à développer notre village grâce à ses vaches de haute montagne, en transformant leur lait en délicieux fromages "colombo-français", dignes de la tradition française et à un prix abordable pour la majorité de la population colombienne.Il y a quelques années, des raisons financières nous ont amené à transformer la moitié de notre maison en fromagerie (quand on débute il faut savoir faire avec ce qu'on a, pas vrai?).Mais aujourd’hui, notre rêve est de construire une véritable fromagerie, cela nous est même devenu indispensable pour continuer d’exister. Nous espérons que ce financement participatif nous aidera à le faire: nous avons préparé une multitude de contreparties que vous pourrez recevoir autant en France que depuis un grand nombre de pays!Nous aider dans ce projet c'est soutenir que la mondialisation peut aussi se faire "par le bas" en prenant part à une ambitieuse aventure paysanne locale qui traverse les frontières grâce à son multiculturalisme! On y va?Sauvons Bonne Nature.Hola tout le monde,Notre entreprise familiale fait la promotion du métissage culturel entre nos deux pays de cœur - la Colombie et la France - via l'élaboration de fromages artisanaux mêlant le savoir-faire fromager français et les produits issus de la campagne colombienne.Notre famille colombo-française, les “MEJÍA MEJÍA”, est née de l'union entre Luz Marina et John Jairo, accueilli·e·s par la France en 1991.Après presque 25 années passées dans la ville de Lyon, Luz Marina décide d'apprendre l'art du fromage artisanal français et de rentrer en Colombie monter une fromagerie biologique pour aider à développer son village natal : Armenia Mantequilla.Riche en culture, paysage et nature, notre village prospérait autrefois en transformant ses matières premières et en diversifiant ses activités agricoles. Mais la révolution industrielle, l'exode rural et une mondialisation effrénée sont passés par là…Bonne Nature est donc née de notre volonté de créer une entreprise écologique inspirante, qui magnifierait les ressources locales et dont Armenia Mantequilla, la Colombie et la France pourraient être fiers!Construisons la "Quesería de mi sin ti".Notre maison improvisée en fromagerie ne possède plus d'espace suffisant pour notre activité, ni de caves pour affiner nos fromages. Continuer dans ces conditions est extrêmement éprouvant pour nos fromagères et n'est plus viable économiquement.Voilà pourquoi notre rêve aujourd'hui est de construire une véritable fromagerie avec des caves à fromage afin de pouvoir augmenter notre production et croître.Pourquoi nous avons besoin de votre aide et où iront vos contributions.Un prêt bancaire nous a permis d'acheter une maison possédant le terrain où serait construite la nouvelle fromagerie. Nous avons besoin de votre soutien pour nous aider à financer le chantier de la fromagerie (73.000€) ainsi que l'achat d'équipements (24.000€).Nous avons calculé l'objectif de ce crowdfunding en nous basant sur le minimum dont nous aurions besoin pour continuer l'aventure. Il est important de noter que des 67.000€ d'objectif, après le paiement des différents frais, ce seront en réalité 46.255€ qui nous reviendraient directement pour le chantier. Pour plus de clarté et de transparence, voici un petit fromage (c'est notre spécialité après tout) expliquant où ira l'argent exactement:L'argent arrivera sur le compte bancaire de "FILO", association loi 1901 de solidarité internationale, créée pour promouvoir les liens culturels en la France et Armenia Mantequilla. La totalité de la somme récoltée sera ensuite envoyé pour le paiement du chantier en Colombie.Bonne nouvelle si vous êtes une entreprise :  la tva non applicable sur le soutien financier que vous nous apporterez!La fromagerie.Notre fromagerie sera composée de caves à fromages semi-enterrées situées au sous-sol dont le coût de construction est estimé à 21.500€. Au rez-de-chaussée, un laboratoire de fabrication avec un local séparé dédié à l'emballage du fromage ainsi qu'un espace d'accueil et de vente seront construits pour un budget estimé à 25.500€.Les équipements.Si nous réussissons à dépasser l'objectif minimum, nous pourrons investir dans l'achat d'équipement pour la nouvelle fromagerie.Nous possédons déjà du matériel que nous nous sommes procuré en réinvestissant les bénéfices engendrés par la fromagerie au fil du temps. Cependant l'espace sera plus grand et notre production également, l'achat d'équipements sera donc nécessaire pour fonctionner convenablement.Entre autres: une machine à laver industrielle, une presse à fromage professionnelle, un chaudron à lait de 150 litres, des plans de travail en inox, du mobilier de stockage en bois pour les caves, des moules à fromage…Pourquoi notre fromagerie est importante?Notre projet comporte dans ses gênes une dimension sociale, politique et écologique forte.Il faut le dire, s'installer au beau milieu de la Cordillère des Andes, pour produire du fromage artisanal à base de lait cru non pasteurisé - dans un pays ne possédant pas la culture de ce type de fromage - était un pari un peu fou.Mais cette courageuse idée s’est révélée être un pari gagnant: nos fromages plaisent! De par leurs goûts à la fois doux et prononcés, leurs mélanges avec des épices colombiennes et leurs prix accessibles.Sept ans maintenant que nous prouvons qu'il est possible de travailler  "avec et pour" les gens du village, tout en travaillant "avec et pour" la nature de nos montagnes.Aujourd’hui, nous payons le lait à un meilleur prix que celui du marché traditionnel et sommes en train de convaincre les éleveurs de passer en élevage biologique en leur proposant une transition écologique douce et réalisable. Petit à petit, la vache fait son nid.À Armenia Mantequilla, nous choisissons de travailler prioritairement avec des femmes cheffes de famille, afin d'apporter une indépendance financière. Actuellement Bonne Nature fonctionne grâce à trois fromagères à la production et à l'avenir notre équipe s'agrandira.A terme, nous souhaiterions devenir une coopérative écologique et solidaire dont tous les membres tireraient des bénéfices en fonction de leur travail et investissement.Si vous ne pouvez pas nous aider financièrement, il existe d'autres moyens.Quelquefois, ce n’est juste pas possible d’apporter un soutien financier, on comprend! Heureusement une manière très efficace de nous aider est d’utiliser les outils de partage Indiegogo sur vos réseaux sociaux. L’idéal étant d’écrire une phrase de votre style (cela intéressera bien plus qu'un lien seul) expliquant pourquoi vous trouvez important de nous soutenir.En ces temps de pandémie, des mots d'encouragement, des idées, des conseils nous donneront également la force de continuer.Nous apprécierons réellement toutes les aides que vous pourrez nous apporter.Merci!L'équipe Bonne Nature. ENGLISH VERSION.Multicultural incipit.In the Andes Mountains, in the Colombian village of Armenia Mantequilla, "Bonne Nature" was created.Since 2014, we have been helping to develop our village by transforming the milk of the Andes cows into delicious "colombo-french" cheeses, worthy of the French tradition and at a price affordable to the majority of the Colombian population.A few years ago, for financial reasons we transformed half of our home into a cheese factory (when you start out you have to make do with what you’ve got, right?)But today, our dream is to build a real cheese factory - it has even become essential for us to continue to exist. We hope that this crowdfunding will help us do it: we have prepared a multitude of rewards that you will be able to receive in France as well as in many other countries!Helping us in this project means supporting bottom-up globalisation by taking part in an ambitious local farming venture that crosses borders thanks to its multiculturalism! Let’s do this! Help save Bonne Nature.Hola everyone,Our family business promotes the cultural mix between our two home countries - Colombia and France - through the creation of artisanal cheeses mixing French cheese-making know-how and products from the Colombian countryside.Our Colombian-French family, the "MEJÍA MEJÍA" family, was born from the union between Luz Marina and John Jairo, welcomed by France in 1991.After almost 25 years in the city of Lyon, Luz Marina decided to learn the art of French artisanal cheese and to return to Colombia to set up an organic cheese factory to help develop her native village: Armenia Mantequilla.Rich in culture, landscape and nature, our village once prospered by processing its raw materials and diversifying its agricultural activities. But the industrial revolution, the rural exodus and unbridled globalisation have all taken their toll...Bonne Nature was born out of our desire to create an inspiring ecological enterprise that would enhance local resources and that Armenia Mantequilla, Colombia and France could be proud of!Let's build "Quesería de mi sin ti".Our cheese factory which is also our home house no longer has enough space for our activity, nor cellars to mature our cheeses. To continue in these conditions is extremely hard on our cheese makers and is no longer economically viable.That is why our dream today is to build a real cheese factory with cheese cellars so that we can increase our production and grow.Why we need your help and where your contributions will go.A bank loan has enabled us to buy a house with some land where the new cheese factory would be built. We need your support to help us finance the construction of the cheese factory (€73,000) and the purchase of equipment (€24,000).We have calculated the crowdfunding target based on the minimum we need to continue the venture. It is important to note that after payment of the various fees, only 46,255€ of the 67,000€ target will actually go directly to the project.For more clarity and transparency, here is a little cheese (it's our specialty after all) explaining where the money will go exactly:The money will go to the bank account of "FILO", a charity under the law of 1901 for international solidarity, created to promote cultural links between France and Armenia Mantequilla. All of the money collected will then be sent to pay for the project in Colombia.Good news if you are a company: there is no VAT on the financial support you donate!The cheese factory.Our cheese factory will be composed of semi-buried cheese cellars located in the basement. The construction cost is estimated at 21.500€. On the ground floor, a production laboratory with a separate room dedicated to packaging of the cheese as well as a reception and sales area will be built for an estimated budget of 25.500€.Equipment.If we manage to exceed the minimum target, we will be able to invest in the purchase of equipment for the new cheese factory.We already have some equipment which we have purchased by reinvesting the profits from the cheese factory over time. However the space will be bigger and so will our production, so the purchase of equipment will be necessary in order to be able to operate properly.Among others: an industrial washing machine, a professional cheese press, a 150 litre milk cauldron, stainless steel worktops, wooden storage furniture for the cellars, cheese moulds…Why is our cheese factory important?Our project has a strong social, political and ecological dimension.It has to be said that setting up in the middle of the Andes Mountains to produce artisanal cheese made from unpasteurised raw milk - in a country with no culture of this type of cheese - was a bit of a gamble.But this courageous idea turned out to be a winning bet: our cheeses are popular! With their mild yet pronounced flavours, their mixtures with Colombian spices and their affordable prices.For seven years now, we have been proving that it is possible to work "with and for" the people of the village, while working "with and for" the nature of our mountains.Today, we pay a better price for milk than the traditional market price and are convincing farmers to switch to organic farming by offering them a gentle and feasible ecological transition.In Armenia Mantequilla, we choose to work primarily with female heads of household, in order to provide financial independence. At present, Bonne Nature is run by three women in production and in the future our team will grow.In the long term, we would like to become an ecological and solidarity-based cooperative where all members receive benefits according to their work and investment.If you can't help us financially, there are other ways.Sometimes it's just not possible to give financial support, we understand! Fortunately a very effective way to help us is to use the Indiegogo sharing tools on your social networks. Ideally, you should write a sentence of your own (it will be much more interesting than a link alone) explaining why you think it is important to support us.In these times of pandemic, words of encouragement, ideas and advice will also give us the strength to continue.We really appreciate any help you can give us.Thank you for your support!The Bonne Nature team.

story:
Who are Fattoria Valle Magica?

We are Ralph, Ninke and Elizabeth (plus the kids, Airik, Lucian, Anakin & Nimue). We chose to leave the rat-race to create a more meaningful life by establishing a 100% off grid, eco-sustainable farm. We are located on the edge of Italy’s 3rd biggest nature reserve. We are passionate about what we do, what we produce, how we do it, but most importantly…. why we do it!

We want to provide a place that teaches people how well animals used to be cared for and provides products reminiscent of how good food used to taste.

Chi è Fattoria Valle Magica?

Siamo Ralph, Ninke ed Elizabeth (più i bambini, Airik, Lucian, Anakin e Nimue). Abbiamo scelto di lasciare la corsa al successo per creare una vita più significativa creando una fattoria ecosostenibile al 100% fuori rete. Ci troviamo ai margini della terza riserva naturale più grande d'Italia. Siamo appassionati di ciò che facciamo, di ciò che produciamo, di come lo facciamo, ma soprattutto…. perché lo facciamo!

Vogliamo fornire un luogo che insegni alle persone quanto bene si prendevano cura degli animali e fornire prodotti che ricordino il sapore del buon cibo. 

 

 

We started from scratch 5 years ago on land that used to be a farm formerly owned by the convent of Carapelle Calvisio but was abandoned shortly after the 2nd World War. We are now at a critical point in the development of our story, which, due to the global pandemic, we need your help to achieve.

Siamo partiti da zero 5 anni fa su un terreno che era una fattoria un tempo di proprietà del convento delle Carapelle Calvisio ma che è stato abbandonato poco dopo la seconda guerra mondiale. Siamo ora a un punto critico nello sviluppo della nostra storia, che, a causa della pandemia globale, abbiamo bisogno del tuo aiuto per raggiungere. 

 

 

 

Our Objectives

Our goal is to achieve the remaining funding we require to enable us to build an eco structure  with off grid solar power, handicapped facilities and an outdoor area, that will be used as a shop, a cheese lab and a location to host school visits, workshops and much more.

I nostri obiettivi

Il nostro obiettivo è ottenere il finanziamento rimanente di cui abbiamo bisogno per permetterci di costruire una struttura ecologica con energia solare fuori rete, strutture per i handicap e un'area esterna, che sarà utilizzata come negozio, laboratorio di formaggi e luogo per ospitare visite scolastiche, workshop e molto altro ancora.

 

In return for helping us achieve this funding we will match all donations by donating an equal value of our certified, 100% natural food products, to Italian families in genuine need. This donation will be made via established charities that specialise in helping disadvantaged, hungry families in Italy.

We believe that this campaign is an opportunity to gain help and support in achieving our goals but also in helping those less fortunate than us. With over 5,000,000 (Five Million) people in Italy below the poverty line and children going without sufficient food, we are in a privileged position to have food that we can donate.

In cambio di averci aiutato a raggiungere questo finanziamento, compenseremo tutte le donazioni donando un valore uguale dei nostri prodotti alimentari certificati, 100% naturali, a famiglie italiane in vero bisogno. Questa donazione verrà effettuata tramite enti di beneficenza affermati specializzati nell'aiutare le famiglie svantaggiate e affamate in Italia.

Crediamo che questa campagna sia un'opportunità per ottenere aiuto e supporto nel raggiungimento dei nostri obiettivi ma anche per aiutare chi è meno fortunato di noi. Con oltre 5.000.000 (cinque milioni) di persone in Italia al di sotto della soglia di povertà e bambini senza cibo sufficiente, siamo in una posizione privilegiata per avere cibo che possiamo donare.

 

 

Win:Win:Win

 

A win for us!

Through your support and donation, we can achieve the funding to help us build the eco-structure we have planned and create all the benefits it supports. These benefits include but are not limited to a shop location, a cheese lab, job creation, opening for schools, opening for disabled visitors, ability to offer workshops, solar energy to extend our off-grid, eco-sustainable approach and  increasing local eco-tourism.

Una vittoria per noi!

Attraverso il tuo sostegno e la tua donazione, possiamo ottenere i finanziamenti per aiutarci a costruire l'eco-struttura che abbiamo progettato e creare tutti i benefici che fornisce. Questi vantaggi includono un negozio, un laboratorio di formaggi, la creazione di posti di lavoro, l'apertura per le scuole, l'apertura per i visitatori disabili, la capacità di offrire laboratori, l'energia solare per estendere il nostro approccio off-grid, ecosostenibile e l'aumento dell'eco-turismo della zona.

 

A win for the hungry families!

 

Through your giving, you will not only help us but you will enable us to gift our natural food products to Italians who need help and support to feed their families. This giving will be achieved via the following established charities:

Una vittoria per le famiglie affamate!

Attraverso le tue donazioni, non solo ci aiuterai, ma ci consentirai di regalare i nostri prodotti alimentari naturali agli italiani che hanno bisogno di aiuto e sostegno per nutrire le loro famiglie. Questa donazione sarà ottenuta tramite i seguenti enti di beneficenza stabiliti:​

​      

 

​

 

 

A win for you!

Having helped us and helped families in need there is also something in it for you. Every contributor will be thanked by us and recognised for their donation but in addition, depending on the level of giving you would like to provide there are some additional fantastic perks you can choose from including: a natural soap, virtual farm visits, group farm visits, workshops on the farm, private booking of the farm, sponsorship of one of our rare breed areas (signage included), planting of trees and much more.

 

Una vittoria per te!

Avendo aiutato noi e aiutato le famiglie bisognose, c'è anche qualcosa per te. Ogni collaboratore sarà ringraziato da noi e riconosciuto per la sua donazione, ma in aggiunta, a seconda del livello di donazione che vorresti fornire, ci sono alcuni fantastici vantaggi aggiuntivi tra cui puoi scegliere: un sapone naturale, visite alla fattoria virtuali, visite di gruppo alla fattoria , laboratori in fattoria, prenotazione privata della fattoria, sponsorizzazione di una delle nostre rare aree di razza (segnaletica inclusa), piantumazione di alberi e molto altro ancora.

 

 

What We Need, What We Donate & What You Get

 

What we need to achieve:

The overall project, including solar power and some additional equipment, will cost over €170000. We have already funded some of the materials and costs and we have received €90,000 of government funding, leaving us a funding gap of €50,000 to achieve.

 

What we will Donate:

We have ample stock value of products to cover this gap, but the current pandemic is causing challenges around selling quickly enough to meet our timescales. We will therefore match all donations to help us with an equal value of food donation via recognised charities to help families in need.

 

What You Will Get:

Please take a moment to browse each of our fantastic perks and see what level of giving is right for you and which of the perks you may like to benefit from. We are also open to ideas and suggestions for the creation of tailored perks if you have something in mind... by all means ask us and we will see what is possible... 

 

 

Cosa ci serve, cosa doniamo e cosa ottieni

 

Cosa dobbiamo ottenere:

Il progetto complessivo, inclusa l'energia solare e alcune apparecchiature aggiuntive, avrà un costo di oltre 170000 €. Abbiamo già finanziato alcuni dei materiali e dei costi e abbiamo ricevuto 90.000 € di finanziamenti governativi, lasciandoci un deficit di finanziamento di 50.000 € da raggiungere.

 

Cosa doneremo:

Abbiamo un ampio valore di prodotti per coprire questo divario, ma l'attuale pandemia sta causando difficoltà nel vendere abbastanza rapidamente da rispettare i nostri tempi. Pertanto combineremo tutte le donazioni per aiutarci con un uguale valore della donazione di cibo tramite enti di beneficenza riconosciuti per aiutare le famiglie bisognose.

 

Cosa otterrai:

Prenditi un momento per sfogliare ciascuno dei nostri fantastici vantaggi e vedere quale livello di donazione è giusto per te e di quali vantaggi potresti beneficiare. Siamo aperti anche a idee e suggerimenti per la creazione di vantaggi su misura se avete qualcosa in mente ... chiedeteci assolutamente e vedremo cosa è possibile ...

 

 

 

What if we don't make our full target?

​We have committed to building this structure. We have already purchased many of the materials so it will be built although we may have to do so over a greatly extended period and at a much greater cost to the family as we will lose the government funding we have been offered.

If we fail to reach our goal then we will have to seek costly finance that will put stress on all of us and risk the future of our business.

Whichever way, every penny raised will be invested into improving the facilities on the farm for visitors and animals alike and every penny that is donated will be 100% matched with a food donation to the specified charities. We also guarantee the perks selected by all backers will be fulfilled!

 

E se non raggiungiamo il nostro obiettivo completo?

Ci siamo impegnati a costruire questa struttura. Abbiamo già acquistato molti dei materiali, quindi verrà costruito, anche se dovremo farlo per un periodo molto lungo e con un costo molto maggiore per la famiglia in quanto perderemo il finanziamento governativo che ci è stato offerto.

Se non riusciamo a raggiungere il nostro obiettivo, dovremo cercare finanziamenti costosi che metteranno sotto stress tutti noi e rischieranno il futuro della nostra attività.

In ogni caso, ogni centesimo raccolto verrà investito nel miglioramento delle strutture della fattoria per i visitatori e gli animali allo stesso modo e ogni centesimo donato sarà abbinato al 100% a una donazione di cibo agli enti di beneficenza specificati. Garantiamo inoltre che i vantaggi selezionati da tutti i sostenitori saranno soddisfatti! 

 

Why this means so much to us:

We really hope you chose and are able to support our worthwhile cause and make a huge difference both for us and also for needy families in Italy. The realisation of this project will bring together 5 years of work, effort and dreams. To be able to open our doors to schools and societies for the disabled is something we are so excited to do. We can only hope that you will be inspired by our vision and decide to support us. If you have any questions you'd like us to answer please let us know and please watch out for updates!

 

Perché significa così tanto per noi:

Speriamo davvero che tu abbia scelto e sia in grado di sostenere la nostra valida causa e fare un'enorme differenza sia per noi che per le famiglie bisognose in Italia. La realizzazione di questo progetto riunirà 5 anni di lavoro, impegno e sogni. Essere in grado di aprire le nostre porte a scuole e società per disabili è qualcosa che siamo così entusiasti di fare. Possiamo solo sperare che sarai ispirato dalla nostra visione e deciderai di sostenerci. Se hai domande a cui vorresti che rispondessimo, faccelo sapere e fai attenzione agli aggiornamenti! 

 

If you personally find yourself unable to support financially you can still help us by spreading the word and letting others know about our story, our goals and the needs we are trying to support.

Please mention us to friends, family, colleagues or use one of the tools to share it to your social media accounts.

Se personalmente trovate in grado di sostenere finanziariamente si può ancora aiutarci diffondendo la parola e lasciare che gli altri conoscono la nostra storia, i nostri obiettivi e le esigenze che stiamo cercando di sostenere.

Per favore, menzionaci ad amici, familiari, colleghi o usa uno degli strumenti per condividerlo con i tuoi account sui social media.

Siamo appassionati di ciò che facciamo, di ciò che produciamo, di come lo facciamo, ma soprattutto…. perché lo facciamo!Vogliamo fornire un luogo che insegni alle persone quanto bene si prendevano cura degli animali e fornire prodotti che ricordino il sapore del buon cibo.   We started from scratch 5 years ago on land that used to be a farm formerly owned by the convent of Carapelle Calvisio but was abandoned shortly after the 2nd World War. We are now at a critical point in the development of our story, which, due to the global pandemic, we need your help to achieve.Siamo partiti da zero 5 anni fa su un terreno che era una fattoria un tempo di proprietà del convento delle Carapelle Calvisio ma che è stato abbandonato poco dopo la seconda guerra mondiale. Siamo ora a un punto critico nello sviluppo della nostra storia, che, a causa della pandemia globale, abbiamo bisogno del tuo aiuto per raggiungere.    Our ObjectivesOur goal is to achieve the remaining funding we require to enable us to build an eco structure  with off grid solar power, handicapped facilities and an outdoor area, that will be used as a shop, a cheese lab and a location to host school visits, workshops and much more.I nostri obiettiviIl nostro obiettivo è ottenere il finanziamento rimanente di cui abbiamo bisogno per permetterci di costruire una struttura ecologica con energia solare fuori rete, strutture per i handicap e un'area esterna, che sarà utilizzata come negozio, laboratorio di formaggi e luogo per ospitare visite scolastiche, workshop e molto altro ancora. In return for helping us achieve this funding we will match all donations by donating an equal value of our certified, 100% natural food products, to Italian families in genuine need. This donation will be made via established charities that specialise in helping disadvantaged, hungry families in Italy.We believe that this campaign is an opportunity to gain help and support in achieving our goals but also in helping those less fortunate than us. With over 5,000,000 (Five Million) people in Italy below the poverty line and children going without sufficient food, we are in a privileged position to have food that we can donate.In cambio di averci aiutato a raggiungere questo finanziamento, compenseremo tutte le donazioni donando un valore uguale dei nostri prodotti alimentari certificati, 100% naturali, a famiglie italiane in vero bisogno. Questa donazione verrà effettuata tramite enti di beneficenza affermati specializzati nell'aiutare le famiglie svantaggiate e affamate in Italia.Crediamo che questa campagna sia un'opportunità per ottenere aiuto e supporto nel raggiungimento dei nostri obiettivi ma anche per aiutare chi è meno fortunato di noi. Con oltre 5.000.000 (cinque milioni) di persone in Italia al di sotto della soglia di povertà e bambini senza cibo sufficiente, siamo in una posizione privilegiata per avere cibo che possiamo donare.  Win:Win:Win A win for us!Through your support and donation, we can achieve the funding to help us build the eco-structure we have planned and create all the benefits it supports. These benefits include but are not limited to a shop location, a cheese lab, job creation, opening for schools, opening for disabled visitors, ability to offer workshops, solar energy to extend our off-grid, eco-sustainable approach and  increasing local eco-tourism.Una vittoria per noi!Attraverso il tuo sostegno e la tua donazione, possiamo ottenere i finanziamenti per aiutarci a costruire l'eco-struttura che abbiamo progettato e creare tutti i benefici che fornisce. Questi vantaggi includono un negozio, un laboratorio di formaggi, la creazione di posti di lavoro, l'apertura per le scuole, l'apertura per i visitatori disabili, la capacità di offrire laboratori, l'energia solare per estendere il nostro approccio off-grid, ecosostenibile e l'aumento dell'eco-turismo della zona. A win for the hungry families! Through your giving, you will not only help us but you will enable us to gift our natural food products to Italians who need help and support to feed their families. This giving will be achieved via the following established charities:Una vittoria per le famiglie affamate!Attraverso le tue donazioni, non solo ci aiuterai, ma ci consentirai di regalare i nostri prodotti alimentari naturali agli italiani che hanno bisogno di aiuto e sostegno per nutrire le loro famiglie. Questa donazione sarà ottenuta tramite i seguenti enti di beneficenza stabiliti:​​       ​  A win for you!Having helped us and helped families in need there is also something in it for you. Every contributor will be thanked by us and recognised for their donation but in addition, depending on the level of giving you would like to provide there are some additional fantastic perks you can choose from including: a natural soap, virtual farm visits, group farm visits, workshops on the farm, private booking of the farm, sponsorship of one of our rare breed areas (signage included), planting of trees and much more. Una vittoria per te!Avendo aiutato noi e aiutato le famiglie bisognose, c'è anche qualcosa per te. Ogni collaboratore sarà ringraziato da noi e riconosciuto per la sua donazione, ma in aggiunta, a seconda del livello di donazione che vorresti fornire, ci sono alcuni fantastici vantaggi aggiuntivi tra cui puoi scegliere: un sapone naturale, visite alla fattoria virtuali, visite di gruppo alla fattoria , laboratori in fattoria, prenotazione privata della fattoria, sponsorizzazione di una delle nostre rare aree di razza (segnaletica inclusa), piantumazione di alberi e molto altro ancora.  What We Need, What We Donate & What You Get What we need to achieve:The overall project, including solar power and some additional equipment, will cost over €170000. We have already funded some of the materials and costs and we have received €90,000 of government funding, leaving us a funding gap of €50,000 to achieve. What we will Donate:We have ample stock value of products to cover this gap, but the current pandemic is causing challenges around selling quickly enough to meet our timescales. We will therefore match all donations to help us with an equal value of food donation via recognised charities to help families in need. What You Will Get:Please take a moment to browse each of our fantastic perks and see what level of giving is right for you and which of the perks you may like to benefit from. We are also open to ideas and suggestions for the creation of tailored perks if you have something in mind... by all means ask us and we will see what is possible...   Cosa ci serve, cosa doniamo e cosa ottieni Cosa dobbiamo ottenere:Il progetto complessivo, inclusa l'energia solare e alcune apparecchiature aggiuntive, avrà un costo di oltre 170000 €. Abbiamo già finanziato alcuni dei materiali e dei costi e abbiamo ricevuto 90.000 € di finanziamenti governativi, lasciandoci un deficit di finanziamento di 50.000 € da raggiungere. Cosa doneremo:Abbiamo un ampio valore di prodotti per coprire questo divario, ma l'attuale pandemia sta causando difficoltà nel vendere abbastanza rapidamente da rispettare i nostri tempi. Pertanto combineremo tutte le donazioni per aiutarci con un uguale valore della donazione di cibo tramite enti di beneficenza riconosciuti per aiutare le famiglie bisognose. Cosa otterrai:Prenditi un momento per sfogliare ciascuno dei nostri fantastici vantaggi e vedere quale livello di donazione è giusto per te e di quali vantaggi potresti beneficiare. Siamo aperti anche a idee e suggerimenti per la creazione di vantaggi su misura se avete qualcosa in mente ... chiedeteci assolutamente e vedremo cosa è possibile ...   What if we don't make our full target?​We have committed to building this structure. We have already purchased many of the materials so it will be built although we may have to do so over a greatly extended period and at a much greater cost to the family as we will lose the government funding we have been offered.If we fail to reach our goal then we will have to seek costly finance that will put stress on all of us and risk the future of our business.Whichever way, every penny raised will be invested into improving the facilities on the farm for visitors and animals alike and every penny that is donated will be 100% matched with a food donation to the specified charities. We also guarantee the perks selected by all backers will be fulfilled! E se non raggiungiamo il nostro obiettivo completo?Ci siamo impegnati a costruire questa struttura. Abbiamo già acquistato molti dei materiali, quindi verrà costruito, anche se dovremo farlo per un periodo molto lungo e con un costo molto maggiore per la famiglia in quanto perderemo il finanziamento governativo che ci è stato offerto.Se non riusciamo a raggiungere il nostro obiettivo, dovremo cercare finanziamenti costosi che metteranno sotto stress tutti noi e rischieranno il futuro della nostra attività.In ogni caso, ogni centesimo raccolto verrà investito nel miglioramento delle strutture della fattoria per i visitatori e gli animali allo stesso modo e ogni centesimo donato sarà abbinato al 100% a una donazione di cibo agli enti di beneficenza specificati. Garantiamo inoltre che i vantaggi selezionati da tutti i sostenitori saranno soddisfatti!  Why this means so much to us:We really hope you chose and are able to support our worthwhile cause and make a huge difference both for us and also for needy families in Italy. The realisation of this project will bring together 5 years of work, effort and dreams. To be able to open our doors to schools and societies for the disabled is something we are so excited to do. We can only hope that you will be inspired by our vision and decide to support us. If you have any questions you'd like us to answer please let us know and please watch out for updates! Perché significa così tanto per noi:Speriamo davvero che tu abbia scelto e sia in grado di sostenere la nostra valida causa e fare un'enorme differenza sia per noi che per le famiglie bisognose in Italia. La realizzazione di questo progetto riunirà 5 anni di lavoro, impegno e sogni. Essere in grado di aprire le nostre porte a scuole e società per disabili è qualcosa che siamo così entusiasti di fare. Possiamo solo sperare che sarai ispirato dalla nostra visione e deciderai di sostenerci. Se hai domande a cui vorresti che rispondessimo, faccelo sapere e fai attenzione agli aggiornamenti!  If you personally find yourself unable to support financially you can still help us by spreading the word and letting others know about our story, our goals and the needs we are trying to support.Please mention us to friends, family, colleagues or use one of the tools to share it to your social media accounts.Se personalmente trovate in grado di sostenere finanziariamente si può ancora aiutarci diffondendo la parola e lasciare che gli altri conoscono la nostra storia, i nostri obiettivi e le esigenze che stiamo cercando di sostenere.Per favore, menzionaci ad amici, familiari, colleghi o usa uno degli strumenti per condividerlo con i tuoi account sui social media.

story:
What is Coin Arcade Bar?

Coin is a retro arcade and bar filled with professionally restored 80's and 90's arcade and pinballs featuring craft beer from regional breweries and retro inspired fresh signature cocktails.

Games will be .25 to .75 cents each and will featured a simple food menu to satisfy your snack craving while you drink and game.

 

How this all began

Six years ago, when our second daughter was born, I was pushing too hard at work, not sleeping (newborns, am i right?) and I wound up with a needle in my spine at 3am at Lehigh Valley Hospital. I got pretty sick and had to spent 5 days alone in a room thinking.

It was a big wakeup call and made me realize I needed to get my priorities in line with what made me feel alive and what I wanted to do in life. So in true 80's rebellious fashion, I booked a flight to LA to see the world and visit some friends. I ended up visiting ''82'' an arcade bar that changed my world. It was a Friday night and it was packed. No tv's, 3 bartenders and arcade games, pinballs and an amazing DJ to complete the vibe. "This would be amazing to have back home."

And that's when the seed was planted. Fast forward to November 2017, I bought my first arcade machine and was all in on a mission to open the first Arcade Bar in the Lehigh Valley.

 

Why Does This Matter?

The Lehigh Valley is growing and developing into a better city everyday. We want to be a part of this growth. We also want to help develop a market we feel needs improving. The Bar Arcade.

Arcades are getting harder and harder to find. The classics have basically disappeared from the public eye. Today, most of them are either collecting dust in warehouses or in the basements of collectors' homes. Let's change that!

This place will finally give us something to do other than to sit at the bar and drink. After all, arcade games have been found in bars since their conception. We want to provide that experience for people again. A place built by the people, for the people.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Here's how it breaks down:

  • A tap system from Micromatic complete with glycol chilled lines (an awesome bar tap design, Mario inspired!)
  • Bar stools, chairs, places to set drinks and lounge when you are aren't gaming and want to chill
  • A pinball machine (Addams Family/ Twilight Zone) or 2-3 (Tapper, Joust, Star Wars) more arcade games

The prizes:

  • Old school, Coin designed swag (bottle openers, shirts, stickers, fanny packs, coin holders)
  • Your (company) name, immortalized (plaques on bar stools, engraved bricks at the bar, sponsored arcade and pinball machines)
  • Year long drink perks/ mug club
  • The ultimate VIP experience, enjoy a private party before we open doors to the public
  • **Donate $50+ and you'll be entered to win a Ms. Pac Man arcade**

 

The Impact

Over 98% of Lehigh Valley residents said that we need something new to do.  Coin will be a place where all are welcome to come (21+) and get bit by the nostalgia bug. This is something that has been reserved for other cities but it's about time we get one here, done the right way. We have a hockey and baseball arena but still don't have a bar arcade; and we're here to create an experience different from any other bar in the valley and we want you to be a part of it.

 

 

Where we are at

It's taken me 18 months to track down, repair and restore enough games to be able to open Coin the proper way. With over $25k already invested and loans/grants already approved, our aim is to do this right from day one. The support has been amazing on our Facebook and Instagram as well as everyone who's been to our pop-ups. We've been featured on WFMZ and Lehigh Valley Live and are now finally close to finding a long term home.

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please help get word out to your friends and come to our pop up starting Sept 20th at 21 N 7th Street (across from Queen City BBQ) and make some noise.
  • Share this campaign on your Facebook/ IG/ Twitter 
  • Consider donating that arcade game thats sitting in your garage/basement (you wouldn't be the first!)

 

And that's all there is to it.
