story:
Short Summary

Hey there! We are Lena Gosik-Wolfe and Melissa Paterson, two creative service providers who came together over a passion for three things that are really important to us. Building strong foundations in business, bringing people together with the experts they need to grow and maintain a solid business, and all things animals (dogs, cats, and guinea pigs are our particular specialty).

This campaign has been created to culminate our months of work creating a space online for entrepreneurs to build their business through community, commitment, and guidance. This space is a membership platform called Lumynary. It’s a place to connect with industry-leading experts whose skills and knowledge are the cornerstone to building a successful foundation for any business. Our members will have access to these experts to ask questions, create relationships and learn from them to grow their business and to get the support they need as they need it, affordably, rather than spending hours trying to Google their way through answers and potentially wasting money on the things they don’t need to focus on (right away).

When you contribute to our campaign you will be helping us reach, support, and deliver Lumynary to entrepreneurs around the world so that they can deliver their dreams and the passion behind their business to the world.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking for $8000 in funding which we will use to help boost our efforts in reaching a wider variety of entrepreneurs. Through targeted Facebook ads, Instagram ads, and Google Adwords we hope to connect with entrepreneurs ready to get out of the Google trap and get on the court with their business through action-oriented guidance. 

We’ve always worked with Makers and Artisans, who we love to pieces, but we also want to reach creative service owners, new startups, mom & pop shops, or anyone who has a dream to run a business and who doesn’t know where to begin or is looking to discover that next step. This could be anything from hiring a team, expanding and scaling, manufacturing, wholesale and distribution or retirement. We believe that what’s next is just as important as building strong foundations.

Our perks for contributing are designed to have you EXPERIENCE Lumynary in your life. Here’s some of what we have lined up:

1-Hour Critique - For every $75 donated you’ll receive a 1-hour critique of either your brand (Lena) or website (Melissa). With a combined 15 years of experience in the branding and web design and development fields, we love helping you understand and see the blind spots in your business. A critique can show you exactly where things are working, aren’t working and what steps you can take to improve your brand or website. Critiques are regularly priced at $150.

1-Hour Video Critique for Brand + Website - For every $100 donated you’ll receive a 1-hour video critique from both Lena and Melissa. What’s better than making sure your brand is representing your business properly and ensuring that your website carries that voice forward as you sell your services? Nothing, we say!

Discounted Year of Program Membership - For every $750 donation, you will lock in your discounted membership rate for one year. Regularly $997 (for introductory members only).

ONE Lifetime Membership - For $2500 you will get lifetime access to Lumynary and never have to pay a monthly fee for all of the perks. As we mentioned, Lumynary members get access to experts but also guest experts and their award-winning services and programs at a discounted member-only rate. Plus access to our Pathfinder quiz, which as you evolve and grow, continues to grow with you. Our library of member-only content is curated by our amazing support staff who are available to you whenever you have a question or need support. 

Our goal is $8000 but even if we don’t reach our goal the funds will continue to drive forward our outreach as much as possible.

 

The Impact

Lumynary is unlike any other membership service. Our experts are a part of our team and we fully believe in creating partnerships and promoting teamwork in every area of business. Without this, Lumynary would not have been born. 

Lumynary provides access and breaks down the barriers between entrepreneur and expert. Who knew a lawyer could also be your partner in seeing your business grow? Or an SEO guru could help you understand how to get your website found in one simple interaction? 

From our own personal years of experience, we have seen clients who implement community, commitment and take the guidance of experts to explode their businesses and their impact on the world. We have many clients who donate proceeds from their businesses to support causes close to their hearts, including ourselves. 

Lumynary has the potential to increase these global initiatives by supporting heart-centric entrepreneurs, who understand that their WHY in business is more than just cash-flow. Without cash-flow though and a solid foundation, most will not survive and Lumynary is designed so that anyone with a dream of entrepreneurship can learn the skills to develop themselves, take the necessary actions and succeed.

 

Risks & Challenges

Our major risks & challenges include member retention, expert turnover, and technical obstacles.

We believe we are qualified to overcome these hurdles. Lumynary is designed to be up-to-date to face any new questions, different generations of entrepreneurs and technological advancements. Our experts are also highly vetted and committed to maintaining a degree of integrity around their expertise. This means, they will continue to grow and evolve with their specialties, and as they do Lumynary will grow with them. So, members will always have a reason to stay involved in Lumynary and grow with us.

Expert turnover is always a risk in any business or team. We understand that our experts may decide to leave or pursue other ventures and believe that as we grow, our reputation will grow for creating a unique experience for our experts as they are compensated for their time and efforts (unlike most other memberships in the entrepreneurial space). Our aim is to always have 10 key experts and have put in place ways to ensure we have enough notice and time to replace an expert, should they decide to leave the membership.

Technical obstacles are faced by all modern businesses. We have many tech-savvy members on our team and are constantly looking at ways to use tech to our advantage vs. seeing it as an obstacle. We also believe through open communication with our members that we can resolve any problems and have created a solid system for support using tech and non-tech methods.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you’d like to help us reach more people and spread the word, we’d love a shout out! Everyone knows an entrepreneur in their circle and if we can make a difference for just one person, our mission of seeing dreams come to life can be fulfilled.

If you can give us a shoutout, find us on Facebook and Pinterest!

Don’t forget to share our campaign as well! Every dollar really makes a difference. We appreciate you so much and thank you for stopping by our IndieGoGo page.

All the best!

Mel & Lena

So, members will always have a reason to stay involved in Lumynary and grow with us.
Expert turnover is always a risk in any business or team. We understand that our experts may decide to leave or pursue other ventures and believe that as we grow, our reputation will grow for creating a unique experience for our experts as they are compensated for their time and efforts (unlike most other memberships in the entrepreneurial space). Our aim is to always have 10 key experts and have put in place ways to ensure we have enough notice and time to replace an expert, should they decide to leave the membership.
Technical obstacles are faced by all modern businesses. We have many tech-savvy members on our team and are constantly looking at ways to use tech to our advantage vs. seeing it as an obstacle. We also believe through open communication with our members that we can resolve any problems and have created a solid system for support using tech and non-tech methods.
 

Other Ways You Can Help
If you’d like to help us reach more people and spread the word, we’d love a shout out! Everyone knows an entrepreneur in their circle and if we can make a difference for just one person, our mission of seeing dreams come to life can be fulfilled.
If you can give us a shoutout, find us on Facebook and Pinterest!
Don’t forget to share our campaign as well! Every dollar really makes a difference. We appreciate you so much and thank you for stopping by our IndieGoGo page.
All the best!Mel & Lena

story:
Magosh Brewing is a small craft brewery located in Kingsburg, CA. We are focused on crafting and serving fresh and delicious beer inspired by our communities cultural and agricultural roots.

 

Magosh Brewing was established by Josh Bakker and Magnus Olson in 2018 but dreamed of for years before.

In 2013, during the height of the drought, out of a combination of boredom, curiosity, and extreme thirst, we decided to try brewing our own beer. Before long we were scavenging the farm’s boneyard for anything that we could re-purpose into our home brewery. We "borrowed" the biggest pot we could find, ruined the kitchen stove and eventually built a home brew system out of some re-purposed kegs, an old truck wheel and a random pipe we found in our pasture. We were having a great time and others started to notice.  We have been making and sharing our brews ever since! 

In the following years, Magnus and I have found more than a hobby in brewing beer. What had started as a curiosity indulging pastime turned into our passion and has now evolved into a business. Sharing carefully crafted beers with our friends and family never gets old.  

Now we want to bring the fun, intrigue, and lifestyle of craft beer to Downtown Kingsburg by opening a microbrewery.   

What We Need & What You Get

We have come a long way in realizing our dream of opening our brewery and now we want to give you, our community, an opportunity to help us realize our dream of bringing great craft beer to downtown Kingsburg. As a thank you for your support we are offering some great packages including limited edition, first run swag, amazing experiences, as well as the opportunity to purchase discounted beer. 

The Impact

Your support during this campaign will be used to directly enhance your experience when you visit Magosh Brewing. The funds will go toward furniture, décor, and final touches in the tap room, as well as providing the us with a few much needed pieces of equipment that will enable us  to make even more great beers.

Other Ways You Can Help

We get it, you may not be in a position to contribute to our campaign right now. But if you still want to help, share our campaign, come see us for a beer and check out the new brewery once it’s up and running.

story:
The foundation of our training comes from Krav Maga, an Israeli fighting system, but there is so much more.

Different levels of training will be available and Advanced Training will be accessible to long-term students whether or not they are able to test. We intend to provide great gear and a comfortable and encouraging environment, while also providing a place where you can push yourself to the limits. We are very passionate about what we do, and we want to offer the best possible quality of training. We just need the resources to get equipment and secure our permanent home. Our mission is to focus on staff training, equipment, and properly compensating people for their hard work and efforts without placing an undue burden on clients!

The leaders of The Coalition include Jaimie Lee, DC Pacheco, and Josh Townsend. 

Jaimie Lee has been a Krav Maga instructor since 2012 and is passionate about training and understanding the principles of traditional Krav Maga. She has three certifications in the US and has also been certified at the Wingate Institute in Israel, the birthplace of Krav Maga. With an additional background in dance and certification in Pilates/Barre, she offers a restorative approach to training.

DC Pacheco is a 2nd Ranger Battalion War Veteran having served with the 75th Ranger Regiment. DC is also a longtime combat instructor and the founder of Centerline Krav Maga. Incredibly, DC has tailored a system designed for people of smaller stature, with stand up and ground fighting!  Centerline also includes a raw yet ingenious blend of several forms of martial arts to comprise a no-holds-barred approach to self-defense.

Josh Townsend who is the guru of understanding the mental, physical and spiritual connection with training and other forms of movement. With over 18 years of hands-on experience with the human body, he has developed a close connection to the mind-body relationship, giving any martial artist a well-rounded training experience through his warrior yoga, Qigong, guided meditations, workshops and more. Josh has designed a program that increases flexibility and mobility among warriors, and that provides an extremely focused and endurance building approach to self-defense.

We, The Coalition, want to ensure that we have proper gear and training equipment available for our clients and that we cover all expenses for our permanent location in Chapel Hill, NC. From the bottom of our hearts, we thank you for your support!

story:
OUR PROJECT 

The project’s idea first started from an observation : The way that people are living, working and connecting with others is evolving a lot. The new generation of active people wants more flexibility, mobility and at the same time is willing to connect more. 

Vine 21 is a unique space, that will host in the same place 3 different activities : a Co-living, a Co-working/Event space & a Coffee Shop.

CO-LIVING - Open since September 2018

Shall we start with a definition ?
A Co-living is a space hosting under the same roof, a group of people willing to share common values and resources. It offers a wide variety of benefits for its residents, including comfort, flexibility, affordability and an exchange of ideas and experience that fosters a greater sense of social belonging. 

Vine 21's co-living hosts a community of 15 people - both Romanian & foreign - with mostly creative profiles : freelancers, entrepreneurs, digital nomads, musicians, artists and various others.

The minimum stay is one month, but most of our residents are stay for the long term. Each resident has a private room while the common spaces are shared with the other members of the community. These include the living room, dining room, kitchen, bathrooms, balconies, and the terrace.

 

CO-WORKING & EVENT SPACE - Opening in September 2019

This space, directly connected to the main house (co-living), has been designed by Oblic Studio, a truly talented Romanian architecture studio based in Bucharest. It has been created to be totally modulable and easily switchable from a working to an event space.  It is 120m2 big, divided into 2 floors : a working area & event space at the ground floor, a private office and a relaxation area at the first floor.

Working area :

As our co-living, it will be open to all kind of creative minds : entrepreneurs, graphists, designers, architects, digital nomads, artists... 

The atmosphere will be warm and cozy, with a limited amount of members. It will have a maximum capacity of 15 persons, an ideal size to get to know the other members, and for it to feel like being in a second home.

It will have 3 different desk types :

  • 3 private desks at the ground floor
  • A shared table (max 8 persons) at the ground floor
  • A shared private office (max 4 persons) at the 1st floor

Facilities : Meeting/projection room, small kitchen area, relaxation room. 
Services : Wifi, lockers, print/scan, storage space, filtered water, free access to the public events.

Ground floor co-working (C)Oblicstudio
The shared table on the front and the 3 private desks on the back

Ground floor co-working (C)Oblicstudio
The shared table on the front and the meeting/projection room on the back

Events :

The ground floor of the working space will be hosting all kind of events, mainly in the evenings and weekends : workshops, conferences, team building, seminars, exhibitions, private parties.
Again, we believe that the unique atmosphere and energy of the space, will be conducive to all different sorts of group expression.

Event area (C)Oblicstudio

It will have a maximum capacity of 60 persons standing / 35 sitting. In function of people needs : conference mode, workshops or gatherings. We'll be able to arrange the space in many different ways.

Services events : wi-fi, projection wall, catering options.

 

COFFEE SHOP - Opening between September & October 2019

The coffee shop will be hosted inside the Co-working area and will be open 7/7. We'll also have a really nice terrace enjoyable 6 months a year. With this new social area, we aim to create a new dynamic in the neighborhood and also to let people from the outside take part in the community.

Coffee shop area (C)Oblicstudio

Coffee Shop facade (C)Oblicstudio

Bucharest being one of the European capitals for specialty coffee, with more than a hundred of really nice shops in town; it would therefore be unthinkable not to provide high quality coffee.

We'll work with Romanian specialty coffee roasters, in order to promote the local scene and also to ensure to always get fresh roasted coffee. Regarding the equipments, we'll work with a Lamarzocco machine for the espresso part  : Espressos, cortado, cappuccino, latte, flat white...
We'll also offer brewed coffee : V60, Aeropress, Chemex.

Beside that, we'll offer a wide range of teas, juices, sodas, craft beers and wine, as well as some snacks (wraps, sandwiches, salads), and even desserts (cakes, cookies, sweets).

On the top part : Working area with 3 private desks, a shared long table, a meeting/projection room.
On the bottom part : The coffee shop with the bar on the right side, seats on the left and on top of the bar.

Left side : Small kitchen and relaxation area.
Right side : Private office.

 

WHAT DO WE NEED THE MONEY FOR ?

If you help us achieving our goal, we will use the money to develop our new Co-working space and Coffee Shop area :

$ 10.000 - Our first goal : A set of 12 designed furnitures (wood and metal)  for the co-working space, designed by Oblic Studio and built by Nod Makerspace : An 8 persons desk, a 3 private desks module, a locker furniture, some tables for the coffee shop area.

$ 15.000  - A second step : The set of 12 designed wooden furnitures + Creation of 2 designed spaces : Meeting/projection room, a private office at the 1st floor

$ 20.000 - Amazing ! : All the designed wooden furnitures + Creation of 4 designed spaces : Meeting/projection room, a private office at the 1st floor, a relaxing area, a small kitchen spot

$ 25.000 or more - Unbelievable ! : All the designed wooden furnitures + Creation of the 4 designed spaces + the furnitures, machines & materials/tools for the coffee shop : the bar, coffee grinders, coffee tools, crockery, etc.

 

WHAT DO YOU GET ?

 

 

 

 

TEAM

 

FOUNDERS STORY 

We are both French, coming from the same city, (Lyon), where we met each other almost 15 years ago. We both studied economics for a little while until graduation, and then we went for what society defines as a “reasonable choice” : corporate jobs, one in the advertising field, the other doing marketing. 

After years of studying, working, travelling and mostly arguing about the definition of  happiness and "the perfect life", we came to the conclusion that we wanted to do something more meaningful of our lives.

The first decision we took was to choose freedom : we dropped our respective jobs in late 2016. In search of inspiration, Hugo left for a long travel in south America. Arthur later decided to join him and while travelling, they began to envision a project together.

And now the main question : How did these two guys ended up in Romania ? 
A couple of month after this adventure, we joined some friends in a trip to Romania. We spent the last days in the capital and we immediately loved Bucharest’s spirit : its organized mess, its really nice districts and parks, its people and also its nightlife ! On our last day, after a long night (or a really short one), we stopped for a coffee before getting to the airport… There and Then we began to make plans, agreeing that it would be the perfect city to settle and start something.

Two months later, we returned to Romania. We found a student house, where we decided to stay for a few weeks. While being there, we saw the potential of the space and realized it was the ideal place we had been looking for. We found the opportunity to take it over in May 2018, and three months later we began Vine 21’s adventure!

 

RISKS & CHALLENGES

The main challenge we are facing now, is to get funded in order to finish our co-working and coffee shop concepts. If we don't reach our goal of $ 25,000, some aspects of the project could be delayed.

We will in any case be able to open the co-working by September 2019, with at least the ground floor and first floor working areas ready. But the opening of the coffee shop may take place a bit later : by November-December 2019, or early 2020.

story:
Community Yoga Austin was founded in 2010 by Jyl Kutsche and Alison Fox, two yogis with a vision. When they looked at their city of Austin, they saw members of our community dealing with high levels of stress, anxiety, and trauma. Jyl and Alison believed in the power of yoga and mindfulness to heal and transform our community.And so, with the mantra of sharing the practice, Community Yoga Austin was born.

Mission and Programming

The mission of Community Yoga Austin is to offer the practices of yoga, mindfulness and other evidenced-based wellness programming to Austin-area communities, some of whom may not otherwise have access. Our purpose and commitment is to facilitate personal empowerment and social change by unlocking the inherent value of our communities.

Our current programs target at-risk populations in the Austin community, including prison inmates and K-12 schoolchildren from underserved areas. Our elementary and middle school program helps children practice mindfulness while developing essential skills for a lifetime of health and wellness. Our high school youth wellness program provides yoga therapy to at-risk teens, many of whom have experienced significant loss, trauma, abuse and/or neglect in their lives. Instructors take a clinical, mindfulness-based approach to help these youth manage their personal wellness on multiple levels and integrate yoga, relaxation training, stress reduction, anger management and life skills. Through the prison yoga program, we work to establish connections with men and women at the Travis County Correctional Complex (TCCC), who have been physically severed from the larger community, and welcome them into — at the very least — the yoga community. By sharing the discipline of yoga with them, they are offered a tool that can help them to break cycles of violence, addiction, and negative-thinking.

We Need Your Help!

Community Yoga Austin is making a difference in the lives of hundreds of Austinites, and we need the support of the larger Austin community to continue this important work. We are 100% reliant on donations, and at this point, we are facing a cash shortfall. We would like to raise $15,000 – enough to fund five full months of programming for current school and prison participants.

But that’s not all. We have a far grander vision. We believe that every person in the Austin community – regardless of age, school district, or socio-economic status – should have the opportunity to benefit from yoga and mindfulness training. We want to expand our programming to every school and prison in the Central Texas area. We want to explore partnerships with other non-profit organizations to bring services to other members of the community, including working professionals, senior citizens, substance abuse recovery thrivers and the chronically homeless. But, unfortunately, right now our grand vision is stalled as we try to keep our current programs afloat financially. By contributing to this IndieGogo campaign, you will not only help us to meet imminent funding needs, you will also build a foundation upon which Community Yoga Austin can expand to serve the entire Austin community.

We invite you to join us in this effort. Gifts of all sizes can make a difference, and we have yoga-rrific perks, including passes to exclusive yoga classes, online courses, training programs -- even hugs! You can also support us by getting the word out and sharing this campaign with your friends. We are a community organization, and we need the help of many in order to Build the Community and Share the Practice.

Sincerely,

Community Yoga Austin Board of Directors

Leya Samiloglu – President

Elizabeth Harvey – Vice-President

Daniel Goldstein – Secretary

Jazmine Leon-Wing – Treasurer

Karen Gross

Kelle Hand

and

Struan Vaz - Director of Operations

Shawn Kent - Youth Director

Joanne Carreon Reyes - Elementary Director

Geoff O'Meara - Prison Director


Community Yoga Austin Ambassadors

Ben Heath

Denise Deniger

Erinn Lewis

Genevieve Yellin

Gioconda Parker

Jenn Wooten

Kewal Hausmann

Kiely Rutledge

Leeah Taylor

Leigh Fisher

Lilyana Frescas

Richie Flores

Shanti Kelley

difference, and we have yoga-rrific perks, including passes to exclusive yoga
classes, online courses, training programs -- even hugs! You can also support us by getting the word out and sharing this
campaign with your friends. We are a community organization, and we need the
help of many in order to Build the Community and Share the Practice. 
Sincerely,
Community Yoga Austin Board of Directors 
Leya Samiloglu – President 
Elizabeth Harvey – Vice-President 
Daniel Goldstein – Secretary 
Jazmine Leon-Wing – Treasurer

Kelle Hand

story:
Street Fare brings tasty bites and beverages to Mt. Airy. We hope to host the 2015 Street Fare on Thursday, September 17, 2015, from 6:00pm to 10:30pm. 

Sip and savor gourmet eats and drinks from 50+ of the region’s best gourmet food trucks and local restaurants stationed along Germantown Avenue, between Sedgwick and W. Mt. Airy Avenue. Stroll the Avenue for family fun, live music and handmade crafts. Street Fare is organized by Mt. Airy USA and annually attracts over 15,000 people.

But- we need your help to make it happen! Street Festival fees include special permits, rentals, advertising just to name a few- and it adds up! Your contribution will help ensure we can bring the fun to Mt. Airy again.

story:
Sinister Grin Press

Sinister Grin Press is an independent publisher of horror fiction located in Austin, Texas. We publish books and stories from authors such as Ray Garton, Ramsey Campbell, Charlee Jacob, Wrath James White, Shane McKenzie and many more.


SGP3 Here's How it Works: Support the Production of Multiple New Projects and Expansion Coming in 2015 and 2016 from Sinister Grin Press by Contributing Before this Indiegogo Campaign Ends on July 15th. Projects include books from Brian Keene, J.F. Gonzalez, John Everson, Ronald Kelley, Shane McKenzie, Sara Brooke and David Bernstein. We also have collections with stories from Ray Garton, Lee Thomas, Monica J. O'Rourke and Tim Miller. As well as introducing numerous new writers to the world.

There will be timely announced giveaways as well as surprise flash giveaways. All giveaways will be lottery drawings based on contributions. The next giveaway will be July 16th, drawing from all contributors before midnight CST of July 15th. The next giveaway will be for a signed and numbered hardback copy of JAGGER by Kristopher Rufty.


Customers who support this Indiegogo campaign will be supporting the production of multiple projects coming in 2015 and 2016 from Sinister Grin Press, including those listed above. We also have plans to expand into the audio book market and hope to open a sister press for other genres. The SGP3 products will be shipping to customers starting August 2015 and ship to United States customers for free! International customers please use the International Shipping perk to cover additional shipping charges of any perk including Limited Edition books.


Thank you for your support, and if you have any questions about this campaign please contact us at: sinistergrinpress@gmail.com. Find information on optional add-ons, stretch goals, authors, artists, and more below.

The items within SGP3 (both digital and physical) are chosen at random from our in stock/available products except for those specified by name (such as Prey Drive by Wrath James White). A full list of in stock items can be found on this page.


Shipping will begin by August 2015. Digital product will be sent via e-mail, while physical books will be shipped via USPS in sturdy boxes with ample packing materials. The physical books ship free to United States customers and at a discounted shipping rate to international customers.


For any further questions please e-mail us at: sinistergrinpress@gmail.com

Shipping is done in sturdy weight tested Uline boxes with ample shipping materials to almost any country in the world via USPS. Additional funds need to be added for shipping outside of the United States on every perk level that includes physical items. Just select the International Shipping Perk. Custom shipping requests can be fulfilled, but please e-mail us at sinistergrinpress@gmail.com for such requests to be best handled.


Sinister Grin Press is an independent specialty publisher of horror fiction, founded in 2010. We produce limited run, signed hardcover editions for collectors as well as quality paperbacks and eBook editions. Our products are found on Amazon, Barnes&Noble, Google Play, kobo and Payhip. Sinister Grin has contract staff throughout the United States while its physical presence is in Austin, Texas.

     Soon to be Published Projects:

       


                 
                                                 

                     Stretch Goals

As we reach each new goal level we will include new product, projects and giveaways.

  T-Shirts & New Books 

When this goal is unlocked each "Avid" and "Voracious" supporter will receive a free Sinister Grin Press T-Shirt. The T-Shirt Perk will be unlocked for selection as well as two new limited edition book projects not available for the public ordering until later in the year. 

We will have other designs and colors.


 Special Limited Edition Project

When this goal is unlocked we will announce a very special limited edition flip book and a giveaway of the last signed, numbered limited edition copy of 

Sixty-Five Stirrup Iron Road

 

This will be a flash giveaway when the stretch goal is unlocked. All Perks for a specific time period will be entered into a drawing for the Signed & Numbered Limited Edition Hardback.

Gifts and New Project

Help us launch our new sister press for Science Fiction, Fantasy, Crime and more, Mirror Matter Press. Unlock copies of upcoming sci-fi stories!! Help us launch the new website and publish new science fiction stories with Perks to buy unreleased digital copies.

Mirror Matter Press

       Special Project Announcement

 With this stretch goal we will announce some very special projects.



Authors -

  Wrath James White    Shane McKenzie


 J.F. Gonzalez                Lee Thomas

 John Everson                        Ray Garton


As well as: 

Brian Keene, Jack Ketchum, Kristopher Rufty, David Bernstein, Adam Cesare, Sara Brooke, Monica J. O'Rourke, Ronald Kelly, Cameron Pierce, Nate Southard, Thomas Tessier, Charlee Jacob, Lesley Conner, Mark Gunnells, K.R. Griffiths, Tim Miller, Michelle Garza, Melissa Lason, Jason Murphy, Joshua Rex, Liam Dunson, Matthew Weber, Neko Lilly, Tony Cella, Michael Shayne, Raymond Prew & Richard J. O'Brien

and Artists:


 Frank Walls                   Jim Agpalza

plus  Nick Gucker, Kyushik Shin, Alan M. Clark & Kristopher Rufty

Stock of Books (Current and Upcoming) all Perks and Giveaways drawn from:

Jagger by Kristopher Rufty              Voracious by Wrath James White
Cut Corners Vol. 1 by Ramsey Campbell, Ray Garton & Bentley Little
Cut Corners Vol.2 by Ray Garton, Shane McKEnzie & Monica J. O'Rourke (2015)
The Slab City Event by Nate Southard     Down by Nate Southard
Jackpot by Shane McKenzie, Adam Cesare, David Bernstein & Kristopher Rufty
The Myth of Falling by Charlee Jacob   Ash Street by Lee Thomas
The Killings by Wrath James White & J.F. Gonzalez
I'm Not Sam by Jack Ketchum    Prey Drive by Wrath James White
What Happens In The Darkness by Monica J. O'Rourke
Remorseless by Thomas Tessier            Sacrifice by Wrath James White
Fantastic Earth Destroyer Ultra Plus by Cameron Pierce & Jim Agpalza
The Weight of Chains by Lesley Conner (2015)
Scavengers by Nate Southard (2015)      Adrift by K.R. Griffiths (2015)
The Summer Job by Adam Cesare (2015)   Fresh Meat by Various Writers (2015)
Episodes of Violence by David Bernstein (2015)
 Gardens of Babylon by Sara Brooke(2015)

If you have any questions, please e-mail us at sinistergrinpress@gmail.com

story:
Short Summary


  • Hello here is a 24 years old single women who does have a idea to repair an old pool in her city.
  • This project is very important to her to ensure a future for our village and to extend the life of people.


What We Need & What You Get


  • I need about 15000 $ to fix up the lot, displayed in the picture, into a swimming pool for kids and elderly in this area. This money will be used for machines that are necessary to clean up the area. In addition we will need the money for labor,  materials(cement,sand,adhesive,hone,tile,canvas,..etc.), furnitures (chairs,tables,sunbeds,umbrellas,mobile bar), sanitary groups (wc+sink), showers, changing cabins
    Why is this special? This pool will be the only one in my area, for miles!
  • The funds received will be greatly appreciated and will go directly to the business; even if I do not reach my goal I will try to get a loan from the bank next season, hopefully.

The Impact


  • This project will help everybody (young/older people) to swim as there is no local pool nearby. Currently, the people of Olt, must travel a good distance to other cities which are far away and not everyone can pay to make that trip. To have this pool will mean the people of Olt will not have to travel and can save a few needed dollars, since the pool can be near to them.
  • I want to get the children a better life and a chance to experience the fun that all children should have.

Other Ways You Can Help


  • IF u cant help with donation please share this post!
  • You can also use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Unity Outfitters is a fair trade fashion brand starting up in Raleigh, North Carolina. We seek to design and produce apparel and jewelry using sustainable materials from artist groups around the world. Unity Outfitters’ mission is to give a platform to women & indigenous artisan groups who produce culturally and socially significant work.  Our promise to you is to engage in traceable production using the highest quality materials available while supplying beautifully crafted designs.

The funding from this campaign will allow us to work with our first partner, Casa Flor Ixcaco, a women’s weaving cooperative in Guatemala. Through volunteer, retail, and sourcing experience I (Katina) have been involved with this weaving cooperative for four years, and I wish to further develop this partnership to include design and production using fair trade principles. Through this work that will comprise Unity Outfitters’ first collection,  we will contribute to the revitalization of hand spun organic cotton and the use of natural dyes. This collection will feature beautiful textiles produced through the Mayan tradition of backstrap weaving.

Timeline of events for our first year in operation once we are funded


We believe that the promotion of and investment in fair and sustainable fashion is desperately needed to replace the toxic fast fashion industry. Through funding Unity Outfitters you are taking a stand against the negative impacts to people and the planet caused by this industry, and you are supporting a positive change in the way the fashion world works. We  create stylish and fairly and extremely well made products using the highest quality natural materials. Our customers will love wearing these garments and feel good about buying them, too.

Right now we are in Guatemala working directly with Casa Flor Ixcaco to develop the fabric which will be used to produce our samples for next summer's collection.

We are currently a very small operation with over a decade of experience working in the textiles and apparel industry in every position from pattern-making, quality assurance, design, and product development, to wholesaling, sourcing, merchandising and retail, and right now we are working overtime to make this dream happen. With great success over this past year selling an extremely limited product offering at local markets, we are seeking to expand and we know that the demand is there. Our vision is to one day become a worker owned cooperative, and we want to employ artists and workers in the USA who will earn a fair wage and be provided dependable work. Several talented women in the USA  are on-board and eager to work with us on this project; we just need the funding to start-up an organization that can pay everyone fairly for their work.

By raising $20,000, Unity Outfitters will have the opportunity become a thriving business in the USA with worker-owners who care about fair trade, and are cared for by their workplace and community  in return. This money will allow Unity Outfitters to form and  grow partnerships with artisan groups worldwide under the principles of fair trade and provide fair pay in exchange for their top quality work as well.


For your support in helping launch our business, we offer you the chance to own a piece from our Winter 2015 pre-collection. This limited collection is being hand-made by members of the cooperative and Unity Outfitters and sold to raise money for our first official collection to be produced in the spring/summer of next year. This collection includes gorgeous fair trade jade jewelry, shawls, and a bag which will all be offered in multiple different colors. Once you order your perk I will contact you to discuss what colors/styles/metals you want your perk to be produced using. (Scroll down to see more images from the collection.)

Some of our perks!

Mayan Calender Bookmark - Once this perk is ordered, we will contact you via email to receive your birthday info and determine your Nahual (Mayan sun sign).

Cosmetic Bag - Once this perk is ordered, we will contact you via email to determine what your color preference is.

Fair Trade Shawls & Scarves produced by Casa Flor Ixcaco - Once this perk is ordered, we will contact you via email to determine what your color preference is.



Fair Trade Jade & Tassel Earrings Produced by Unity Outfitters and Casa Flor Ixcaco - Once this perk is ordered, we will contact you via email to determine which type of metal you prefer (eco-silver or 14k gold) and what your color preference is for the all natural dyed cotton tassels.

Fair Trade Jade Bracelet Produced by Unity Outfitters  - Once this perk is ordered, we will contact you via email to determine which type of metal you prefer (eco-silver or 14k gold).


Fair Trade Three Volcanoes Clutch Bag Produced by Unity Outfitters and Casa Flor Ixcaco - Once this perk is ordered, we will contact you via email to determine which weave (design) you would like and what your color preference is.  The bags will be made in the USA once we return stateside.

Weave pattern and color option for three volcanoes clutch bags

Backstrap loom and hand-spun cotton yarn produced by Casa Flor Ixcaco - Once this perk is ordered, we will contact you via email to determine what your color preference is and to arrange times and dates for weaving lessons.

Visit Casa Flor Ixcaco in Guatemala and learn about our process firsthand! - Once this perk is ordered, we will contact you via email to make all the arrangements. Included in this perk is all travel, lodging, food, water, tourguide, and activity costs. This perk truly is all inclusive.

Color Options for Naturally Dyed Products

Risks - The main reason we have chosen to start up Unity Outfitters with our partnership in Guatemala is that we have been working with them for over four years, we have a good relationship established, we work well together, and we know their production process well. We understand that there can always be unforeseen difficulties that come up, and timing is a risk involved in all fashion production processes.  We are aware that delays may happen during production in Guatemala, in the USA, or during the shipping process. Our campaign supporters will be kept well informed during each stage of our production process so they know exactly where their rewards are and how our project is progressing. Our practice of fair trade principles extends beyond production to our customer service, and we will ensure the products we make and service we provide will please our customers.

THANK YOU FOR SUPPORTING OUR WORK!!!

The money we are raising will help cover our production costs, material costs, travel costs, website set-up costs, design work, marketing, and sales costs,  It takes a lot financial resources and hard work to launch a business like this using fair trade principles.  The good news is that once a business like ours gets started, it becomes self sustainable. If we do not meet our fundraising goal, all funded perks will still be delivered, and we will do our best to continue to produce this line.  If we exceed our funding goals, we will celebrate and sleep easier at night knowing we have the financial ability to make our dream happen. We need your help to get this project off the ground and appreciate your supporting our work!


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Help us spread the word about our campaign, share a link to this page with your friends and family directly, or use the Indiegogo share tools!
Find out more about Casa Flor Ixcaco
View recent work from of Unity Outfitters
Read our blog about ethical fashion, fair trade, and transparent supply chains at  https://forbearantfashion.com/

THANK YOU FOR SUPPORTING OUR WORK!!!The money we are raising will help cover our production costs, material costs, travel costs, website set-up costs, design work, marketing, and sales costs,  It takes a lot financial resources and hard work to launch a business like this using fair trade principles.  The good news is that once a business like ours gets started, it becomes self sustainable. If we do not meet our fundraising goal, all funded perks will still be delivered, and we will do our best to continue to produce this line.  If we exceed our funding goals, we will celebrate and sleep easier at night knowing we have the financial ability to make our dream happen. We need your help to get this project off the ground and appreciate your supporting our work!  Other Ways You Can Help
 Help us spread the word about our campaign, share a link to this page with your friends and family directly, or use the Indiegogo share tools!  Find out more about Casa Flor IxcacoView recent work from of Unity OutfittersRead our blog about ethical fashion, fair trade, and transparent supply chains at  https://forbearantfashion.com/

story:
"The best damn pale I've ever had. Hands down."


Local malt

Local hops

Beer from here

\

So fresh you want to slap it. 

This is YOUR Homefield

Local veggies and artisanal cheese

Fresh breads, fermented pickles, kraut, and more


Music that's fresh and local just like you

Join us in making this real

A few of the of the luscious Homefield batches made at our partner breweries and enjoyed by many:

And yes we hope to continue collaborating with our many great friends in the brewing community, but we need a base of operations in order to keep this beer in on tap. Help us build a place to call home for truly local beer.

 

What We Need & What You Get

In short we need money. We could open as a tasting room selling bottles to go, but our space is so cozy and rustic we want folks to be able to relax and enjoy. 

But to pour pints, as well as world class northeast grown wines and ciders, and serve soups, and cheese plates and other farm to table grub, we need to install a lot more plumbing. In fact, plumbing will be our most expensive budget item. 

  • $20,000 allows us to install an added restroom and make it universally accessible, as well as four big kitchen sinks, prep tables, additional refrigeration and seating. With all that, plus our state of the art 1 barrel brew kettle, four 2 barrel fermenters, a brite tank and other brand new equipment, we will have a truly unique place - authentic farm to table and sustainable in every way.

     
  • If we fall short of our entire goal, we will still honor all of our perks. The rest of the funding will be used toward our ultimate goal. It will just take us a little longer to get there. 

The Impact

When we say this is your Homefield, we mean that you could and should take pride in what we make with local farm goods. From the beginning, Homefield has connected with our sense of community. Meeting farmers, walking the fields, smelling the freshest of malts, offering the chance for folks to buy into the harvest long before the beer is even made. We own it. But you own it too. This beer is ours. Let's do this together. Joining the jug club puts money in the farmers pockets so they can assure that our malt and hop supplies will keep filling our kettle. 

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest risk is opening without a full pouring license, which we will do if we fall short of our funding goal. This will amount to a slower start, but we will pour revenue into the the remodeling required to get our taproom. Since we make great beer with the freshest ingredients, patience will be well rewarded. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can contribute, you will feel great that you're helping build a community asset. If you can't, but you still want to help, please share our campaign with your friends. And thank you.

story:
The best energy drink on the market now available at Amazon and Texas H-E-B's

 

"Devastatingly good", "delicious", "amazing", "way better",... MOONSHOT destroys standard HoooHa energy drinks.

 

We chose the International SXSW 2015 Music + Tech conference in Austin, TX to introduce MOONSHOT Premium Crafted Energy to movers, shakers and party goers alike coming from across the nation and internationally. The testimonials you see in our video are real and unfiltered and straight from the streets.

After 9 days and over 1,200 samplings of MOONSHOT Premium Energy drinks, NOBODY chose Monster or Red Bull over MOONSHOT when asked which energy drink they prefer... NOBODY. We're talking NONE, NADA, NYET, NINGUNO, GOOSE EGG. Think 1998 Yankees vs. the Bad News Bears... Michael Jordan in his prime versus you in flip flops... Fat Albert versus a slice of cake. All 3 energy drinks have the same 115 mg caffeine per 12 oz (along with Taurine & B Vitamins), but only MOONSHOT dominates with a devastatingly delicious natural taste with NO chemical aftertaste.

 

Why we launched an IGG campaign for MOONSHOT

 

MOONSHOT is a bottled carbonated energy drink that comes in 6 delicious fruit flavors. We are a real company doing real business at retail stores, bars & restaurants nationwide since 2013. To better meet our ever growing demand, we felt it necessary to introduce a more portable option; and thus, we are launching our companion 12 oz Sleek aluminum can line.

Production for our #3 Orange Grapefruit and #5 Coconut Pineapple flavors has begun. These flavors serve as the reward perks for this campaign and the perks will be delivered regardless of the campaign goal being met. Reaching the $60,000 campaign goal will allow us to put 2 more flavors into production (#1 Sour Apple and #2 Tart Cherry).

Please view our testimonials; we know you want our "tastes fucking awesome" #2 Tart Cherry. If we hit $60,000, then we will make it rain tart cherry for you. If we get to $120,000 then all 6 flavors will go into production and getting your favorite MOONSHOT will only be a clickity click away on Amazon. Hitting the $120K stretch goal will also allow us to accelerate R&D on our next 3 flavors  (-which you can suggest with a $7 perk contribution-). How's a Watermelon Lemonade with a 115 mg caffeine kick sound, or maybe an energized black tea with orange and lemon juices and a splash of honey?

How does MOONSHOT make the best tasting energy drink by a mile?

When was the last time you had a truly refreshing and delicious energy drink with no funky aftertaste? Did you even think it was possible after sucking down cans of battery acid for the past 20 years? We at MOONSHOT are serious about what we do. To do an energy drink right; absolutely right, my gawd this tastes so good right, you need to master the craft and science of flavors. It doesn't happen overnight or even over months, and it can't be done cheaply. REPEAT, it can't be done cheaply.

Our ingredient costs for the best energy drink made are at LEAST 3x greater than the mass market brands and that plays a very large part in being able to craft 6 amazing lightly carbonated energy drink beverages. Why do we use premium ingredients like 30% juice (not 5%, not 15%, but 30%), pure cane sugar and real honey in our drinks? Maybe it's because we aren't led by a guy who makes decisions based on excel spreadsheets; or maybe it's because we drink this stuff, we believe in this stuff and this stuff makes us happy. No doubt about it; when you use better ingredients, you can craft a better drink whether it's a premium craft energy drink like MOONSHOT or a premium craft beer.

With our premium ingredient costs, you would think we'd cost much more than other energy drinks; but nope, we are right in line with the cheaply made junk stocking shelves everywhere. It's possible/probable that we charge too little for our Premium MOONSHOT energy drink but also it just might be that the mass market brands charge way too much for their artificial cans of HoooHa.

Your contributions are great, but what we really need is your help introducing MOONSHOT to your social circle

We really hope everybody has watched at least some of the video testimonials (they are entertaining to watch in an Anthony Bordainesque kind of way). It should be readily apparent that the one common denominator amongst people who love MOONSHOT is they have nothing in common. You can like energy drinks, hate energy drinks, hate sodas, only drink water; be an athlete, a geek, a hippie, a musician, an engineer, a guy, a girl, young or old. If you breathe, you will probably like MOONSHOT. If you like caffeine, then almost certainly you will LOVE MOONSHOT.

We ask you be the hero in your social group and be the ONE that introduces friends to MOONSHOT Premium Energy. Blast our IGG campaign link on facebook / twitter / instagram etc. and you may be surprised by how many hugs and thanks you receive down the road. Liberating one's gut from cheap HoooHa after drinking it for 20 years is a beautiful thing.

http://igg.me/at/moonshot

What will the Sleek 12 oz cans artwork look like?

For reference, below is our bottle line that has been going strong since 2013.

 

 

Our can line will have the artwork seen below.

With an amazing taste like this, can MOONSHOT really be an energy drink?

 

Oh yes we can and yes we are. If drinking a can of HoooHa enables you to run a 4.4 40 and Bench 405lbs, drinking a 115 mg caffeine MOONSHOT will enable you to do the same. The only difference being you won't have a sour pucker face and your gut (and bowels) will be thankful you chose premium MOONSHOT. Also, we do use 2 Quality Control Laboratories to keep an eye on things (we can be quite anal about quality at MOONSHOT). What you see on the label is what is in the bottle, rest assured.

 

What does MOONSHOT taste like? In the testimonials, everybody raves about it being the best tasting energy drink but the descriptions seem all over the map.

 

We are not your typical mass produced energy drink that takes the base formula and just squirts in some artificial fruit flavor du jour and calls it a "new" drink flavor. Each of our 6 flavors is crafted from scratch using their own set of premium ingredients. For example, our #4 Honey Peach flavor uses real honey... surprise!

 

If you try our #1 Sour Apple, you may think MOONSHOT is a tangy and sweet carbonated cider-like drink with an edge. If you try our #5 Coconut Pineapple, you may think MOONSHOT is a sweet tropical soda with coconut and pineapple flavors that explode in your mouth. MOONSHOT has 6 very different flavor profiles, but regardless of the flavor, MOONSHOT never tastes like HoooHa!

Why MOONSHOT will never produce a 0 calorie or 1 calorie drink

 

MOONSHOT will always be an energy beverage line that incorporates meaningful amounts of fruit juice and fruits have fruit sugar calories. For our current line of 30% juice MOONSHOT, the fruit juice component alone contributes roughly 13 grams of fruit sugars which roughly equate to 52 calories. In other words, before we add anything else, our MOONSHOTs start at 13 grams of sugar and 52 calories due to  the juice. We have 1 diet flavor (#6 Lite Pomegranate) which contains 30% juice, a bit of cane sugar and stevia, and it is a 90 calorie drink.

 

Statement on why we chose to use synthetic caffeine over "natural" caffeine in MOONSHOT and therefore do not claim to be 100% all natural

The only ingredients in MOONSHOT that are not natural are the synthetic caffeine and vitamin B6. On a weight or volume basis, MOONSHOT is comfortably 99.999% natural. So why not just drop the B6 and swap out the synthetic caffeine with "natural" caffeine? Any marketer would do this in a heartbeat because having a 100% all natural claim is a marketer's dream. However, I only want the best for it -and my body- and my scientific background tells me the best energy drink requires synthetic caffeine. Why is synthetic better in this case?

Pharmaceutical grade synthetic caffeine has a purity that is consistent regardless of supplier or external environmental factors. It doesn't matter if there are swarms of diseased locusts or if a plant fungus is striking down crops. It doesn't matter if there is a drought or if there is a flood. Farm pesticides and water supply purity are never a concern. The lab can and will consistently output the same pure grade of caffeine day and night 365x7.

Now on the other hand, let's think about "natural" caffeine for a minute. Does one just cut down some coffee plants and wave a finger and suddenly the plants let out a "natural" super purified 99.99% caffeine dust like magic? Nope, it doesn't work that way. The irony with "natural" caffeine is you need to use very "unnatural" processes (that sometimes require solvents) to get the caffeine out of the plant and then other "unnatural" processes to purify this extraction liquid. There are variances in methods from supplier to supplier that leave many questions unanswered. Therefore (for the time being), I choose the better purer option for MOONSHOT, synthetic caffeine. --- MOONSHOT John

story:
Short Summary

California State University of Fullerton's Society of Unmanned Aerial Vehicle Engineers (SUAVE) team is about learning and obtaining valuable experiences. The students of Engineering and Computer Science strive to prove themselves in the design, fabrication, and testing of multi-purpose autonomous aerial vehicles. Throughout the whole process, each individual learns to work and cooperate in an interdisciplinary team project in developing a UAV system that is worthy for competition. 

Our team has been working tirelessly to complete our aircraft. However, constructing and transporting our aircraft and team across the country is an expensive prospect. Our dream is to take our aircraft to the Student Unmanned Aerial Systems (SUAS) competition that will take place on June 19th at Webster Field, Maryland. On this date, we will stand together as a team to watch our aircraft soar through the sky.

Link To Competition Website: http://www.auvsi-seafarer.org/

                      

    




What We Need & What You Get

We are asking our community for financial support. For our SUAVE team to compete, we need to raise $3,500. These funds will be used to keep pushing our project forward and realize our dreams of competing at an international level. 

For contributing to our campaign you will receive awesome perks ! Ranging from coffee mugs, book bags to a license plate frame! These gifts were generously donated by the CSUF Center for Entrepreneurship and Factory eNova.

                    


 *If we do not reach our goal of 3,500, our funds will be retained for the project.

The Impact

Our supporters will be contributing to the advancement of the aerospace industry that so many of us benefit from. Our team has acquired the knowledge necessary to produce industry grade projects at a collegiate level. Attending the SUAS competition will be an immeasurable experience for us as we stand tall and watch our aircraft soar through the blue sky. 

          

            

Risks & Challenges

In the previous year, one week before competition, we encountered many technical difficulties with the design and manufacturing of the airplane. During testing, the plane crashed, caught fire and unfortunately could not be salvaged. This year, we started with a more comprehensive plan from the very beginning: the design of the airframe passed through many simulations, construction began significantly earlier, and a prototype aircraft was constructed and tested before a final design was developed and passed through the same rigorous procedure. To ensure that our aircraft performs competitively, we are participating in a local competition that will test our robust airframe. This competition is two months prior to the international competition, the Student Unmanned Aerial Systems (SUAS) event, and it will enable us to continue refining our aircraft prior to SUAS. It is an additional challenge our team has taken on because we believe we have the competence necessary to persevere through any difficulties we may encounter.

Other Ways You Can Help

Every bit helps ! You can help by sharing this campaign to Facebook, Twitter or Instagram. We have a long journey ahead of us and we can not do it alone. With the help of our community, we will achieve our goal!

story:
Cannabis and enlightenment

Legalization of the world's most valuable medicine is sweeping the nation, and that's a very good thing. But in the great green rush that is taking place, some have lost sight of cannabis' connection to spirituality, as it helped manifest many of the world's greatest religions, a fact that has been suppressed for centuries.

After I organized the first Cannabis Cup in Amsterdam, I felt an obligation to study the long history of cannabis as a sacrament, a voyage that started with the oldest living religious document, The Rig Veda.

I quickly discovered the central sacrament in the Veda was called "Soma" and "healed all who are sick, the blind see, the lame walk...a sage and a seer inspired by poetry." I knew immediately Soma was cannabis and milk (and not mushrooms like the mainstream claimed). I was also struck by the similarity of Soma's powers with the initial miracles of Jesus, and soon deduced cannabis played a role in those as well. In fact, Shiva, Buddha, Isis and Dionysus and many more gods and goddesses have strong ties to cannabis.

Finding my religion

So after 30 years of intensive study, I did my best to construct a corruption-free form of spirituality that respects all non-violent traditions and seeks to blend them all in order to break the current hoodwink that manufactures war for profit by pitting religions against each other in an endless cycle of violence.

The funds collected will be used to purchase a property in Colorado, ideally an existing church that can immediately be transferred into a house of worship where cannabis can be consumed by adults.

If the funds I receive are insufficient to purchase such a property, I will rent a large house and invite the contributors to a ceremony on the premises. I will seek advice from my sponsors on when and where this ceremony should be held.

If you pledge $10 to this cause, you will be invited to the opening of the lodge, which will include a great feast and entertainment from notable cannabis celebrities. But if you pledge $420, you'll be a part of those Opening  Ceremonies and will be invited to sign the official membership book and receive a golden pin that confers lifetime membership in the lodge and guaranteed admission to any and all ceremonies at any Pot Illuminati lodges around the world.

The need for peace enlightenment

Today many children are raised on a steady diet of junk food, violence programming and synthetic pills. As a result, we are awash with school shootings, suicides and opiate addiction, while the entire country is bordering on PTSD. The media cartel is not helping by force-feeding so much emotionally-charged coverage of tragic events as the unfold. Peace ceremonies are a step in the right direction in seeking an antidote to excessive violence, and cannabis can be an effective tool in breaking opiate addiction and healing PTSD.

After years of study, I've concluded North American peace culture got its start in Congo Square, New Orleans, which is also where cannabis was first instituted as a ceremonial tool on this side of the globe. The key elements of North American peace culture are improvisation and inclusivity.

I recently published a book titled "Magic, Religion & Cannabis" that explains my voyage of discovery that led me to attempt to solve the religion problem by inventing a religion with no dogma. We do have one basic rule, however: don't hurt anybody.

Manifesto of the Pot Illuminati

Devoted to the Welfare of the World

Cannabis has been a constant provider of human welfare throughout humanity’s long journey. The time has come for the Pot Illuminati to gather and take our place as stewards of cannabis. We seek to help dissolve the oppressive laws against our sacrament. We also seek to harness the power and energy of cannabis for the welfare of the world.

We have long celebrated the great gifts this unique plant offers such as medicine, food, fuel, paper, cordage, paints, plastics as well as the sacramental key to higher realms of consciousness (if used wisely and in moderation). We have patiently waited for humanity to awaken from the ignorance caused by forgetfulness and many of our members have suffered great persecution just for their acknowledgement and love for the many blessings cannabis has bestowed upon us.

But we now stand at the threshold of a great cannabis reawakening, a phoenix rebirth of the mighty healing spirit of cannabis. The Pot Illuminati, as faithful stewards and advocates of cannabis, claim our right to determine, shape and protect the future of cannabis from state and corporate domination and exploitation.

The Pot Illuminati Lodge is a non-political entity that embraces all people regardless of race, religion or national origin. We seek to blend all the great religions, many of which have been perverted to manifest war for profit.  We also seek to disarm the dark lords who support Prohibition and we will do this by stealing their sigils, their names, their totems, and bending them all to our vibrations of peace and respect for Mother Earth.

The Pot Illuminati Grand Lodge: Rules and Dogmas

There is no dogma: Do anything you like, just don’t hurt anybody. However that does not mean we do not study and celebrate the poetry and myths of past religions. We do. However, we feel free to merge concepts from all religions because they are rivers flowing into the same sea.

Improvisation is encouraged at all times: always allow the inspiration of the moment to manifest and trust your instincts because they prove your heart is pure.

The main vibration to manifest is love and when we share it, it fills our Temple with a palpable vibration that can be used to heal damaged souls and one can feel that energy later in the empty Temple long after everyone has left.

The second vibration is fun, as much fun as possible, and pranks and jokes are totally fine, provided everyone laughs when it’s over, because if anyone cries, you just created a stain on your karma.

When the Pot Illuminati gather for an improvisational ceremony, no anger or evil telepathic desires should manifest in the Temple, and if someone’s energy is not correct, an Illuminated Master must rectify the situation quickly, often done by inviting the person to share some cannabis.

If someone yells, or starts a violent confrontation inside the Temple, it must be cleared immediately, and everyone should vacate while an Illuminated Master solves the situation. Members should not return until the perpetrator(s) have either left the Temple or been excused by the Illuminated Master, and the room should be blessed with sage and ceremony and members should pray in silence until the proper vibration returns and normal Temple functions can continue.

No member should ever lie, cheat or steal, and if caught doing so, they should be expelled. Such matters involve the entire membership, or whoever shows up for the trial, and the accused can be saved by an Illuminated Master if he believes the facts are in doubt.

A small jar of cannabis should be placed on the altar in the Temple at all times in case of medical emergencies. Members always know they can come to the Temple should they require medicine. White powders, hard drugs, and alcohol are not permitted in the Temple. Do not bring weapons of violence into the Temple and the penalty for this violation is permanent expulsion.

Members should not speak of our society to anyone other than a prospective new recruit, nor share our secrets or ceremonies with outsiders.

Please never carry more than one ounce of Cannabis into the Temple. It is your responsibility to help protect the Temple and the members from persecution. We seek to create a refuge from the storm so our members can share the sacrament in peace, but we cannot allow that peace to be shattered because of excessive amounts of cannabis brought into the Temple.

Once you are inducted into our society, you will be given a pin to wear, which you can display or hide. However, you should never brag or boast about your membership, nor draw attention to your pin, but if someone asks what that is, feel free to whisper the words: “Pot Illuminati” and then put a finger to your mouth and go “shhhh” and say no more on the subject.

This is a work in progress, and you can help my making suggestive comments.
story_txt:
Cannabis and enlightenment
Legalization of the world's most valuable medicine is sweeping the nation, and that's a very good thing. But in the great green rush that is taking place, some have lost sight of cannabis' connection to spirituality, as it helped manifest many of the world's greatest religions, a fact that has been suppressed for centuries.After I organized the first Cannabis Cup in Amsterdam, I felt an obligation to study the long history of cannabis as a sacrament, a voyage that started with the oldest living religious document, The Rig Veda.I quickly discovered the central sacrament in the Veda was called "Soma" and "healed all who are sick, the blind see, the lame walk...a sage and a seer inspired by poetry." I knew immediately Soma was cannabis and milk (and not mushrooms like the mainstream claimed). I was also struck by the similarity of Soma's powers with the initial miracles of Jesus, and soon deduced cannabis played a role in those as well. In fact, Shiva, Buddha, Isis and Dionysus and many more gods and goddesses have strong ties to cannabis.
  Finding my religion
 So after 30 years of intensive study, I did my best to construct a corruption-free form of spirituality that respects all non-violent traditions and seeks to blend them all in order to break the current hoodwink that manufactures war for profit by pitting religions against each other in an endless cycle of violence.
The funds collected will be used to purchase a property in Colorado, ideally an existing church that can immediately be transferred into a house of worship where cannabis can be consumed by adults.
If the funds I receive are insufficient to purchase such a property, I will rent a large house and invite the contributors to a ceremony on the premises. I will seek advice from my sponsors on when and where this ceremony should be held.

story:
An app to get your lawn mowed... Cool!

A new and amazing app to connect you with a LawnHiro – lawn mowing service provider.　

Too tired to mow?　Out of time?

Simply pull out the LawnHiro app, click, and order. Then you're automatically connected to a hand selected lawn mowing Hiro nearest you. You'll know who, able to read reviews, and when complete, you'll even receive pics of job well done.

Hear what people are saying about LawnHiro and SnowHiro on our Youtube Channel. 

Many more here-----(https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCG7ZWIFHfMbe6-...)


　Fully integrated with Google maps to find your lawn fast.　

Automatically calculates the area of your lawn.　 Gives you an instant price quote before you order.　

 simply choose same day or anytime later

Then your job order is sent to our network of LawnHiro providers to be claimed.　


once claimed, you’ will be instantly notified as to who and when your LawnHiro will mow your lawn.　

 You'll even be able to read reviews, rate, and give feedback after a job well done.　 Every LawnHiro's rating is tied to their rate of income.  So, they have a vested interest in performing above and beyond expectations.  When your lawn is complete, you will even receive pictures of your freshly cut grass.

Remember, we are reliable and available.

What we aim to accomplish -

  1. We will connect service providers with people looking to hire someone to mow their lawn or a lawn for a loved one. Fast, simple and easy.

  • Who could use options to earn money? Teenagers, college students, dads, moms, empty-nesters with extra time, fundraising organizations, and many more.

  • Know the cost upfront, and pay securely through the app.

  • We will attract, hand select, and screen only the best individuals wanting to become a LawnHiro or SnowHiro service provider.

  • We will give every LawnHiro the ability to quickly fill their work calendars with job orders.

    • Each job order will be first come, first served.

    • All the marketing, promotions and invoicing will be provided through the app allowing each provider to focus more time on what they do best.

    • Work when you want as often as you want. You control your workload.

  • Build and maintain a state of the art website, iOS, Android, and windows phone apps.

  • Continuously looking for best practices and ease of use for both the user and provider.

  • Cutting edge methods and best practices.

  • Reliable service.


    • What we need -

    This is where we need you. To make LawnHiro succeed we need to reach specific goals.　

    • $16,000 Front and backend web development for LawnHiro and SnowHiro websites.　

    • $6000 for iOS app development.

    • $4000 for android app development

    • $4,000 marketing.　　

    The funds from this campaign will be used to build the heart of LawnHiro and SnowHiro. Front and back-end web design/development. Simultaneous mobile iOS and Android development. We are at the beginning of something truly revolutionary.

    If we exceed our goal, we are ready to put the funds to work and be able to launch LawnHiro and SnowHiro that much faster.

    1. Hire a full time staff to grow our markets.

    2. Be able to launch other markets that much faster.

    3. Design and implement social integration.

    4. Home office space for our new corporate family.

    5. Marketing and promotional supplies.

    6. Equipment.

    7. Computers and networking.

    8. More Red Bull.

    Risks & Challenges

    Of course with every endeavor, there will always be risks and challenges. The exciting thing is we have the experience and talent to successfully find a way through, over, under or around any challenge.

      • Hand selecting every LawnHiro and SnowHiro provider will be a big challenge. This is where we will especially take great care.
      • Building our web database- Thankfully we selected developers with decades of expertise with cutting edge technology.
      • Spreading the word- While this is a huge challenge for any start up, this is something we love to do…. And with your help, this can become a reality much faster.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    There are other ways you can help.

    • If you believe this is a great idea and would like to see it become a reality… SHARE LawnHiro with your friends and family.
    • If you think you are qualified to be a LawnHiro or SnowHiro, visit our website www.lawnhiro.com and sign up. (active after July 4, 2015)

      • We will contact you to recruit for the first of LawnHiro or SnowHiro. 　

    How nice would it be not to have to worry about your lawn anymore?

    LawnHiro will change lawn care as we know it. You will gain complete control of your time with this easy to use, free, downloadable app.

    Simply order anytime, anyplace for a lawn mow service or snow blow. You’ll know the price upfront. You’ll receive a notification of who and when your lawn mow or snow blow will occur. You’ll even receive pictures of our completed lawn or driveway. You can also schedule for an entire season.

    Thank you!


    How the idea was born.



    **all app images are artist depictions

story:
Short Summary

Hi there everyone! My name is Patricia Jaggernauth here today on behalf of the KNOW YOUR COUNTRY team. I am a Toronto personality and also an entrepreneur passionate about her country: CANADA!!

I'd like to ask you: How well do you KNOW YOUR COUNTRY?

Shockingly, many people know not very much about the country they reside in or were even born in...

That's where this project comes in.

It's called KNOW YOUR COUNTRY and it's Canada's newest most entertaining game show! On this show, we will tour across Canada, coast to coast to coast, quizzing Canadians and those living in Canada on questions they must know the answers to. Now the harder the question, the higher the dollar amount. That's right! Canadians will win cash AND gain knowledge.

This show will test all Canadians and those living in Canada and even those who have a love for Canada, people just like YOU, to find out how well you KNOW YOUR COUNTRY. This show is also the perfect learning tool for all new immigrants preparing for their Canadian citizenship test as it's teaching them about this great country.

For this campaign, we ask you to dip into your pockets and donate to this amazing Canadian initiative! We plan to have KNOW YOUR COUNTRY debut on the web THIS FALL 2015 providing a global reach, following a National TV time slot so all Canadians can tune in, watch and learn!

Only YOUR donations can make this brand, vision and Canadian dream come to life!



What We Need & What You Get


KNOW YOUR COUNTRY will need the generous donations by people like YOU to make this dream come alive! Here is a rundown of where the funding is going for Season 1 (12 episodes):

-PRODUCTION:

Editing: $8,000

Host: $6,000

Camera/Crew/Equipment Rentals (3 people): $22,000

Researcher: $2,000

Web Design: $3,000

Producer/Creator: $3,000

PR/Public Relations/Social Media: $4,000

Cash Giveaway: $10,000 (approximately $800 per episodes x 12 episodes)

Misc: $2,000 (t-shirts, caps, pens, parting gifts for contestants, etc.)



Perks:

Our perks for your generous donations are fun and unique!


-$10 x 100: KNOW YOUR COUNTRY T-Shirt

-$20 x 50: Special thanks in our show credits

-$50 x 10: Meet Patricia Jaggernauth in person and snap a photo with her too!

-$100 x 5: Be on the show, KNOW YOUR COUNTRY, and have a chance to win some cash!

-$500 x 3: 3-minute FaceTime call with Patricia Jaggernauth

-$1,000 x 2: Producer credit on KNOW YOUR COUNTRY

-$5,000 x 2: Be featured on the family edition of KNOW YOUR COUNTRY


The funds will go 100% towards the show. If we do not reach our entire goal of $60,000, less episodes will be filmed.



Risks & Challenges

There can be no reward with no risk and no risk with no reward! Over the past 4 years, we have poured our blood, sweat and tears into this project, KNOW YOUR COUNTRY, to make it what it is. It is the start of a major movement of education, insight and fun!

The risks here are quite low as we already:

1.) Own the brand;

2.) Our brand is Copyright and Trademark protected;

3.) We have the web/website platform to share it on immediately;

4.) Our host is a major, well known, National television and web personality with a large fan base;

5.) Our production team has more than 25+ years of experience;


So, as you can see, the reward of success is truly guaranteed!


Other Ways You Can Help

Being here right now shows us how much you support us and our project - and for that we are so very grateful! If you can't support us financially, help us make some noise about our campaign and help us spread the word.

Share with your friends on all of your social media platforms! Don't forget to use our Indiegogo share tools too!

LINK:

Much love from the KNOW YOUR COUNTRY team!

Thank you so much, xo
