story:
Dream of Downtown Dancewear in Gilroy, CA

I am a mom of amazing twin girls that love to perform and dance. We spend many nights at the dance studio getting homework and dinner between classes. I am a dance mom and I love it! I am active in the community and encourage my children to do the same. This year I was laid off from my job of more than 10 years in the tech industry and now have the opportunity to pursue my dreams. I want to open a store that can give young dancers the tools they need to continue learning and growing in an activity that they love doing.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $60,000 to open the doors. With this campaign are seeking to raise just $10,000 in just 14 days so we can begin working on the store. We appreciate anything that you can give - even $1! We're offering some sweet positive reinforcement starting at $100. With a donation of $100 you will receive a swag bag at our opening night event. If 100 people purchased a swag bag, we would be fully funded and ready to get the Downtown Dancewear started!

The Impact

My vision is to create a store that will be an integral part of the performer's life and our community. Gilroy & Morgan Hill are communities that promote young artists in music, dance, and theater. We have multiple dance studios and teams, cheerleader teams, marching bands and color guards, and children's musical theaters with no local resources for practice wear, shoes, and performance clothing.

All these performer's work hard at what they do and want to feel special. Personal attention, great customer service and exceptional products is what they want and need and that is what I will deliver.

Downtown Dancewear will also be an active and vocal member in the community by supporting local events and organizations working with children in the arts. We will work with local community organizations to ensure we are able to make our products accessible to all children in our community no matter their economic situation by offering discounted, barely used, items so any child in our community that wants to dance can.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenges ahead is the online market - the hurdle for most new small businesses. We will have a brick and mortar store, an online store and a personal shopper service to dance studios, trying to open as many sales streams as possible. I am very lucky to live in a community that supports local business as well as knowing that the personal touch can win over the online market.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not everyone can or want to make a donation - I totally get that. Every little bit helps though, so you can help by telling your friends about the store, sharing or liking our posts and photos on Facebook, and generally helping us spread the word about the campaign and business!
story_txt:
Dream of Downtown Dancewear in Gilroy, CA 
I am a mom of amazing twin girls that love to perform and dance. We 
spend many nights at the dance studio getting homework and dinner 
between classes. I am a dance mom and I love it! I am active in the 
community and encourage my children to do the same. This year I was laid
 off from my job of more than 10 years in the tech industry and now have
 the opportunity to pursue my dreams. I want to open a store that can 
give young dancers the tools they need to continue learning and growing 
in an activity that they love doing.

story:
Danceformation has a built-in customer base.There is a thirsty multi-million dollar personal empowerment industry. Yet, the existing programs strive to target the minds activity alone.

What I know for sure is...DANCEFORMATION works because the issue is in the tissue. The body will hold on to every single experience until we are ready to let it go, thwarting us from living the life that is sealed in our heart.


Considering those facts and looking at how my own demons had been transformed by the power of dance, I designed and strategically aligned Danceformation as the 1st Ever, dance-based, human potential program (with tactical workbook exercises and 3 Key Movement Phases; Move it OUT, Move it IN, Move it UP). To help people access the hidden compartments of their soul, and cultivate their ability to shatter old mind-sets and gain the clarity, confidence, power and resilience to redesign their reality. Be it...face issues of Weight Loss, Unforgiveness, Low Self-Esteem, Stress, High Blood Pressure, Addiction or Domestic Violence, just to name a few. All the while strengthening their spirit, allowing them to live a life of New Successes, Abounding Prosperity and INNER PEACE

Different than other Life Coaching processes Danceformation offers...

  • Accelerated learning strategies
  • Value for the body, mind and spirit
  • Essential movement exercises
  • Growth assessment exercises

Recent data has actually proven that dancing richly supports Mental Health.



· A neurology professor at Albert Einstein College of Medicine in New York, found that dancing was the only physical activity tied to a lower risk of dementia.
*Source: http://www.aarp.org/personal-growth/life-long-learning/info-2007/dancing-keeps-your-brain-sharp.html
 
· Dancing releases new neural pathways to overcome the blockage of dopamine (the hormone that makes fun).
*Source: www.parkinson.org/Parkinson-s-Disease/Treatment/Exercise/Dance-as-Exercise-for-People-with-PD

WHY CARLTON

My work as a private coach, workshop facilitator and event speaker is supported by a multitude of self-awareness philosophies I've cultivated over the years; including Religious Science Practice, the Kabbalah, the Bible, the 12 Step Sobriety Program and Meditation. The key principles that support my Empowerment Movement are Authenticity, Integrity, Forgiveness, Faith and Gratitude. 

While I'm very grateful to be a Globally Respected Life Coach and Award-Winning Author, Performer and Producer with over 20 years of film, TV and stage experience, I am, also, super thrilled that my “calling” of Empowerment Teaching is on the move to positively impact a broader, cross-section of people throughout North America and Internationally.

Some highlights of my career include Hubbard Street Dance Chicago, Madonna’s Blond Ambition and The Girlie Show world tours, The Ten Commandments at the Kodak Theater, Like Jazz at the Mark Taper Forum, starring as Garnet in The Public Theater’s - New York Shakespeare Festival production of Blade to the Heat, and as Satan in the highly acclaimed gospel stage play Tell Hell I Ain’t Comin'. Received a GLADD Media Award Nomination for my guest starring role on the television series The Mentalist, the Award of Merit - as a Producer, from the Los Angeles Cinema Festival of Hollywood for the movie trailer titled Breakout, plus a Best Actor Award from the NYLA International Film Festival for my lead role in the feature film The Boarder (Released last month on the Lifetime Movie Network as Troubled Child). 

WHAT IS NEEDED

So, here's the bottom line...aside from our already confirmed Danceformation event, next month in Trinidad...Yippy...I have three new events that I'm determined to make happen, and they are for the people of Chicago, New York and Amsterdam. And, in order to make those opportunity's be as successful as possible, I need to raise $25,000. Below is a list of what your generous contribution of funds will help me take care of...

  • Hiring a Personal Assistant
  • Airline tickets
  • Hotel  costs
  • Renting Location/Studios
  • Local Transportation
  • Hiring Videographer's 
  • Editing
  • Workbooks
  • Marketing/PR
Below are ADDITIONAL BENEFITS that further separate
our company from the competition:
*Improvisation exercises encourages both physical and fitness and mental health
*Powerful, personalized processes for localizing and dissolving useless mind-sets
*Excellent exercises for the non-dancer as well as the avid mover
*Forgiveness
*Divine Guidance
*Freed up energy
*Positive emotions
*Solidified intentions
*Lasting impressions

I just finished the completion of Danceformation, and I fell amazing. Carlton has really helped me see the blockages in my life, that I'm ready to push aside and really face my life head on. And I really appreciate that.

- Allysa Raynard

Danceformation was fantastic for me. Carlton does a really masterful job of integrating those elements; mind, body and spirit. And bringing them all together to really re-tap me back into who I am at my core and where my power truly comes from.

- Destin Gerek

I'm not a dancer, and anybody who's concerned about doing this because they're not a dancer; if this white girl can do it You can do it! And it will move you and challenge you in ways that you surely will benefit from.

- Susan Gayle Watts

For more information, and additional testimonials go to: www.mydanceformation.com

TRUST FACTOR

The overall need of this market place is trust: an adept coach and effective strategy supporting the student to move and shift psychologically from a negative reality to a powerful one. The ‘hungry for more’ are also longing for coaches that aren’t simply book and knowledge savvy, with strong strategist skills and credentials. But, are those with wisdom developed from a life that was well navigated, far up and away, from the ashes of a war zone existence. While being that person who is now able to be transparent about it all, thus bridging the gap between ‘the haves and the have nots.’ Those desired qualities are  what I'm committed to providing!

INFLUENCE

Can't contribute? That doesn't mean you can't support my Empowerment Movement:

  • Ask your friends to spread the word and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Share and like the Danceformation fan page at https://www.facebook.com/mydanceformation
  • Or simply use the Indiegogo share tools

MY GIFT FOR YOU

Simply click the link below and you can get my 3 Key Tips To Living Empowered at: http://livingfrontandcenter.com/

Thank you for any contribution or support to help make Danceformation a success!!

God Speed...

Carlton

story:
Where your donations go and why Crowdfunding

The lion's share (more than 50%) of all contributions "Avevitus" Social Rehabilitation and Development center receives are spent on the RENT of PREMISES!!! 

Through this crowdfunding campaign, we aim to raise an initial 390K USD in order to acquire premises we currently rent. In case we are able to exceed the goal substantially  we would be able to construct our own center on the privately held land.

It is our wish to use rised funds for hiring best possible specialists in the market to help children rehabilitate socially rather than to spend the contributions for the Real Estate Moguls!!!

Crowdfunding seems like a great way to do that. We really appreciate your feedback, as well as your support and contributions. Your feedback and support will help us make "Avevitus" the best it can be!

This project is running independently for more than 5 years raising funds thgrough subsidies and donations, but to achieve such a big goal we hope for your support which would help us to reach our goal much faster. Every dollar contributed is directed to improve the quality of "Avevitus" center services for children.

We are committed to Give children the best available social rehabilitation services and will not settle for anything less. With the years of experience and best experts on the market we have what it takes to deliver the best for the children in need, we just need You to join us in this effort. All of us together can be a part of this small miracle changing a child's life for the better!

About Us

   Social Development and Rehabilitation Center "Avevitus" - is a non-profit multifunction physical development and therapy center. It provides effective additional special education for disabled children, caring for their leisure time, as well as helping to create well-being for their families.

At "Avevitus", children with special needs are taught to recognize and manage their disability and to look after themselfs. Through exercises and play we help them learn to orientate and move in the environment, improve their fine motoric skills, cognition and physical development. At "Avevitus" children gain positive emotions and self-confidence to prepare them for life.

Family members of disabled children also get the environment to share information and experiences collectively, they are then better prepared to manage psychological problems resulting from disability, including difficulties in conjugal relations, while trying to overcome the fear of publicity, as well as to better integrate into the society.


Our Target Group

  Children who are 4-10 years of age with moderate to severe physical disability also with mild to moderate mental retardation, as well as children having disorders related to social and role functioning, sensory, hearing, hypersensitivity, vestibular and body motility.

Our mission
  Helping disabled children to grow up Healthy, Educated and Motivated!

Our vision
 Social Development and Rehabilitation Centre "Avevitus"- is the place:

  • where children with disabilities are treated with individual therapy;
  • where children are taught self-sufficiency, knowledge of the world as well as how to communicate, share and enjoy life;
  • where parents and their children are welcome to join mutual assistance groups that enable them to share information, relieve anxiety as well as to celebrate children's achievements.

How Can We Help



Perks: "Avevitus" Kids TAHNK YOU!

    10 USD - "Avevitus"  Kids Yellow Virtual Hi-Five              

   20 USD - Special "Avevitus" Kids Yellow Band            

    30 USD - Special "Avevitus" Kids Yellow Cap             

   40 USD - Special "Avevitus" Kids Yellow T-Shirt       

  45 USD - Special "Avevitus" Yellow Calendar   

  50 USD -  "Avevitus" Kids Drawings Book       

  70 USD -        +    


  90 USD -   + +


  135 USD -   + ++ 


  185 USD - + ++ +

  370 USD - 2 x + ++ + 

  555 USD - 3 x + ++ + 

  740 USD - 4 x + ++ + 

  925 USD - 5 x + ++ + 

  1850 USD - 10 x + ++ + 



What You Can Do To Help

  •   Donate Now: when you give, you directly impact the lives of the children and send a clear message that our community is stronger because we are united!
  •   Tell Your Friends: Please share the "Avevitus" Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, email - whatever you can do to help us get our children to life!

    •      On behalf of the children we serve, 100 000 thanks for anything you can  
               do to help!



    Press about us

    http://www.delfi.lt/news/daily/health/tevu-meiles-stebuklas-po-klastingos-infekcijos-nesiorientavusia-dukra-ismoke-gyventi.d?id=63546704

    http://www.respublika.lt/lt/naujienos/lietuva/kitos_lietuvos_zinios/isgyventi_imanoma_tik_suremus_pecius/http://www.bernardinai.lt/straipsnis/2013-09-05-penkiolikmete-savanore-ieva-padek-uzaugti-reikia-tavo-pagalbos/106475

story:
In a world of cookie cutter subdivisions and factory farms, we are offering you the opportunity to join us in restoring and preserving a historic barn in its proper place on a circa 1850 working farm.

Timberwood Farm is a small family farm in Rhoadesville, Va,  committed to raising Heritage Breed Livestock in a natural and humane manner.    Timberwood Farm raises Nigerian Dwarf Dairy Goats,  Clun Forest Sheep,  New Hampshire and Araucana chickens, Narragansett Turkeys, Tamworth pigs, as well as Heirloom Vegtables.  Established in 2001 in Caroline County, Virginia, we moved to a larger 17 acre farm in Orange County, Virginia in 2008, and  are currently expanding to a larger 52 acre, circa  1850 farm.  In addition to our regular farming activities, we also make the farm available for educational visit by both public and private school groups.

Among the on the new farm's outbuildings are two that are historically contemporary to the main circa 1850 farmhouse, a corn crib/feed storage building and a barn.  Both these building played an important part in the daily life of the farm.  Unfortunately, the former owners allowed these buildings to fall into disrepair and they are in need major stabilization and restoration to preserve them for their intended use.  We have undertaken, on our own, the restoration on the corn crib but, are asking for your assistance in restoration of the barn.
While the roof and the upper part of the structure are sound, much of the foundation, sills, and lower posts need to be stabilized, repaired, or replaced.  The funds raise by this campaign shall be spent toward the materials needed for the stabilization, restoration, and preservation of the Barn.  Any funds collected in excess of our funding goal will go towards the restoration of other historic structures on the farm. 
The First Stage of the project will involve jacking up the building and repairing or replacing foundational footing, support columns, and sill beams.  This will allow to  us to stabilize and level the Barn.  Estimated cost of materials for the First Stage: $2400.00.
The Second Stage of the project will involve re-siding the barn.  Estimated cost of materials for the Second Stage:  $1800.00.
The Third Stage of the project will involve the restoration of the roof.  Estimated cost of the Third Stage: $800.00.

Check out the available perks, help us preserve the Barn of the future, spread the word, and share our campaign with your friends,  In addition, if our campaign is successful and upon completion of the barn restoration, everyone who donates $100.00 or more will be invited to attend a Day On Timberwood Farm event, which will feature a grand dedication of the newly restored Barn.  
For more information on Timberwood Farm, visit our website at www,timberwoodfarmandfiber.com, or our Facebook page, TimberwoodBarn.

Timberwood Farm is a small family farm in Rhoadesville, Va,  committed to raising Heritage Breed Livestock in a natural and humane manner.    Timberwood Farm raises Nigerian Dwarf Dairy Goats,  Clun Forest Sheep,  New Hampshire and Araucana chickens, Narragansett Turkeys, Tamworth pigs, as well as Heirloom Vegtables.  Established in 2001 in Caroline County, Virginia, we moved to a larger 17 acre farm in Orange County, Virginia in 2008, and  are currently expanding to a larger 52 acre, circa  1850 farm.  In addition to our regular farming activities, we also make the farm available for educational visit by both public and private school groups.
Among the on the new farm's outbuildings are two that are historically contemporary to the main circa 1850 farmhouse, a corn crib/feed storage building and a barn.  Both these building played an important part in the daily life of the farm.  Unfortunately, the former owners allowed these buildings to fall into disrepair and they are in need major stabilization and restoration to preserve them for their intended use.  We have undertaken, on our own, the restoration on the corn crib but, are asking for your assistance in restoration of the barn.
While the roof and the upper part of the structure are sound, much of the foundation, sills, and lower posts need to be stabilized, repaired, or replaced.  The funds raise by this campaign shall be spent toward the materials needed for the stabilization, restoration, and preservation of the Barn.  Any funds collected in excess of our funding goal will go towards the restoration of other historic structures on the farm.  The First Stage of the project will involve jacking up the building and repairing or replacing foundational footing, support columns, and sill beams.  This will allow to  us to stabilize and level the Barn.  Estimated cost of materials for the First Stage: $2400.00.
The Second Stage of the project will involve re-siding the barn.  Estimated cost of materials for the Second Stage:  $1800.00.
The Third Stage of the project will involve the restoration of the roof.  Estimated cost of the Third Stage: $800.00.
Check out the available perks, help us preserve the Barn of the future, spread the word, and share our campaign with your friends,  In addition, if our campaign is successful and upon completion of the barn restoration, everyone who donates $100.00 or more will be invited to attend a Day On Timberwood Farm event, which will feature a grand dedication of the newly restored Barn.  For more information on Timberwood Farm, visit our website at www,timberwoodfarmandfiber.com, or our Facebook page, TimberwoodBarn.

story:
• BEST QUALITY ORGANICLY GROWN VANILLA AND RAINFOREST HONEY.    

My name is James Francisco, I'm 40yrs old and  I'm a father of two.  We live as caretakers on a property in Cape Tribulation QLD, where I have been living for the past 8yrs. I have been growing vanilla orchids for more than 10yrs  and have also mastered the arts of hand pollination of the flowers, and curing of the beans. I have enough vanilla orchids to plant out over a thousand vines and if given enough land, over the first 2yrs could increase this number by more than 10 times that (10,000 vines).  Each orchid can take up to 3yrs to start producing flowers but can produce up to 100 flowers each season. Each flower that is successfully pollinated than grows a bean. Each bean then takes about 8mths to mature than another 3mths to cure. and 5than another 2mths for the vanillin to set. than they are ready for use. For the first 3yrs, rainforest honey will be my biggest produce. I would like to add coffee and cocoa to my produce list in the future also.

    I wish to raise $100,000 to purchase a suitable block of land to set up and plant out all my vanilla with plenty of room for expantion, build a shed for storage of tools and equipment and also for curing beans and packaging  finished  product,, solar power and back up generator (as there is no mains power north of the Daintree river ). $100,000 is about the minimum amount of funding I need, considering land prices. I really need $200,000. I  aim to get organic certification on my vanilla, as all my vanilla is grown  organically. I will establish a large Apiary and rent hives out to some of the fruit farms in the area and to some of the local garden enthusiasts also. The best place to grow vanilla is in the rainforest for little or no clearing of trees is required. so it is also rainforest safe. I would like to donate a percentage of my profits to a rainforest preservation fund. By producing a large vanilla plantation and apiary, not only would I be producing ongoing work and income for myself and family , ongoing casual and  seasonal work within the community. but also a sustainable future for my children and the environment we live in. I have the knowledge, the skill  and the will to achieve. I have the orchids, bee boxes are on there way, All I need now is the funding for the land. I have already set up one other vanilla plantation of 150 vines for a friend of mine, as a gift for him and his wife, and will teach them the whole process as we go. Could some body please help me with my project, to produce a larger vanilla industry in northern Australia, and also help with the survival of the other pollinators, the bee's.

story:
Hey,

Let me introduce myself. My name is Jeanette Edmead and I’m 40 years old. There is no sob story to tell and life is pretty good at the moment. Over the last few years I’ve completed my 200hrs RYS Yoga Teacher Training course with Yoga First UAE, became certified to teach Swing Yoga, had my eyes lasered and have worked on myself inside and out! All of this takes time and money, of which I was happy to do. I completed my first degree and postgraduate degree in Business Studies and Spanish language.

I want to realise my dream of opening a yoga retreat in Colombia for the LGBT community. The retreat will offer a combination of cooking classes, dance, yoga and meditation. My passions! 

Why Colombia?

In 2016, Colombia legalized same sex marriage.

After 52 years of civil war, on 25th June 2016, Colombia signed a ceasefire        agreement.

Colombia approves full adoption rights for same-sex couples.

Colombia is one of a handful of countries in Central and South America to   have an LGBT chamber of Commerce.  https://www.iglta.org/colombian-lgbt- chamber-of-commerce-cclgbtco/

In 2016 Colombia was’Named The Happiest In The World, Again.
’http://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/this-country-was-just-named-the-    happiest-in-the-world-again_us_568c0ce4e4b0b958f65d1d7a
In 2013,  Medellin, Colombia, was named ‘Innovative City Of The Year’ In WSJ And Citi Global Competition. http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2013/03/02/medellin-named-innovative-city-of-the-year_n_2794425.html

I could go on and on and on as to why Colombia is the right place for Younityoga retreat.

The retreat will be open to families, singles and couples. Historically I have been active in the LGBT community in my home town of Birmingham in the UK, however, my heart is desperately calling for a home in Colombia where I can create a safe space for the LGBTQ community to come with their children, partners or alone and practice yoga, meditation, learn how to cook fusion Caribbean dishes and dance together!

The funds will be used to:

Buy or rent a rural property on the northern coast of Colombia

Decorate the inside and outside of the property

Furnish the property

Buy yoga equipment

Buy swing equipment

Buy mini stoves, cooking equipment and utensils

The retreat will offer:

Cookery classes

Dance

Ladies only retreats

Family retreats

Singles retreats

Couples retreats

Open retreats

Younityoga Mission Statement

We aim to provide a welcoming, secure, safe, fulfilling and harmonious environment where guests practice yoga and share their passions in life with other members of the LGBTQ community.

Our core values

Excellence

We aim to consistently offer amazing life enhancing  experiences during your stay at our retreat, every time and to everyone

Fun

We aim to create an atmosphere of fun, laughter and a celebration of life.

Inclusiveness and diversity

We believe that every member of the LGBTQ community has the right to practice yoga in a safe and welcoming environment.

Community

We aim to foster healthy and positive relationships with every single guest and the wider community.

Commitment / integrity / accountability

We aim to do what we say, and say what we mean. We aim to encourage an atmosphere of mutual trust and respect.

Sustainability

We aim to do our bit for mother earth.

I wholeheartedly believe in this concept and following an initial reconnaissance visit to Colombia in December 2015, I know that the time is now. Younityoga is about the LGBTQ community and our friends. Together we can do it!

Many thanks in advance. 

Jeanette

story:
The Food Bank MIKHUNA is a non profit organization that aims to improve the nutritional, growth and development conditions of vulnerable families in the province of Azuay, Ecuador, in order to reach food sovereignity in rural and marginal urban areas. The Food Bank MIKHUNA is an unprecedented initiative under the aegis of EQUIDAR project. 

Since the early beginnings in 2012, EQUIDAR project has been reducing malnutrition in the province through a comprehensive program that aids nowadays the 9,600 most vulnerable families in the province. Currently, the program further involves 3,200 small scale dairy farmers, mixed-economy company Lactjubones, and 168 neighborhood stores that support the families with a daily distribution of 9,600 boxes of fresh whole milk. In order to give integrity to the program, volunteering university students take medical-psychological records to monitor and measure the obtained results in time, offer free comprehensive dental care, train parents on productive entrepreneurship and run workshops on nutrition, social and gender equity. In addition, the program encourages community participation and the eradication of domestic violence.

Facts and figures:

  • 40% of households with domestic violence
  • There have been 6,100 medical records created, and 10,000 children and 5,000 mothers examined. 3,038 children and 161 mothers found in a state of malnutrition
  • By free distribution of 9,600 liters of milk daily, we have reached 34,000 beneficiaries and 18,000 participating children
  • 4,500 comprehensive dental care sessions
  • 900 blood counts made

Given these high rates of malnutrition, we have been working hard to start another initiative and intensify our fight. In the end, we have opted for a pilot idea here in Azuay, which has been proved to work elsewhere in the world- a Food Bank! In November 2015, we launched MIKHUNA, the first Food Bank in the province of Azuay, Ecuador. The main objective of MIKHUNA is to collect enough foodstuffs to provide the 9,600 families with at a symbolic price. 

What is a Food Bank?

A Food Bank is a nonprofit organization, based on volunteerism and contribution of companies and individuals committed to fighting against hunger and malnutrition. There are more than 1,000 food banks worldwide helping over 40 million people annually. 

The purpose of the MIKHUNA Food Bank is to collect:

  • Food in perfect condition with upcoming expiration dates.
  • Food with defective packaging or containers suitable for human consumption
  • Surplus food from mass production
  • Food that does not meet the highest standards of market (Too small vegetables and fruits, or with no standard form etc.).

The collected food is distributed in the shortest possible time to the neediest families; decreasing at the same time the wastage rate in the province of Azuay. This is how we will facilitate access to healthy and nutritional food and improve health conditions of the vulnerable populations. 

How does MIKHUNA work?

Companies or individuals donate perfectly consumable food to the MIKHUNA Food Bank where these foodstuffs are selected, classified and stored. After the verification of the socioeconomic status, the foodstuffs are distributed to the neediest families at a symbolic price. 

In order to contribute to the food security in our province by implementing the first Food Bank, we have made a strategic alliance with the Foundation Hearts of Gold and the Social Pastoral Vicariate of Turi.


Financial matters

Despite all our efforts, we have very limited financial resources that prevent us from reaching our goal. The 2016 budget for MIKHUNA is 60,000 USD. Why is it so little? Because this is what Ecuadorean government allocated to this project and the amount is irrevocable.

Since the initial costs are always higher, with this amount of money we can only reach out to 200 families. Therefore, we need your help to reach out to 9600 families daily!


We need your help

With your help, we can achieve our goal to reach out to 9,600 families daily and improve the quality of life of those in greatest need. With your support, children will have a healthy and nutritious breakfast, have energy and better school performance. Only with your back up, we can give a promising future to the families of the province of Azuay.

To reach the goal, we are still missing 300,000 USD.

To run a well performing Food Bank, we need:

  • Adaptation of the Food Bank area - 15,000 USD. We have invested around 18,000 USD and are almost done here, but we still need to adjust several rooms to get a fully working facility.
  • Cold-storage rooms - 40,000 USD. Up to now, we have been working with non-perishable foodstuffs because we have no place to store the fresh ones. However, fresh products like fruits and vegetables are much healthier! 
  • Freezers- 15,000 USD. Voluminous freezers guarantee the freshness of the collected food.
  • 4 refrigerated trucks  - 110,000 USD. They are indispensable to distribute the foods to all the corners of the province while keeping the food fresh. 
  • Inventory, accounting and beneficiary-monitoring software - 25,000 USD. This tool is vital to ensure the efficiency and operativeness of the Bank. It will keep a record of medical, psychological, dental and nutritional conditions of the beneficiaries. 
  • Training workshops- 30,000 USD. We intend to train the beneficiaries on how to treat the foodstuffs: storage, cleaning, cooking, and on how to grow agro-economically, for example family orchards. We aim to bring respective experts to Cuenca to teach the workshops. 
  • Mass fundraising events - 30,000 USD. We plan on organizing 2 massive fundraising events per year in order to gather more money for the bank. 
  • Awareness-building campaign - 25,000 USD. It is fundamental to let everybody know about our existence and raise awareness about the cause we fight for. Once we are well-known, we will be more successful in raising funds.
  • Advertising campaign- 10,000 USD. We would love to reach to as many people as possible. More people conscious about the MIKHUNA Food Bank and willing to help, more improved lives in Azuay.


Perks

There are appealing perks for all of you who are willing to pledge! 
Pledge 1$ or more! Join the MIKHUNA community and receive an e-card and a MIKHUNA Food Bank newsletter!
Pledge 15$ or more! Get a thank-you note on MIKHUNA website and an e-card too!
Pledge 25$ or more! Get all the previous perks plus a figurine of chola cuencana  (traditional woman from Cuenca, Azuay province) with a real life story of one of the beneficiaries. 
Pledge 50$ or more! Get all the previous perks plus a figurine of chola cuencana  (traditional woman from Cuenca, Azuay province)with a real lifes tory of one of the beneficiaries. Shipping to anywhere in the world.
Pledge 75$ or more! Receive a diploma, the chola cuencana figurine and an e-card! 
Pledge 100$ or more! Receive a diploma, the chola cuencana figurine and an e-card! Shipping to anywhere in the world.

Pledge 250$ or more! Start the New Year with a personalized calendar with photos of beneficiaries and their testimonies! Shipping to anywhere in the world. You´ll receive the diploma, chola figurine and e-card too.

Pledge 500$ or more! We´ll send you a brochure with receipts from Azuay province, a personalized calendar with photos of beneficiaries and their testimonies, diploma, chola figurine and e-card. Shipping to anywhere in the world.

Pledge 1,000$ or more! We´ll engrave your name into the wall at the MIKHUNA Food Bank as an expression of our eternal gratitude. Plus, we´ll send you a brochure with receipts from Azuay province, a personalized calendar with photos of beneficiaries and their testimonies, diploma, chola figurine and e-card. Shipping to anywhere in the world.

Pledge 5,000$ or more! We will name a truck of a freezer the Food Bank uses after you! We´ll engrave your name into the wall at the MIKHUNA Food Bank as an expression of our eternal gratitude. Plus, we´ll send you a brochure with receipts from Azuay province, a personalized calendar with photos of beneficiaries and their testimonies, diploma, chola figurine and e-card. Shipping to anywhere in the world.

Pledge 10,000$ or more! We invite you to Cuenca, Ecuador for a week to show you around the MIKHUNA Food Bank, all the facilities, the city and we will take you to meet beneficiary families. We will cover the accommodation and meal expenses. In addition, we´ll engrave your name into the wall at MIKHUNA Food Bank and send you a brochure with receipts from Azuay province, a personalized calendar with photos of beneficiaries and their testimonies, diploma, chola figurine and e-card. Shipping to anywhere in the world.

Pledge 50,000$ or more! We can´t believe it! And you won´t either! We will send the director of the Food Bank to your place for a week. He is a nice guy! He may hold seminars, workshops and trainings, he can teach you to cook typical Ecuadorian recipes and more! In addition, we´ll engrave your name into the wall at MIKHUNA Food Bank and send you a brochure with receipts from Azuay province, a personalized calendar with photos of beneficiaries and their testimonies, diploma, chola figurine and e-card. Shipping to anywhere in the world. 

What if we do not meet the funding goal? It does not matter, we are deeply grateful for every single raised dollar. We will happily invest the raised money into the necessary equipment anyway. We need to make this work! 


The impact

So far, we have big goals and little money. With the budget we have for 2016, 60,000 USD, MIKHUNA Food Bank aims to decrease by 5% the chronic and acute malnutrition of 50 children participating in Equidar who are currently in state of malnutrition and judged the most critical. At the same time, MIKHUNA intends to deliver 1 bag of food every two weeks to each of the families involved in the Food Bank. Also, we aspire to improve the daily diet by 10% of 200 families involved in Equidar. Last but not least, we plan to avoid the waste of 3 tons of foodstuffs in the city of Cuenca. 

However, the impact may be much greater with your help. With your help we can expand the coverage to the 9600 most vulnerable families in the province!


Risks and Challenges

The main risk is lack of finance. We depend each month on the contribution of financial resources from the central government and due to the economic crisis that dominates Ecuador, our finances are very limited and thus we fear the future and feasibility of the project during the next year. Anyway, we will not give up!

When it comes to challenges, the most complicated part is to convince big local and national companies to donate food. In Ecuador, social responsibility is not embedded in the legal norms and therefor it is still an abstract concept. To overcome this difficulty, the plan is to advocate for social responsibility through awareness raising campaigns. We intend to achieve a greater impact and have more persuasive voice as we reach out to more and more people on the planet


Other ways to help

In case you cannot pledge, it does not mean you cannot help! Help us spread the word about MIKHUNA Food Bank on Facebook, Twitter and among your family and friends. You can also share it directly from Indiegogo.

If you have any additional questions, do not hesitate to contact us! Thank you very much for helping us to make the world a better place ! 

XOXO Love, the province of Azuay

Pledge 1$ or more! Join the MIKHUNA community and receive an e-card and a MIKHUNA Food Bank newsletter!


Pledge 15$ or more! Get a thank-you note on MIKHUNA website and an e-card too!

Pledge 25$ or more! Get all the previous perks plus a figurine of chola cuencana  (traditional woman from Cuenca, Azuay province) with a real life story of one of the beneficiaries. 

Pledge 50$ or more! Get all the previous perks plus a figurine of chola cuencana  (traditional woman from Cuenca, Azuay province)with a real lifes tory of one of the beneficiaries. Shipping to anywhere in the world.

Pledge 75$ or more! Receive a diploma, the chola cuencana figurine and an e-card! 

Pledge 100$ or more! Receive a diploma, the chola cuencana figurine and an e-card! Shipping to anywhere in the world.


Pledge 250$ or more! Start the New Year with a personalized calendar with photos of beneficiaries and their testimonies! Shipping to anywhere in the world. You´ll receive the diploma, chola figurine and e-card too.

Pledge 500$ or more! We´ll send you a brochure with receipts from Azuay province, a personalized calendar with photos of beneficiaries and their testimonies, diploma, chola figurine and e-card. Shipping to anywhere in the world.
Pledge 1,000$ or more! We´ll engrave your name into the wall at the MIKHUNA Food Bank as an expression of our eternal gratitude. Plus, we´ll send you a brochure with receipts from Azuay province, a personalized calendar with photos of beneficiaries and their testimonies, diploma, chola figurine and e-card. Shipping to anywhere in the world.
Pledge 5,000$ or more! We will name a truck of a freezer the Food Bank uses after you! We´ll engrave your name into the wall at the MIKHUNA Food Bank as an expression of our eternal gratitude. Plus, we´ll send you a brochure with receipts from Azuay province, a personalized calendar with photos of beneficiaries and their testimonies, diploma, chola figurine and e-card. Shipping to anywhere in the world.




Pledge 10,000$ or more! We invite you to Cuenca, Ecuador for a week to show you around the MIKHUNA Food Bank, all the facilities, the city and we will take you to meet beneficiary families. We will cover the accommodation and meal expenses. In addition, we´ll engrave your name into the wall at MIKHUNA Food Bank and send you a brochure with receipts from Azuay province, a personalized calendar with photos of beneficiaries and their testimonies, diploma, chola figurine and e-card. Shipping to anywhere in the world.

Pledge 50,000$ or more! We can´t believe it! And you won´t either! We will send the director of the Food Bank to your place for a week. He is a nice guy! He may hold seminars, workshops and trainings, he can teach you to cook typical Ecuadorian recipes and more! In addition, we´ll engrave your name into the wall at MIKHUNA Food Bank and send you a brochure with receipts from Azuay province, a personalized calendar with photos of beneficiaries and their testimonies, diploma, chola figurine and e-card. Shipping to anywhere in the world. 
What if we do not meet the funding goal? It does not matter, we are deeply grateful for every single raised dollar. We will happily invest the raised money into the necessary equipment anyway. We need to make this work! 
   
The impact So far, we have big goals and little money. With the budget we have for 2016, 60,000 USD, MIKHUNA Food Bank aims to decrease by 5% the chronic and acute malnutrition of 50 children participating in Equidar who are currently in state of malnutrition and judged the most critical. At the same time, MIKHUNA intends to deliver 1 bag of food every two weeks to each of the families involved in the Food Bank. Also, we aspire to improve the daily diet by 10% of 200 families involved in Equidar. Last but not least, we plan to avoid the waste of 3 tons of foodstuffs in the city of Cuenca. 
However, the impact may be much greater with your help. With your help we can expand the coverage to the 9600 most vulnerable families in the province!
    
Risks and Challenges The main risk is lack of finance. We depend each month on the contribution of financial resources from the central government and due to the economic crisis that dominates Ecuador, our finances are very limited and thus we fear the future and feasibility of the project during the next year. Anyway, we will not give up!
When it comes to challenges, the most complicated part is to convince big local and national companies to donate food. In Ecuador, social responsibility is not embedded in the legal norms and therefor it is still an abstract concept. To overcome this difficulty, the plan is to advocate for social responsibility through awareness raising campaigns. We intend to achieve a greater impact and have more persuasive voice as we reach out to more and more people on the planet
    
Other ways to help

In case you cannot pledge, it does not mean you cannot help! Help us spread the word about MIKHUNA Food Bank on Facebook, Twitter and among your family and friends. You can also share it directly from Indiegogo.
If you have any additional questions, do not hesitate to contact us! Thank you very much for helping us to make the world a better place ! 
XOXO Love, the province of Azuay

story:
Shopping for a Change (SFAC) is a 501 (3)(c) that helps artisans, artisan co-ops, and companies that employs these artisans from impoverished areas, sell fair-trade goods via our digital marketplace. 

We pay the artisans up front for their goods, sell their products, then donate our net proceeds to:

  •  fund international community improvement projects focused on clean water, healthcare, and education in the artisans' communities, 
  • U.S.-based nonprofits (nonprofits that YOU get to choose at checkout)!

We need your help to further progress the amazing work being done, and the improvement we are seeing in the lives of people both here and abroad. We need the ability to: purchase beautiful new inventory, create marketing materials, maintain our website, and grow our team. Added funds for SFAC will allow us to provide work for additional artisans, enabling even more impoverished women (men too!) to continue improving their lives through their own efforts. SFAC operates as an all-volunteer organization with no salaries and no rent.

Our story began in 2009 when our founder, Stacey Horowitz, visited Peru with her family.

She witnessed the ugly face of hunger and poverty in sharp contrast with the innate beauty of these regions first hand. Noticing the wealth of artistic talent passed down through generations, she knew that given the right circumstances, this could be their means to a better life.

She learned that many women were the sole providers for their families, and had been affected by atrocities such as illness, spousal abuse, war, unemployment, and death. Realizing, but for an accident of birth, it could have been her living under similar conditions, Stacey arrived home a different person. She felt compelled to do something to help better the lives of these women and their children. The following year she founded Shopping for a Change®  to combat some of these problems in a way familiar to most of us —online shopping.


Step 1: We pay our artisans up front for their creations according to the terms they set, so they immediately benefit from their work. When you buy their products from us through our website and live events, you provide them the means to lift themselves from poverty and enable them to feed, shelter, and educate their children, thereby opening doors to socioeconomic change.

Step 2: The net proceeds from your purchases are then split two ways. Fifty percent is used to fund Community Improvement Projects and grants abroad. The other fifty percent is directed to a U.S. based charitable organization chosen by the consumer at checkout. Below are just some of the nonprofits that we work with. The impact of your purchase not only affects the artisans, but their families, their communities, their countries—and ours.

     

    


It thrills us to say that in the five years since our launch, we have grown from partnering with 11 artisan groups in Africa and South America to over 50 artisan groups spanning 4 continents and 28 countries. And through our network of artisan partnerships we are touching the lives of over 43,000 artisans. Our business has more than tripled, indicating that people are excited by the way our organization enables them to help both at home and abroad. We have completed 4 community improvement projects with our next project to be funded in January 2016.

The Future Looks Bright Project: Half of the net proceeds from our 2015 product sales will be used to provide eyewear for 2500 artisans across three (3) continents, who need glasses for their detailed work. Between the ages of 30-55 yrs. old, people typically begin to lose their ability to clearly see up close, which can be truly devastating for an artisan. Not only does their production begin to dwindle when they cannot see well, but they risk losing their ability to work entirely. By providing this eyewear they will once again be capable of working to their fullest capacity, enabling them to provide necessary food, shelter and education for their children.

Read about our completed community improvement projects here.

"This is so exciting!  The knitters that we work with are thrilled - this will make a big difference in their daily lives.  Thank you. “~Adrienne Chaillé, Director of Marketing, Sales & Community Development @Emilime, Peru






























I Can't Contribute But I Want To Help!

                                 Any Suggestions?

Please click on any or all of the or orbuttons at the top of the page, directly below the Video to help spread the word. You are awesome, thanks for offering your support!!

        If you would prefer to donate by mailing us a check, please send it to:

Shopping for a Change, 951 Mariners Island Blvd.,Suite 240,San Mateo, CA 94404.

                                                                    Thank you!

Help us spread the word about our campaign! Share our IndieGoGo link with your social network and instantly be entered in our referral contest. By using these share tools located beneath our video
(be sure to login first), we will be able to track your referrals through a unique link. At the end of our campaign, the person who has referred the most contributors will receive a $100 Gift Card to Shopping for a Change®. Contest runs the entire duration of the campaign, the winner will be directly contacted and posted on our update page.

Shopping for a Change® is a Top-Rate Nonprofit  four years running: 2012, 2013, 2014 and 2015.


     

In December, 2013 Stacey received the                                                                             Prestigious Jefferson Award for Public Service


Change lives this holiday season, go 

Shopping for a Change® !

 Visit us at www.shoppingforachange.org

story:
AN UPDATE (February 2016):

It has been a very busy start to the new year for us here at Jervoise, but we have GOOD NEWS to share with you all...

Thanks to the efforts of the crowdfunding and awareness that the campaign created, we have secured ALL of the funds required to build a new abattoir here at Jervoise Station - from plans to construction and full operation!

This has been made possible through the kindness and generosity of a fellow North Queenslander who has offered to help us in a financial capacity. This is not a hand OUT, it is a hand UP, and once we are up and operating again, we will be able to repay this great kindness.

The money we raised from the crowdfunding is being used to cover the cost of the abattoir plans and Government fees that we need to pay to get the build approved. Plans are being finalised as we write this, our builder is on standby and boxes are being ticked with the appropriate Councils.

Within the first year of the new abattoir being open, we plan to be producing our own goat, lamb, pigs and chickens as well as our beef. All of these will be grown on Jervoise and fully certified organic.

To those of you that donated to our campaign, those that shared and helped us get the word out - we cannot THANK YOU enough. The future of our farm and our family has been secured and we are excited to be moving towards again being able to provide North Queensland families with quality organic product.

Please follow us on our Facebook page for updates on the build and supply of Jervoise products during this time. 

In gratitude ...Kerry, Kristine and the Jonsson family xx


"We're a hard working bunch, and proud too. So it's mighty hard for us to ask for help. But we know that if we don't raise enough money, Jervoise will close and our family will be left with nothing. North Queensland will also loose it's largest certified organic beef producer." ~ Kerry Jonsson

=============================

About Jervoise 

Jervoise is an organic cattle station in North Queensland. We have 70,000 acres of land and currently run about 5,000 head of certified organic cattle.


The station has been owned and run by the Jonsson family since 1965, and we've always done things a little differently from the norm. Greg Jonsson ('Pa') decided to stop dipping and spraying the cattle back in 1979, a move which had our farmer neighbours questioning whether he'd spent too much time in the sun! 

These days, eliminating the use of chemicals from food production hardly seems radical, but back then there wasn't such a thing as 'organic farming' or a certified organic body, let alone accreditation standards like we have now.

We gained our official organic certification in 1996 and up until we lost our abattoir in 2014, our business was thriving. In fact, we were experiencing a surge in demand for organic meat as consumers became more aware of animal welfare, a concern for the environment and food free from chemicals and hormones. 



=============================

So how did we lose our abattoir?

We knew that in order to be able to control the quality of our meat and ensure that it didn't come into contact with any chemicals or poisons, we needed to have our own processing facility. So in 2005 we embarked on an ambitious project to buy our own abattoir. 

We took a loan out from an Australian banking institution and purchased a property on the coast, at nearby Tully, and opened Far North Queensland's first and only certified organic abattoir. Business was booming and our market was growing steadily.  

But in 2014 disaster hit for us. We were contacted by Powerlink and told that the land on which the abattoir sat was to be acquired to expand an existing substation. It was to be a mandatory land acquisition and there was nothing we could do to fight it. We had no choice but to accept a payout amount from the Queensland Government which was insufficient to allow us to build a new abattoir, and we had to walk away. 


In yet another blow, our banking institution took the entire payout to reduce our debt to equity ratio due to non organic values being used by the bank, leaving us with no way to rebuild.


It was absolutely devastating, to lose everything that we'd worked so hard for ten years to build.


Since then we've been forced to hire the facilities of other abattoirs around North Queensland in order to keep our loyal customers satisfied and to provide the quality product they have come to know and expect. However, we can only hire the facilities for three days at a time during weekends, when we need it for at least a week. We're at the mercy of the facility owners with regards to availability. We also need to thoroughly clean any hired facilities to ensure they are free from harmful chemicals prior to use and it's an extremely costly exercise for us. It's simply not sustainable for us to continue like this.

=============================

Where to from here?

Since losing our abattoir we have been transporting our animals approximately 320kms on a stressful journey. We then process the meat and store it in Cairns 400kms away. We then drive 250kms home, meaning we are practically living on the roads. Transporting our animals in this way is detrimental to them and to the quality of the final meat product. Our family is suffering, we are always on the road and never home, and it is dangerous and exhausting, both physically and mentally.

We need to build an abattoir right here at Jervoise Station. By doing this we will again have complete control of the processing of our own certified organic beef, with animal welfare and the welfare of our family greatly improved. This will mean we can continue doing what we love and what we are passionate about - farming healthy, organic cattle, peacefully.


=============================

Where's the Indegogo money going?

We need to raise $250k so that we can, in combination with a loan from the Government's Queensland Rural Adjustment Authority (QRAA) program, build and equip the first stage of a fully integrated multi-species organic abattoir at Jervoise Station, our home of 50 years.

We’ll use the IndieGoGo funds raised here to fund the first stage of the building process - paying the architect for the building plans, paying the SARA fees to be able to operate the abattoir, and to engage contractors to lay the building foundations and initial shed construction. The QRAA loans are limited to only $200,000 for equipment so we will also need to use some of the funds we are raising here to purchase essential equipment.

Once we've covered the cost of those initial building stages, the final steps will be funded through a special loan from the QRAA.

The new abattoir will be certified organic which means we'll be able to put into action our plans to expand into other areas of production - organic chicken, lamb and pork - which is in huge demand in Queensland.


How you can help

1. Donate now, every little bit helps!

2. Share this page on your own Facebook or Instagram page and hashtag #savejervoise

3. Share this page via email to your friends and colleagues.

4. Take a photo of yourself holding a sign that says 'I/we donated to help save Jervoise Station #savejervoise"


Our heartfelt thanks and gratitude, from the Jonsson family of Jervoise Station.



Print examples below, four photos to choose from:

Our heartfelt thanks and gratitude, from the Jonsson family of Jervoise Station.

story:
I am Evan Fallenberg, a novelist, translator and teacher of creative writing and literary translation at several institutions around the world, and I invite you to read more about my books and awards at  evanfallenberg.com.  I was born in the US but have been living for about the past thirty years in Israel. 

Check out our Website - www.Arabesque in Acre.com

Two years ago I bought a dilapidated centuries-old building in the Old City of Acre (Akko) on Israel’s northern seacoast.  The Ottoman structure’s beautiful walls and ceilings were hidden behind hundreds of years of neglect, but thanks to an amazing team of practical visionaries, it has been restored to its original glory and enhanced quite a bit. 


Acre is an ancient town, one of the world’s oldest continually inhabited cities and host to dozens of civilizations as well as some of the most fascinating characters from history, like Alexander the Great, Cleopatra, Marco Polo and Napoleon.  It is a UNESCO World Heritage site.


Today, Acre’s Old City is nearly 100% Muslim.  My neighbors have not only accepted me but made me and my family and guests feel like an absolutely welcome new addition to the neighborhood.  They are as excited as I am about Arabesque; we all look forward to turning Arabesque into a venue where everyone feels at home, where the arts enable healthy self-expression and a safe and attractive meeting point for people of different languages, cultures and religions. Personally I’d like to think of this as one step on the road to peace, but in the Middle East it’s best to keep such wishes in one’s own heart.


As of this writing, in early November 2015, we are about a month away from finishing the restoration project and will be able to open our doors to the public in December, though we don’t expect to be up and fully running until the start of 2016.  We need you to get involved and help us start the real work, now that the building itself is nearly ready, by joining our arts programming; by helping us host events; by sponsoring writers and translators for month-long residencies; by taking part in our Arabic immersion program; or just by getting the word out that there is a new and exciting venue in Acre where you can enjoy a pampering and unusual stay in a unique B&B, absorb some terrific culture, and generally help support people in a community trying to make a difference in the Middle East.  By supporting us financially now you are giving us the breathing room we need while word spreads.


The incentives we are offering are low-priced ways for you to buy our services in advance.  For you that means, say, “purchasing” a poster or a stay in the B&B (which can also be given as a gift); it means sponsoring an event or a visiting writer or translator for an extended stay.  For us it means we have an operating budget for the critical first months.

The poster - reproductions of Andrei Grimberg’s original drawings of Arabesque.

Although dozens of people have been involved in turning Arabesque into reality, four of us will be intimately involved in its daily operations: my son Micha and our neighbor Maharan will be co-managers; Maharan’s mother, Khayet, will serve as house mother; and I will be responsible for the arts programming.  You can read about us and anything else you wish to know about Arabesque at  arabesqueinacre.com.  And do make sure to attend one of our launching events, soon to be announced.

Thanks in advance for supporting Arabesque at this absolutely crucial time, and for becoming part of what we all hope and believe will be an amazing, enduring focal point for great people and events in Acre and the entire region.
story_txt:
I am Evan Fallenberg, a novelist, translator and teacher of creative writing and literary translation at several institutions around the world, and I invite you to read more about my books and awards at  evanfallenberg.com.  I was born in the US but have been living for about the past thirty years in Israel. Check out our Website - www.Arabesque in Acre.comTwo years ago I bought a dilapidated centuries-old building in the Old City of Acre (Akko) on Israel’s northern seacoast.  The Ottoman structure’s beautiful walls and ceilings were hidden behind hundreds of years of neglect, but thanks to an amazing team of practical visionaries, it has been restored to its original glory and enhanced quite a bit. Acre is an ancient town, one of the world’s oldest continually inhabited cities and host to dozens of civilizations as well as some of the most fascinating characters from history, like Alexander the Great, Cleopatra, Marco Polo and Napoleon.  It is a UNESCO World Heritage site.Today, Acre’s Old City is nearly 100% Muslim.  My neighbors have not only accepted me but made me and my family and guests feel like an absolutely welcome new addition to the neighborhood.  They are as excited as I am about Arabesque; we all look forward to turning Arabesque into a venue where everyone feels at home, where the arts enable healthy self-expression and a safe and attractive meeting point for people of different languages, cultures and religions. Personally I’d like to think of this as one step on the road to peace, but in the Middle East it’s best to keep such wishes in one’s own heart.

As of this writing, in early November 2015, we are about a month away from finishing the restoration project and will be able to open our doors to the public in December, though we don’t expect to be up and fully running until the start of 2016.  We need you to get involved and help us start the real work, now that the building itself is nearly ready, by joining our arts programming; by helping us host events; by sponsoring writers and translators for month-long residencies; by taking part in our Arabic immersion program; or just by getting the word out that there is a new and exciting venue in Acre where you can enjoy a pampering and unusual stay in a unique B&B, absorb some terrific culture, and generally help support people in a community trying to make a difference in the Middle East.  By supporting us financially now you are giving us the breathing room we need while word spreads.The incentives we are offering are low-priced ways for you to buy our services in advance.  For you that means, say, “purchasing” a poster or a stay in the B&B (which can also be given as a gift); it means sponsoring an event or a visiting writer or translator for an extended stay.  For us it means we have an operating budget for the critical first months.The poster - reproductions of Andrei Grimberg’s original drawings of Arabesque.Although dozens of people have been involved in turning Arabesque into reality, four of us will be intimately involved in its daily operations: my son Micha and our neighbor Maharan will be co-managers; Maharan’s mother, Khayet, will serve as house mother; and I will be responsible for the arts programming.  You can read about us and anything else you wish to know about Arabesque at  arabesqueinacre.com.  And do make sure to attend one of our launching events, soon to be announced.Thanks in advance for supporting Arabesque at this absolutely crucial time, and for becoming part of what we all hope and believe will be an amazing, enduring focal point for great people and events in Acre and the entire region.

story:
SmallFolders are flatpack urban gardening products inspired by African and Latin American farmers and their hacks to gardening challenges. SmallFolders will help you grow herbs and plants, keep bees, and bring the magic of nature straight from the fields to your balcony or windowsill.


We know that many people living in urban settings struggle to keep plants in small spaces. So, with this campaign, we want to bring you products straight from the experts themselves - the Farmers! 


Who? Cafédirect Producers’ Foundation

We are Cafédirect Producers’ Foundation (CPF) and we work with a network of 280,000 smallholder farmers and 37 farmer cooperatives across Africa and Latin America.   

Our work helps to create forums in which farmers can get together to share their experiences, knowledge and innovations with one another. 

Farmer Hacks - big ideas for tiny spaces

We noticed that many of the farmers’ hacks are focused on efficiently utilising space and finding efficient ways to grow in small areas. These are very similar challenges to the ones we face in London. Here we saw the opportunity to take these designs direct from the fields of smallholder farmers and turn them into products ready for urban environments. 

In honour of their origins we have called them SmallFolders. Farmers are the experts who know best how to grow plants using simple techniques developed over years of experimentation and innovation. Therefore, with SmallFolders we have adapted farmers’ gardening designs, showcasing the in-depth knowledge of smallholders and the relevance of their expertise to western audiences.

How? The Products 

We have been assisted by product designers from Those to take the farmers' ideas and create the initial product designs!

We now have a great working model of a vertical garden to accompany designs for two further SmallFolder products: the Bee Hive, and the Bug Trap. 

Your support will make these a reality - as well as feed money back in to help develop even more products with our farming network!

What? The Perks 

SmallFolders - a fun series of packs 

Our SmallFolder packs will include:

  • information about the origin of the idea.
  • some Farmer Tips - to help you get the most out of your SmallFolders.
  • copies of the original sketch or smallholder idea.
  • instructions on how to easily assemble and use your SmallFolder.
  • the SmallFolders themselves! 


Vertical Garden - a simple way of keeping a kitchen garden in a small space

  • From farmers of: Michimikuru Tea Factory, Kenya

  • The Farmers Challenge: Lack of free land can make growing food for consumption very difficult. Vertical gardens are a good solution as they help keep in moisture when it’s hot, and let water drain out when it’s wet.

  • Why you’ll love it: Owning a garden in cities is rare but with the vertical garden you can grow plants even in a small flat. The vertical garden is flat-packed, easy to set up, and comes in a variety of colours suitable to grow your favourite foods in your own home.

Bug Trap - a simple way of controlling unwanted bugs from destroying a harvest

  • From farmers of: FEDECARES, Dominican Republic

  • The Farmers Challenge: Coffee farmers in Latin America lose a lot of their crop to pests and diseases. Solutions to this can be expensive and damaging to the environment. Therefore, farmers in the Dominican Republic designed these homemade traps using everyday materials, such as recycled bottles, as a more environmentally friendly alternative.

  • Why you’ll love it: We’ve developed this bug trap to replicate the original’s effectiveness but with a smaller body and modern design, perfect for your home!

Bee Hive - a simple way to keep bees and produce honey

  • From farmers at: Chirinos, Perú

  • The Farmers Challenge: Smallholder farmers often seek ways to diversify their incomes and bring in some extra cash to the household. Farmers in Perú have found a solution by harvesting honey and beeswax which can be consumed at home or sold at the market.

  • Why you’ll love it: Bees are in serious trouble. Their populations are declining rapidly and causing huge problems within complex ecosystems. However, people in both urban and rural environments can help. Our Bee Hive enables you to keep bees on your balcony and give them a home in the city.

Cafédirect Handpicked

We have partnered with Cafédirect Handpicked, the perfect club for coffee adventurists! By choosing the speciality coffee perk, you will receive a different freshly roasted coffee through your letterbox each month from a new corner of the coffee producing world, so you can travel the world cup by cup.

Why? Full Circle Approach 

As well as the opportunity to get your hands on the first SmallFolders products (and some other exciting perks!) this campaign will allow you to be part of something bigger. Your support will help us launch an initiative that showcases smallholder knowledge and innovations. Together we will generate a sustainable income source for our programmes and, by sharing smallholder expertise with western audiences, flip the standard transfer of knowledge from the North to South on its head. 

We are a small team (in fact there's only 8 of us!) supporting a huge network of farmers. We leverage our large network to have a positive impact on farmers, enabling them to: increase their incomes; build resilience to climate change; and improve their yields. 

SmallFolders will help us:

  1.  to develop, modify and adapt our urban gardening products further, creating more robust products for your home.

  2. to continue supporting our network of 280k smallholders improve livelihoods through our programmes.

Initial investment will support programmes on the ground helping farmers to develop additional innovations to increase incomes and build resilience. Consequently, we will be able to develop these farmers' hacks into further urban gardening solutions and restart the circle!


When? Timeline 


Risks and Challenges 

With all crowdfunding projects there are risks. As a charity with proven success in creative initiatives, a strong international team and a passion for these products, we know we can deliver. 

We have plans in place to ensure the SmallFolders are further developed, printed and delivered on time. We have not over promised, and will work day and night to ensure we keep the promise! 

Our team has a large range of skill sets, including technical ability, which has enabled us to make high quality prototypes which have been tested in various conditions. 

Our manufacturing process means that we can produce our SmallFolder range of products in both small and high quantities, and within tight  deadlines. In fact, we have access to the entire manufacturing process, so have total control.


Other ways you can help

You can help SmallFolders become a success by sharing our campaign, giving advice, and making some noise! You can easily share the campaign by clicking 'Share' on the below tools.

Also, please find out more about us and the smallholder farmers we work with by visiting our website: http://producersfoundation.org/


FAQs

When will I receive my SmallFolder item?

We’ll be busy designing and printing our smallfolders in early 2016, aiming to have delivered 100% of our SmallFolders by June 2016. We anticipate that we will have these sorted before this date, but are choosing June 2016 as an absolute latest date in which you’ll receive your SmallFolder, just in time for Summer :)

How will be able to choose my colour of perk after buying?

After you have selected the perk which has the option of selecting a colour (clearly stated), we will contact you asking for your colour preference.

How can I find out more about the charity?

You can find out more information about our work and team by going to our website.

Contact us

If you can't find an answer in our FAQs, feel free to email alex@producersfoundation.org 

We will get back to you ASAP!


How you can help!

Take a look at our amazing perks and support our mission, helping smallholder farmers in the process. We have some amazing perks suited for everyone who has a passion for gardening, DIY, charity. wildlife and nature and of course, supporting innovative ideas!

You can also help us spread the message by clicking ‘share’ below. Social media really does make the difference between success and failure! 

Thanks!
The CPF team
