story:
Why a Campaign for CANTY?

‘Canty’ is an old British word, an adjective meaning 'passionate, spirited, full of life.' And it’s now a new brand: a line of cause-crafted cases for women’s necessaries, and to accessorize their world.  Against objectification, and beyond empowerment, there’s CANTY®. 

Our brand has been met with raving reviews and brisk sales in our limited release to date. With your help, our goal in this campaign is to bring to market the CANTYclutch. This talking piece designer tin clutch will organize your phone, credit cards, chapstick and other essentials with style. This signature CANTY design will be produced as a limited edition. In our opening months of sales, no product has generated more requests than this one! Here's a v1.0 prototype sketch: 


Our Mission: Spreading 'Passion for Good'

CANTY is a women-owned business that is a celebration of the epic ‘Passion for Good’ that women bring to the world every day, in many moments and places. Our medium of expression is cause art, which we apply to cases that women need and enjoy -- for their purse or tote or backpack, or for their desk, dresser or kitchen counter. We’ve met with famous and ‘everyday-ordinary’ designers to shape our vision and bring it to life. And we partnered with Sevenly to draw from the world’s most celebrated library of cause art.
We listened to women like you from near and far about the needs that our cases might satisfy, and about your places and spaces we could accessorize with CANTY cases.  Along the way, we also found women whose stories inspired us, and whose ideas inspired our initial product collection. 

The group of us CANTY co-founders constantly remind ourselves of why we started.  We all have our own stories.  This one we shared, and millions watched. Our own stories compelled us to action; the stories of other women inspired us to risk....


Our Product Collection: Now, and Not Yet : )

Every great journey starts with small steps. You can learn about our first steps and inspirational stories through our brand launch video here. We wanted to find a new product category that would be functional and inspirational.  A line of women's cases was the answer.  

The first products in the CANTY line demonstrate both functional and lifestyle inspiration: CANTYkinis, CANTYhose, and two CANTYcase designs with award-winning Sevenly® art.  You can read all about each in the list of perks or in our version 1.0 website at www.canty.us. They're all connected to a CANTY woman whose charitable work is noted by an iconic mark, emblematic of their cause. Each product in this opening collection is innovative and carries the brand's essence.


The Brand Objective

But more than that, we wanted to create cases that make a statement -- EVERY CASE A CONVERSATION® -- and that inspire the one who holds or sees it. We know we can verbally express our disgust with the objectification of women and girls -- from porn to trafficking to gendercide. We can make a donation to charities in the fight for what's right. We can inspire ourselves and others to take action. But what would happen if there was a brand that combines all these into a line of products for our everyday lives?

Passion for Good would multiply. The group of us began to call it "The CANTY Effect." We white-boarded it like this:  


It all starts with a spark of CANTY in one woman who applies her Passion for Good to a great cause. She inspires a CANTY-branded product. Each of those products sold benefit her work. The women who enjoy the product carry the CANTY spirit to more women.  We join together to support great causes, share new stories, and empower each other to apply our Passion for Good to the great challenges of our time. The CANTY Effect happens: making the world better in ways big and small. These stories are already unfolding on the CANTY Women blog.

We're committed to making CANTY a participatory brand. To us, that means we'll invite our customers to help create product design ideas, select art, and connect those products to the charitable work of CANTY women.  We're also committed to making CANTY a sustainable brand. That means we'll be very selective about our supply chain sourcing, even when it costs us. Our first cases, for example, were all sourced by the same partners used by Trader Joe's, so that certificates we could obtain were further validated by due diligence from another brand we trusted.

Product line expansion will include the CANTYclutch, pill/vitamin cases, and the CANTYlongcase (for glasses, pens and hygiene products), as well as convenience cases for business cards, cosmetics and other necessaries. CANTY cases will be crafted to accessorize a woman’s desk, kitchen, and dresser, too. We'll also promote the CANTY spirit through a small line of wall art, shirts, stickers and other wearables and shareables to create conversation about Passion for Good.


Why This Campaign Matters

Our brand has been met with raving reviews and brisk sales in our limited release to date. We've felt deeply grateful and affirmed in our mission. You've cheered us to move forward! So this campaign marks the next step in the adventure: bringing to market what we believe will be our signature release, to help project the brand.

 

We launched the business with our own capital, and lots of sweat equity. We're all in. To bring the CANTYclutch to market, we'll need some help. If we can raise $21,000, we can bring this product to market by March. If we can raise more, we'll be able to enhance certain design and personalization options, which we'll share with you, and we'll be able to amplify the brand to market.  

Another way of looking at it is this way: the more we raise, the more we promise we'll be showing and seeing more CANTY in the world. :)


Risks & Challenges

We all value transparency. So we'll be clear in saying that we're young. We're inclined to risk because we're passionate.  We sometimes get impatient when things don't get done, or when we sense the time was yesterday for us to have a brand like this that creates stories like these. 

We've surrounded ourselves with good counsel and seasoned entrepreneurs and managers and partners.  But, we'll make mistakes - maybe nylon stockings are coming back, but maybe not....

We also recognize that we may not be able to scale with production agility and pricing advantage while maintaining our core principles of social impact and sustainable, ethical production. We may need to activate new product in creative ways, and with limited supply.  

We've measured these risks. We believe that the need for more CANTY in the places where we live, along with early proof of concept and early fan support, make these risks and the challenges of this campaign well worthwhile. So...


Will You Help Launch a Brand Movement?

Here's how you can help. 

  1. Fund. Our perks make great gifts, for yourselves or CANTY women you love.  We've tried to make it easy for you to help support our campaign.

  2. Share. If you resonate with our mission, share this with your family and friends to help us meet our goal!

  3. Introduce.  If you know anyone who shares our vision (bloggers, retailers, charities), please email us to make an introduction....

And if you have any questions or feedback, we’d love to talk with you about how this new brand can be all that it should be. Contact us at share@cantycases.com

So, give the gift of CANTY, and share Passion for Good!

If we can raise $21,000, we can bring this product to market by March. If we can raise more, we'll be able to enhance certain design and personalization options, which we'll share with you, and we'll be able to amplify the brand to market.  

Another way of looking at it is this way: the more we raise, the more we promise we'll be showing and seeing more CANTY in the world. :)


Risks & Challenges




We all value transparency. So we'll be clear in saying that we're young. We're inclined to risk because we're passionate.  We sometimes get impatient when things don't get done, or when we sense the time was yesterday for us to have a brand like this that creates stories like these. 
We've surrounded ourselves with good counsel and seasoned entrepreneurs and managers and partners.  But, we'll make mistakes - maybe nylon stockings are coming back, but maybe not....
We also recognize that we may not be able to scale with production agility and pricing advantage while maintaining our core principles of social impact and sustainable, ethical production. We may need to activate new product in creative ways, and with limited supply.  
We've measured these risks. We believe that the need for more CANTY in the places where we live, along with early proof of concept and early fan support, make these risks and the challenges of this campaign well worthwhile. So...





Will You Help Launch a Brand Movement?


Here's how you can help. 

Fund. Our perks make great gifts, for yourselves or CANTY women you love.  We've tried to make it easy for you to help support our campaign.
Share. If you resonate with our mission, share this with your family and friends to help us meet our goal!
Introduce.  If you know anyone who shares our vision (bloggers, retailers, charities), please email us to make an introduction....

And if you have any questions or feedback, we’d love to talk with you about how this new brand can be all that it should be. Contact us at share@cantycases.com
So, give the gift of CANTY, and share Passion for Good!

story:
Short Summary

When owner/operator Dan Gorder opened State of Bean Coffeehouse over a decade ago, he had no idea where it would lead him.  Though it started as a simple coffee shop, it quickly grew to include ice cream, in-house roasted coffee, and a simple café menu.  To accommodate the growing demand, Dan packed up shop and moved two blocks south to become The Bean Coffee & Wine Cafe.  He added a drive-thru window and offered an expanded menu with artisan sandwiches, salads, and soups.  He also traded the ice cream for a wide variety of imported wine and craft beers (awesome decision!).  State of Bean/The Bean has now been a staple in the Andover community for eleven years, striving to provide the northern suburbs with Uptown atmosphere but without all the hassle of the city.  However, to better achieve that goal, it is once again time for a change!

Kortni Ringwall has been a part of The Bean for nearly four years, developing and perfecting her culinary techniques while providing Dan an ear to spew his aspirations.  After Kortni spent a year stint in the "real world," Dan convinced her to become his Executive Chef with instructions to rebuild the kitchen and completely revamp the menu.  The ultimate goal?  To turn The Bean into more... much more...

BRIO will be the perfect blend of Owner Dan’s past and Chef Kortni’s future.  During the day, BRIO will be a breakfast and lunch café, offering the best in local coffee, homemade baked goods, and a new full-breakfast menu.  As homage to The Bean, the lunch menu will continue to feature our favorite artisan sandwiches like the Red Feathered Pig and the classic Caprese.  However, come the evening, BRIO will transform into a modern fine-casual restaurant with full table service.  The highly trained wait-staff will serve great espresso, craft brews, and hand-picked wines that pair perfectly with the ever rotating dinner menu.

With the elevated serving standards, fresh take on classic dishes, and strong passion to bring the best we can to our customers, BRIO will not only be an Andover staple, but a Twin Cities destination restaurant.

What We Need & Why

Though BRIO's kitchen remodel is fully funded, we are asking for help with our advertising plan and interior refresh.  We plan on primarily using a word-of-mouth advertising plan; however we need $7000 to purchase new signage for the building.  This sign will show people that we have officially become BRIO!  The rest of our fundraising goal is all for YOU!  We are so excited to have all of you be a part of becoming BRIO!  We are a community-driven restaurant that loves our regular customers, which is why we want to become BRIO!  Many people have asked how they can get involved and this is your answer.  All of our rewards are built to be the most comfortable and practical to suit you guys!
If we are fortunate enough to exceed our goal, all of that funding will go towards our new dinnerware: plates, silverware, and wine glasses; and continued interior improvements, such as new flooring, booths, and lighting.

The Impact

BRIO is exciting, new, classic, modern, young, experienced, and zealous all wrapped into one restaurant.  Though we are technically a single establishment, we will be a combination of TWO concepts: a morning coffee café paired with an evening fine-casual restaurant.  BRIO will provide the Northern Suburbs a much needed culinary haven; offering everything from breakfast classics like pancakes & French toast, to modernized dinner plates such as seared scallops and chicken roulade.
This combination of dinning experiences is hard to find anywhere in this area. Outside of the stereotypical food chains, most establishments cater to the sports bar theme.  Though that certainly has its place in the culinary world, people deserve to have another option!  BRIO is that option!

Risks & Challenges

We are all very confident in BRIO!  We have been around for 11 years, and all during that time we have been diligent in listening to what our customers are looking for in their restaurant offerings.  However, there are three main concerns we have with the big change: upsetting our current clientele, bringing in new faces, and risking the business we've already built.

To handle our current customers, we plan on being very open and honest about all the changes.  We have been very talkative about all our changes: the menu, the name, the kitchen remodel, the booths & flooring, etc…  By keeping an open line of communication with our regulars, we have been able to answer their questions and settle their anxiety about BRIO.

When it comes to bringing in new customers, most restaurants take a strong advertising stance and just want to get their logo out and seen.  At BRIO, we strongly believe in the power of word of mouth advertising.  Though we will have our logo out there, we plan on bringing new people through the door by sending people out the door who have had the best BRIO experience we can give them!  If we truly do what we do best, then the word will spread.

Owner Dan Gorder, Chef Kortni Ringwall, and Manager Amber Bullock have all been working very hard to get BRIO going!  All three are professionals of their industry; Business, Culinary Arts, and Front of House Management.  Simply put, this means all three are risking their hard earned titles by becoming BRIO.  They have worked very hard to get to this point and they don’t plan on stopping.  With the unique combination of youth, experience, and passion, becoming BRIO means becoming better versions of themselves!  Only when you’re the best version of yourself can you be the best, and that is truly our goal as we become BRIO.

Other Ways You Can Help

We have had to be very careful and diligent in our spending as we make the necessary changes to become BRIO... trust us when we say, we understand the tight budget mindset!  Don't feel left out if you can't donate financially!  We understand and would love your donation in other ways.  For example, sharing Brio and this campaign through your social media sites, liking our Facebook page, or by simply coming in and trying all of our offerings for yourself!  We appreciate your support in any form!

story:
Soooooo, a lot of people have been hearing of our initiatives for the first time this week. I guess we have to figure out a way to get the word around (how about you sharing the posts pretty please).

So one of our teams is #OurCarmichael (which you can find via the Facebook search option. 

We have successfully organized and host a few initiatives over the last few months and have a lot more in the works.

Here's a brief, who what why!
WHO: We are all volunteers. Nobody gets paid. We are Bahamian and Non-Bahamian, young and old, black, white, Asian, Indian, mixed, Christian, Rastafarian, Hindu and neither, Carmichael residents and non-residents, employed and unemployed, made up of FNM, DNA, PLP, UDP but we've asked everyone to check their politics, religious views and social status at the door. You get the picture?

WHAT: We are trying to rebuild communities with ordinary people doing extra-ordinary things on the ground and in communities. To rebuild communities, we believe we have to address a number of issues, concerns and needs. So we organize several events and initiatives that we feel are interesting enough to get people involved and out of their comfort zone.

WHY: We all (regardless of our politics, nationality status, religion and social status) want to see things CHANGE in The Bahamas for the better and realize that talking has done nothing, while action makes a difference. We aren't big on talking. Boots to the ground! We believe everyone deserves to feel safe in their community. We believe every child should have equal opportunity to do well in school and start a career worthy of their talents. We believe that everyone should be safe from violence, political victimization and sexual predators. We believe the best thing you can do for your people is educate them. We believe more needs to be done for the elderly. We believe more people would be better off in life and in their communities if they took some responsibility for themselves and had the help they needed for a hand-up as opposed to hand-outs.

So here's some of what we do. Feel free to get involved with this MOVEMENT TOWARDS CHANGE.

1. Bingo & Breakfast events
2. Dinner & Movie events
3. Older People Events
4. Job Agency & Job Fair
5. Community Farming
6. Educational and Empowerment Workshops
7. Money Management Workshops
8. Free Legal Workshops
9. Free Medical Workshops
10. Scholarship Assistance Programs
11. Mentorship and Community Activism Workshops

GREAT BAHAMIAN CHALLENGE

story:
I am Nada Salam From Gaza Strip, Palestine, I have been married 3 years ago, In addition to that I holds a business administration degree from the University College of Applied Sciences and professional.

Since the end of the latest attack and aggression, Gaza strip is suffering from tragic situation, which reached to the extent that the World Bank declared that Gaza is on the brink of collapse. The siege, the bad economic situation, and the high unemployment rate mad me launched this campaign, Because I can’t find any work for me or for my husband , So we can’t meet the needs of our children.

We aspire to build an educational center Pioneers, to give the tuition contribute to raising the educational level of students and improve their performance in schools By paying a small fee.

I am looking for your generous contributions to help me and my family for live as others.

That we need you to help us to build a small project for my family so we can a living as any a family.

Please consider them part of your family and feel their pain. Donate with any amount and lets bring them smile back.

If I got overall amount that will be 5000$ I will use it like this:

Budget breakdown:

  Item                  No. of units        Unit price      Tot in USD

- tables :                         10                           100                  1000$

-   chairs  :                       13                            23                   300$


- Computer :                   1                            700                  700$

- Rent an apartment :    1                          1200                1200$

- Photocopy machine:   1                           1800               1800$



please help  donation & share

Invite your friends to support us

story:
The First Spark...

Five years ago, I realized I had lots of noise and dirt in my life and I needed some SPARKLE!  As a single mom of 2 boys, I needed a job that was flexible so that I could meet my boys' needs and still provide for our family.  A lifelong entrepreneur, I started Bling Out Loud - an apparel company focusing on quality rhinestone designs with fast turnaround.   

I began setting stones by hand and then, after about a year, purchased an automatic setting machine.  The next year, I added an employee and another automatic setter.  This past year, we added screen printing, spangles, and more employees.

We are at the point that the business has outgrown my dining room and my family room has become a cramped production hub.  

Over this past year, the plan has been developing and now we're ready.  The store will be Bling Out Loud Apparel and Gifts, providing custom spirit wear and unique gifts. With a storefront, we will be able to provide 1 hour service on many items.  We are calling this service "Create on Demand."  Stop by the store, pick out your shirt style, the design you want, personalize it with a name on the back, and we'll have it ready in under an hour.    We will continue to provide fast turnaround on group orders and specialize in small print runs.

Another feature of the store will be the party room and class room.   We have "Princess" parties planned, where kids can create their own bling shirts and there are "coloring book" shirt parties, as well.  For adults, we have private Girls Night Out crafting parties and "Create Date" events planned.   The class room will offer DIY lessons for how to bling your shoes, lamps, hats, as well as other craft skills.  

Moving to a storefront will allow this business to continue to grow so that we can bring bling and sparkle to all of West Houston.  It also means my kids get the family room back to play games in.


What We Need & What You Get

We need $25,000 to cover start up costs.  The business plan financing is comprised of a line of credit (to serve as reserve), a handful of small investors (which covers build out), and $25,000 in crowdfunding to cover start up costs.   

Every dollar we raise in this campaign goes to getting the store off the ground.  If we don't make our crowdfunding goal, you still get your perks and we will seek out more investors.  We're determined to make the move to a storefront to grow this business and be able to "thrive, not just survive" for all of our staff while bringing sparkle to Katy.

What do you get for helping out?  You get some great perks!  With all of the levels comes our thanks!  From the $5 level of an original design decal to the $250 level of joining us for our Grand Opening Private event (which includes many of the perks here), you're going to find something to help get your sparkle on and help us reach our goal!

  • $5 - Get Your Sparkle On Decal
  • $15 -Custom Glitter Letter Decal
  • $25 - Personalized Draw String Tote
  • $50 - Sports Mom Bling Shirt
  • $75 - Party Voucher valued at $100
  • $100 - Serious Spangle Pack - Tee, Tote, and Decal
  • $100 - Ba-Da-Bling Pack - Tee, Tote, and Decal
  • $150 - Group Order Voucher valued at $200
  • $250 - Grand Opening Private Party and Swag Bag
See the "Select a Perk" for more details and check the gallery or see below for images of the perks.

Impact

Having a bling apparel and gifts store in Katy will give great schools like Taylor High School, Cinco Ranch High School, Morton Ranch High, and Katy High quick and easy access to spirit wear.  Located at Mason and Kingsland, it's also just a few minutes from Seven Lakes High, Tompkins High, and Mayde Creek High.  
With the Bling Out Loud Create on Demand format, getting your sparkle on and getting personalized, last minute gifts will be easy!
Bling Out Loud will be able to broaden its reach to make everyone sparkle in West Houston.  After all, "Bling Makes Everything Better!"

Risks & Challenges

Like every great American dream, it takes funding.  If we do not reach our funding goal, we will try again.  The advantage to opening the storefront in the spring, is to hit the ground running for end of school events, like teacher gifts and the start of summer sports leagues.   Whether this campaign is fully funded or not, you will receive your perks.  (At the $250 level, there won't be a party to go to.  You'll still receive the swag bag of goodies.  At the $75 level, we'll just have to bring the party to you.)

Other Ways You Can Help

"Sharing is Caring."  Please share this campaign with everyone you know.  If you are interested in more than just a perk, like investing or making a long term, low interest business loan, please contact Pamela Mosby.

You can use the Indiegogo share tools for facebook and other social platforms.  You can also visit our website or facebook page and share from there.

 Like every great American dream, it takes funding.  If we do not reach our funding goal, we will try again.  The advantage to opening the storefront in the spring, is to hit the ground running for end of school events, like teacher gifts and the start of summer sports leagues.   Whether this campaign is fully funded or not, you will receive your perks.  (At the $250 level, there won't be a party to go to.  You'll still receive the swag bag of goodies.  At the $75 level, we'll just have to bring the party to you.)
Other Ways You Can Help
 "Sharing is Caring."  Please share this campaign with everyone you know.  If you are interested in more than just a perk, like investing or making a long term, low interest business loan, please contact Pamela Mosby.
You can use the Indiegogo share tools for facebook and other social platforms.  You can also visit our website or facebook page and share from there.

story:
My name is Elaine Rodriguez, owner of Barkery Delights. My professional background consists of business operations as well as human resources in small & Fortune 500 businesses. My passion, like my grandmother, is making people happy. As a child I did my first home base bakery business to raise money with the goal to purchase presents for my parents on special occasions and holidays. As an adult this passion came back by baking treats for my daughter and later for my pets. About four years ago, our oldest dog "Girl", 13 years old at the time, had her health starting to decline.  Being a single mom, we have had to live paycheck to paycheck for as long as I can remember, so purchasing fancy food and medication for our pet was not that feasible.  After researching on alternative food with natural ingredients doggies need in their daily diet, I decided to make healthy homemade food for them. Girl's health improved within weeks - so I asked myself, why not make doggie treats as well. So I did! This is how Barkery Delights was born. Girl received the opportunity to leave 4 more years with us.  

Now Barkery Delights has 3 different flavors and we even have doggie testers to make sure our treats are withing their liking.  The treats are made with 100% natural human grade products and made in my kitchen. There are no artificial, flavors, preservatives or coloring. Around July 2015, I was able to start the sale of these products.  Unfortunately, due to lack of funds, I have not even scratched the surface of achieving my dream of using my passion to make others happy.  

With your contribution, Barkery Delights will have the opportunity to expand their minimal marketing campaign currently in place to one where we can start marketing to the metropolitan area. Your donations will allow me to purchase products to create the recipes at the wholesale value instead of retail price, which makes it easier for me to produce larger quantities for my treats. Additionally, your backing will allow me to further improve our packaging.   

If this goal is not reached the funds donated will still be used in the business for expansion.  Where there is a will - there is a way!

story:
WHY FIRST RESPONDERS NEED YOUR HELP

Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) takes a terrible toll on law enforcement officers, fire fighters, paramedics and others in emergency response professions.  Help is available through Rotary House Retreat (RHR) but First Responders frequently cannot afford such care when it's not otherwise covered by workers' compensation or other insurance.   Therefore, a partial "scholarship" is needed for those without benefits. 

That's where you can help!

RHR is a six-day intensive outpatient retreat that provides First Responders the opportunity to learn and practice new coping skills while addressing symptoms of PTSD -- substance abuse, anxiety, depression, suicidal thoughts, sleep disorders, etc.   Its model is based on that of the highly successful West Coast Post-Trauma Retreat in northern California.
The goals of RHR are to enable First Responders to restore and resume his/her work in a highly productive manner -- and to avoid negative outcomes such as family dissolution, chemical dependence, or suicide.


The retreat is staffed by clinical professionals, specially-trained peer counselors, and ordained chaplains.  

At the end of the week, RHR participants will have learned and practiced new life skills and gained friends and confidants who understand their issues (personal and professional) as trusted lifelines for the rest of their career and beyond.

Because of the stigma of PTSD, many First Responders fear loss of their careers.   Rotary helps calm this fear by providing a program designed to help First Responders retain and restore their careers by creating and funding retreat operations.   Yet when insurance benefits are not available, additional help is needed from those of us -- ALL of us -- who are served by First Responders as individuals, as families, and as organizations.   The partial "scholarship" funded by all of us fills this need.

Please contribute what you can to help our heroes continue their careers and enjoy a healthy, productive life.

Thank you.

story:
Introduction

Imagine yourself in an aboriginal community (they are called “Orang Asli”) in the jungles of Malaysia, 2.5 hours drive south of the capital Kuala Lumpur and 1 hour away from the nearest urban center.  Here, economic activity and social mobility are severely limited here.  Incomes typically range average around RM600 – RM1,000 (US$146-US$243) per month from doing odd jobs and reaping the spoils from the jungle. This compares unfavourably against Malaysia’s average of RM10,000 (US $2,439) per annum. We believe that we can do something about this and bring about SUSTAINABLE CHANGE to the community by creating an ENTREPRENEUR who can be a shining example, and who will kick-start the process of change (of the mindset).

Bananas on the hills of Jelebu 
My name is Shukri Hamid (the longer article of the project is at my LinkedIn and you can browse my profile) and I have team up with the members of the Musaceaa team at the Islamic Science University (USIM) in Nilai, Malaysia.  As part of ENACTUS (ENtrepreneurial ACTion US) USIM, these studentshave managed to find a novel solution to help this underserved community, in line with their tagline to Fight, Empower and build a Bridge to a Better life.  You can view the longer article on LinkedIn.

Pak Pong and Family of two young children
The students have successfully motivated Pak Pong (or Mr. Jelupong) to plant banana trees on his land on hills for sustainable income.  This was through an RM5,000 (US $1,200) from the Government.   Pak Pong was able to plant 300 banana trees which has already been harvested.  This has resulted in an income translates to RM933 (US$227) a month, which is already TWICE of what he makes before.  He now wants to expand but does not have the funds.  
Our campaign will focus on raising the funds for expansion of the banana plantation from a total of 300 trees to 600 trees.  Pak Pong is now clearing up his adjacent to the current plantation to realise even more income (which we feel would be setting a good example for his tribe to emulate).  We would like to provide him with the funds to realise his goal of expanding his income.  This might be normal for you and most other people, but within the Orang Asli community who only work when they run out of money, this is a novelty!  Seeing that we can do this without Government intervention is important to us as we can set an example of students who have not even entering the workforce being able to do good for the society through Entrepreneurial Action.

This where Pak Pong wants to expand his Banana Plantation
Contributions to our campaign will help transform this rural community into a self sustainable model for generating income.  Our "Love Bananas" projects will  transform the lives of actual families in the this isolated enclave on the top of these jungle hills.  And since this is driven by students barely in the early 20s, it surely leave an indelible mark on these young minds to continue doing social work in the future, knowing that there are many sources of social capital from Malaysia and overseas.  For us (the team), this is a PARADIGM SHIFT from the mentality of going to the Government for grants, which results in a underfunded project and long disbursement cycles.  Things can now be done in the entrepreneurial way, and result in the creation of rural entrepreneurs such as Pak Pong.  You the Contributor will play a big role in making the transformation of the rural aboriginal community happen, to a new template where sustainable income can be derived from working their ancestral lands.

What We Need & What You Get

In order to double the banana trees, we also realise that output must also go along with productivity in true entrepreneurial style.  The previous seeds took 6  months to mature and we are now looking at new seed so he can harvest his fruits in 3 months (taking into account that . Pak Pong jokes with us that the Bananas should be called "Idaman" (meaning hope in the local language).  Other than the seeds, we also need a water sprinkler system to ensure his trees get water.  The hills have an intricate system of piping to bring the water from the rivers and this water now needs to be routed to the trees.  This is more needed here in Jelebu (where Pak Pong's plantation is at) since this is the most arid region in all of Malaysia!  Fertilisers are also needed in order to ensure that the fruits can be harvested in 3 months; the current plantation has only a 70% yield as trees succumb to fungal disease causing the tree to collapse prematurely. Using seeds will reduce the risk of the trees getting the disease (traditionally, bananas are planted from another banana tree making them identical clones susceptible to the same disease). 

We have also prepared a list of attractive perks for contributors.

1. For contributions of US$5 and US$10, we will mention you in a video of the project which we will make from time to time (interim project update) as well as at the end of the project

3. For US$20, we will send you a T-shirt of our logo which we will use throughout this campaign.  You will need to tell us the size 

4. For US$50, we will provide you with a tote bag as well as a "sumpit", the traditional Orang Asli weapon which is made of bamboo and shoots out poisonous jungle berries (we do not provide the berries).  You also get a cap, in addition to the T-shirt. 

4. For contributors of US$100, we will bring you to a tour in Jelebu where the banana plantation is and also for a journey into the pristine Malaysian jungle where you will be amazed at the flora and fauna.  The 4-6 hour tour will be conducted by an Orang Asli of the village who is well versed in the jungle tracks.  You get all the other perks and we will have your "sumpit" made in front of you by the Orang Asli themselves.

Drinking water along the Jungle trek

We will also shoot a video once this project once it is completed. It will appear on YouTube will the list of ALL contributors at the end of the video.  For the larger contributors, we will also feature you and your banana tree!

Should we not reach our goal, we will use the funds discreetly and put a priority in: (1) procuring the banana seeds which yield fruits in 3 months, and (ii) the fertiliser.  We will curtail his ability to generate more income but we also want to show the community that they will be able to reap the benefits early with less risk of the banana trees succumbing to disease, theft by wild animals, and natural causes. 

Should we exceed our goal, we could even select another participant from the Orang Asli village to start another plantation on the jungle hills!  Success is infectious and we want to provide the means for others to replicate Pak Pong's success. 


The Impact

So here we have a classic case of a strong spirited person from an underserved community having the desire and will to change. He has also demonstrated his role as a “change agent” for his community by enlisting the help. But what does he need to break out of the shackles? Shouldn’t we as the community play a role in making his dream “love bananas” bear fruit?  The impact to his Village and others in the Orang Asli community will be far reaching.  For example, we noticed that the Orang Asli here do not place a great deal of emphasis on education as children are encouraged to help their parents look for money at an early age.  There have been many cases of young teens (girls especially) fleeing to the towns in search of more money - the outcome is catastrophic for this community and we will not even touch this subject.  A sustainable income for the families will allow them to put education in its proper place, as a tool for future social mobility.  The Orang Asli children are significantly behind with negative future ramifications for this society.  This project allows us to break this cycle and give the Parents and their children a chance.

A young banana tree, like children, needs nurturing for it to bear fruit


Risks & Challenges

The students at USIM already have gone through the first cycle of 300 banana trees planted here and are well versed to address the risk. There was resistance in early stages (what is sustainable income to the Orang Asli anyway?) especially from the Village Elder but Pak Pong's early success now has set tongues wagging.  We hope that this expansion will get the Village Elder to support our future initiatives to generate sustainable income for the entire community.
The risks are as follows:
1. Disease - We have already seen 30% of the previous trees go to waste. This is why we are planting seeds which are able to produce fruits in only 3 months (vs. the usual 6-9 months) to mitigate the risk of disease.  
2. Theft of the fruits - there is no security to guard against theft of the fruit produce, be it against humans or wild animals.  The Orang Asli are steeped in tradition where theft of member of the community's produce is frowned up.  As to the wild animals, Pak Pong has built a 
3. Financial Management - the Orang Asli are simple people.  Money goes in and money goes out the pocket and life goes on.  This is potentially the largest risk as we are creating a project for Pak Pong to be sustainable; he should use the proceeds from his bananas to fund further expansion of the plantation.  The students of USIM also have conducted various course on financial management (for people with high debt) and will bring their expertise to bear on Pak Pong and the Orang Asli community . A important skill which we will teach Pak Pong is how to use to cashflow from the selling of the fruits to raise for small business loans from Government agencies in the future. 

One of the classes by the USIM students on Entrepreneurship


Other Ways You Can Help

We appeal to everyone to support our campaign in any way you can. This initiative means so much to us as it involves transforming a community in our own backyard. Please spread the news and encourage people to see our videos as well as read our articles.  We will produce more videos and articles in order to update you on the progress of the fundraising and also the project.  To Pak Pong and his Love Ba Ba Ba Banana na.. na..

The team needs your support! However small is significant to us, even by making the campaign go viral

story:
About:

My name is Queen and I am a single mother of a 5 year old.  Being a single mom has not been easy in terms of accomplishing one's goals. I had not planned on being a single mom, but I accepted the situation, buckled myself with prayer, resilience, and determination.  I continue to strive to fulfill my passion. I am currently in a cosmetology school that is accommodating to all types of hair styling and its focus being healthy hair. In addition, I am also pursuing a doctoral degree at a Michigan University. Trying to attain all of this has not been an easy journey.  However, the focus of being well balanced and financially free to take care of life's basics needs and being the best mom I can be continues to be a struggle.  

Single mothers have the stigma of  relying on state aid to alleviate the financial stress of taking care of a child.  However, if the choices were given, state aid would not be an option due to the bureaucracy involved, but rather on a fulfilling and prosperous career.  

Often people ask me, "How do you do it?" and I often say, "I do not know. I just pray and by God's grace, I just do it." Based on this frequently asked question, I have decided to host an event in 2016  along with a friend, who is also a single mother and has a story of her own to tell.  Her story and her determination inspires me.  She is a survivor and a mother of three. 


Description of Event:

According to the US census, more than 80% of single mothers were head of household  in 2014. Single mothers continue to carry the weight of what two parents should be responsible and accountable for in raising a child. Taking on such a task can be overwhelming and therefore, can sometimes give a single mother a sense of inadequacy and isolation. 

Single mothers need a community behind them.  The challenges of raising a child alone day-to-day can be daunting and leave mothers feeling under supported. Single Mothers with A Determined Spirit is an event scheduled for the summer of 2016. The event will revitalize single mothers' career plan of action to reach an attainable career plateau that will provide and promote financial freedom through motivational and inspirational support, ultimately leading to a hopeful, healthy, and well balanced life. The focus of being well balanced and financially free to take care of life's basic needs and being the best mom one can be is a constant struggle for many mothers. The event is to take place in the summer of 2016 in Oakland County, Michigan.The event will consist of motivational speakers that will address stress management, time management and career planning strategies. A financial advisor will provide financial planning tips. The gathering will provide the audience with the knowledge and opportunity to network with people who share similar circumstances, and to help better cope with being a single mother. The event will also give an inner voice  to inspire, encourage, and show single mothers that with determination, many things are possible. As part of the event, some of the proceeds will be awarded in the form of a  scholarship to one single mother who has chosen to pursue a cosmetology licensed career in Michigan.  Pursuing a cosmetology license gives a sense of independence, however,  it does not limit one to pursuing an advanced career or further ones education in the future in any field of interest or passion. The four hour event is expected to have participants of approximately 50-60 people.

Having the opportunity to host such an event will allow lives to be changed through the caring power of community involvement, a strong support system, and respecting the worth and dignity of every person. It will inspire single mothers with ambition, to rise above the odds and sometimes negative connotation associated with being a single mom. 

 

The magnitude of what you will help us achieve:

When you donate, sponsor, or support Single Moms with A Determined Spirits' event,  you encourage women who sacrifice every day to take an inner look at themselves and see their potential.  All contributions will help meet pressing needs and encourage the single moms to either go back to school , earn a certificate or a degree, or explore other career opportunities that offer a sustainable income. This event will also allow the participant to attain financial planning strategies, and bond with other single moms in the community for support and care.

Part of the contributions will aid in supporting and inspiring one single mother who demonstrates an ambition to pursue  a cosmetology license hence, giving her a sense of accomplishing something greater for herself and her family.

The amount of $5,000 is being requested for the event. A portion of the donation will aid towards the preparation of the event and the remainder of the donation will be allocated in the form of a scholarship to one single mom who shows an interest in and determination in pursuing a career in cosmetology to better her life.  The process in choosing the recipient for the scholarship involves the contestants to write a 250 word essay demonstrating how the scholarship would help fund and contribute to their schooling.


The Impact:

Your contribution will help change many single mothers' lives through the positive and valuable resources that would be provided at the event.  These resources will allow single moms to know that they are not alone and the event will impact their life's  journey,  which contributes to society as a whole. This is our first time hosting such an event and with the help from our contributors we hope it will foster future annual events. 


Risks & Challenges:

We are aware that there might be risks and challenges in putting an event together and funding an event. But as single moms, determination and will power is part of our existence. As we launch this campaign, the obstacles we face will be documented as well as our solutions to solve these problems.  This event has been in the planning phase for quite awhile with much fore thoughts.  With such an event it is hard to predict any issues or challenges that might arise, however, with the help of the committee members a solution will be put into place adequately.


Please spread the word with others:

If you have a business and are interested in donating and /or sponsoring this event, please send  an email to momsdetermined@gmail.com. If  you do not have a business but, would still like to offer your support, you may make a donation and / or sponsor via Indiegogo.com. If you want to learn more about the event and or REGISTER  (Registration Website )  for the event please, visit us at singlemomsevent (Official Website) If you are a licensed child care provider and would love to offer your services,  please send us an email. We plan to offer free child care for this event. 

Thank you for taking the time to read this and we await your generous contribution to a great and a  life changing event.

With Candor,

Queen U. and Wei W. (Momsdetermined)
story_txt:
About: 
My name is Queen and I am a single mother of a 5 year old.  Being a single mom has not been
easy in terms of accomplishing one's goals. I had not planned on being a single
mom, but I accepted the situation, buckled myself with prayer, resilience, and determination.  I continue to strive to fulfill
my passion. I am currently in a cosmetology school that is accommodating to all
types of hair styling and its focus being healthy hair. In addition, I am also
pursuing a doctoral degree at a Michigan University. Trying to attain all of this has not been an easy
journey.  However, the focus of being well
balanced and financially free to take care of life's basics needs and being the
best mom I can be continues to be a struggle.  
Single mothers have the stigma
of  relying on state aid to alleviate the
financial stress of taking care of a child.  However, if the choices were given, state aid would not be an option due to the bureaucracy involved, but rather on a
fulfilling and prosperous career.  
Often people ask me, "How do you do it?" and I often say,
"I do not know. I just pray and by
God's grace, I just do it." Based on this frequently asked question, I
have decided to host an event in 2016  along with a friend, who is also a single
mother and has a story of her own to tell. 
Her story and her determination inspires me.  She is a survivor and a mother of three. 

Description of Event:

According to the US census, more
than 80% of single mothers were head of household  in 2014. Single mothers continue to carry the weight of what two
parents should be responsible and accountable for in raising a child. Taking on
such a task can be overwhelming and therefore, can sometimes give a single mother a sense of inadequacy and isolation.  
Single
mothers need a community behind them. 
The challenges of raising a child alone day-to-day can be daunting and leave
mothers feeling under supported. Single Mothers with A Determined
Spirit is an
event scheduled for the summer of 2016. The event will revitalize single
mothers' career plan of action to reach an attainable career plateau that will
provide and promote financial freedom through motivational and inspirational support,
ultimately leading to a hopeful, healthy, and well balanced life. The
focus of being well balanced and financially free to take care of life's basic
needs and being the best mom one can be is a constant struggle for many
mothers. The event is to take place in the summer of 2016 in Oakland
  County, Michigan.The event will consist of motivational speakers
that will address stress management, time management and career planning
strategies. A financial advisor will provide financial planning tips. The
gathering will provide the audience with the knowledge and opportunity to
network with people who share similar circumstances, and to help better cope with being a single mother. The event will also give an inner voice  to inspire, encourage, and show single mothers
that with determination, many things are possible. As part of the event, some
of the proceeds will be awarded in the form of a  scholarship to one
single mother who has chosen to pursue a cosmetology licensed career in Michigan.  Pursuing a cosmetology license gives a sense of independence, however,  it does not limit one to pursuing an advanced career or further ones
education in the future in any field of interest or passion. The four hour event is expected to have participants of approximately 50-60 people.
Having
the opportunity to host such an event will allow lives to be changed through
the caring power of community involvement, a strong support system, and
respecting the worth and dignity of every person. It will inspire single
mothers with ambition, to rise above the odds and sometimes negative
connotation associated with being a single mom. 
 
The magnitude of what you will help us achieve:
When you donate, sponsor, or support Single Moms with A Determined Spirits'
event,  you encourage women who sacrifice
every day to take an inner look at themselves and see their potential.  All contributions will help meet pressing
needs and encourage the single moms to either go back to school , earn a
certificate or a degree, or explore other
career opportunities that offer a sustainable
income. This event will also allow the participant to attain financial planning
strategies, and bond with other single moms in the community for support and
care.

Part of the
contributions will aid in supporting and inspiring one single mother who
demonstrates an ambition to pursue  a
cosmetology license hence, giving her a sense of accomplishing something greater
for herself and her family.
The amount of $5,000 is being requested for the event. A portion of
the donation will aid towards the preparation
of the event and the remainder of the donation will be allocated in the form of
a scholarship to one single mom who shows an interest in and determination in
pursuing a career in cosmetology to better her life.  The process in choosing the recipient for
the scholarship involves the contestants to write a 250 word essay demonstrating
how the scholarship would help fund and contribute to their schooling.


    
The Impact:
Your contribution will help change many single mothers' lives through
the positive and valuable resources that would be provided at the event.  These resources will allow single moms to
know that they are not alone and the event will impact their life's  journey,  which contributes to society as a whole. This is our first
time hosting such an event and with the help from our contributors we hope it
will foster future annual events. 

Risks & Challenges:

We are aware that there might be risks and
challenges in putting an event together and funding an event. But as single
moms, determination and will power is part of our existence. As we launch this
campaign, the obstacles we face will be documented as well as our solutions to
solve these problems.  This event has been in the planning phase for quite awhile with much fore thoughts.  With such an event it is hard to predict
any issues or challenges that might arise, however, with the help of the
committee members a solution will be put into place adequately.


Please spread the word
with others:


If you have a business and are
interested in donating and /or sponsoring this event, please send  an email to momsdetermined@gmail.com. If 
you do not have a business but, would still like to offer your support,
you may make a donation and / or sponsor via Indiegogo.com. If you want to
learn more about the event and or REGISTER  (Registration Website )  for the event please, visit us at singlemomsevent (Official Website) If you are a licensed child care provider and
would love to offer your services, 
please send us an email. We plan to offer free child care for this
event. 
Thank you for taking the time to
read this and we await your generous contribution to a great and a  life changing
event.
With Candor,
Queen U. and Wei W. (Momsdetermined)

story:
About the projects

Hello! We are Ibasho, a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization that works to create communities that values elders in different parts of the world. Ibasho means “a place where you can feel like yourself” in Japanese. Click here for our mission, and here for our current projects.

We launched this crowd funding campaign to help build Ibasho cafe: self-sustainable livelihood projects organized and operated by local elders in Bagong Buhay barangay, Ormoc, Phillipines that was affected by Typhoon Yolanda in Nov. 2013.
Elders already have started to work together for the first 2 phases. Click here for the progress report of the project! They are aiming to complete the project in 3 years, and financial support is needed for them to make it happen. 

!!! Thank you for helping them complete the project, so that not only could elders establish their livelihood, but also for children to be benefited by their elders !!!

How the funds will be used?

The breakdown of $27,000 is as follows:

  • Construction materials for Ibasho cafeteria: $19,000 
  • Create a Mobile Ibasho café on wheels: $2,000 
  • Salary for a Filippino project coordinator: $6,000 

In case we wouldn't reach the original funding goal of $27,000, we allocate the available fund to continue immediate activities for the year 2016, while securing other funding sources.

Photo: A participatory workshop with Filipino elders for project design

Background of the Phillipines project

During the April and October 2014 trip, Ibasho team has assessed the needs of elders in 5 communities that were affected by typhoon Yolanda in , and selected the community in the Bagong Buhay barangay, Ormoc because of the strong leadership of the community. 

Ibasho also appointed a local Ibasho coordinator who would be working with the elders to guide the Ibasho project next two years. Ibasho recognized that developing a livelihood project for the elders who were affected by the Typhoon Yolanda was critical and requires immediate attention.

Following the assessment of community needs and their capacity through several workshops and meetings, Ibasho team suggested the initial scope of work and estimated cost for the physical infrastructure part of this project. It is important to note that these suggested projects are emerged directly from the input of elders in the Bagong Buhay Barangay.

Our Solution

Elders can become catalysts for connecting people of all ages in the community. However, older people are more often thought of as in need of care than as a resource to support younger generations. 

Ibasho project empowers and includes elders throughout the process, from development to operation, reversing the common social perception of elders from being cared for to caring for and contributing to the community. Elders are encouraged to take a leadership role in reinventing their communities.

The Impact

Your contribution will help make significant impacts such as:
  • Elders are empowered to lead community recovery : through intergenerational programs such as growing vegetables, recycling, preparing lunches for schoolchildren, and serving tea and snacks to local community members, it gives elderly disaster victims a way to connect and contribute to their community, a healthy way to find a sense of purpose and a place to be (Ibasho), as well as means to earn incomes.
  • Intergenerational learning: Children learn from elders' wisdom and experience, such as growing food, and clean their community through recycling.
  • Improving Nutrition for children : Children have access to healthier meals prepared by elders.

Photo: Filippino elders planting in their community garden, while Japanese elders exchange knowledge of their farming experiences

Why Ibasho café?

In 2013, Ibasho and the community Ofunato in Japan jointly created the concept of an “Ibasho café”, staffed by elder volunteers, that would serve as a community hub and a focal point of the recovery effort. 

Watch a story of the first Ibasho café project in the Tsunami and Earthquake stricken city of Ofunato, Japan. Since 2013, the Ibasho café has been successfully run by elders, connecting generations and transferring elders'  wisdom and knowledge in the local community.

Milestone of the first Ibasho project in Japan:

  • Elders organized 330 events and welcomed more than 11,000 visitors since 2013. 
  • Elders started organic farm, farmer’s market, noodle shop, and child day care. 
  • Elders Learned to apply for grants proposals. 
  • Elders traveled to Philippines to help set up the second Ibasho project
  • Elders participated in the UN World Conference on Disaster Risk Reduction to share their experiences.  

Photo: Children playing at Ibasho house in Ofunato, Japan.



Ibasho's recent media coverage

  • Red Cross New Zealand: “Leading Disaster Recovery Companion Through the Chaos” (page 21)
  • BloomburgBusiness: “Japan Gets a Look at Its Future Population Drain in Fukushima Today,” March 9, 2015
  • AARP The Journal, “Global Innovation: Ibasho’s Sustainable Communities Help Seniors Redefine Old Age,” January, 2015


Other Ways You Can Help

In addition to donating to our campaign, other ways you can help us would be:

  • Spread the word about our campaign in SNS, email, word of mouth. Click the SNS icons of this page and share among your friends!
  • We are accepting volunteers (PR and marketing, graphic design, grant writing, and so on). If you feel touched by our activities, please contact us!
  • We are looking for opportunities for collaboration with other organizations and projects. Let us know any potential opportunity.


!!! Thank you so much for your support !!!

Photo: Children playing at Ibasho house in Ofunato, Japan.

AARP The Journal, “Global Innovation: Ibasho’s Sustainable Communities Help Seniors Redefine Old Age,” January, 2015






Other Ways You Can Help In addition to donating to our campaign, other ways you can help us would be:  Spread the word about our campaign in SNS, email, word of mouth. Click the SNS icons of this page and share among your friends! We are accepting volunteers (PR and marketing, graphic design, grant writing, and so on). If you feel touched by our activities, please contact us!
We are looking for opportunities for collaboration with other organizations and projects. Let us know any potential opportunity.   
!!! Thank you so much for your support !!!

story:
Okay I'm going to keep this short and to the point. 


You've got an exceptionally good, talented artist, that has a dream to open his own tattoo shop in Melbourne.


You've got his friend that would love more than anything to see him reach that dream.


and you've got the money to help him make that dream come true.


the decision to help is completely up to you! :)


$1 here and there could change his life, he deserves this he is so humble and caring for everyone and I would really hope the world repays him at some point. That's all folks. ❤️❤️❤️

story:
We've already raised $40,000 toward this goal. Help us get all the way there!


 Who We Are

SPUR brings people together from across the political spectrum to develop solutions to the big problems cities face.  For more than 100 years, we have helped create solutions to the most important issues facing the Bay Area, from affordable housing to climate change.  

We provide a place for members of the community to engage with one another in San Francisco and San Jose.  And now we need your help to support our efforts in Oakland.  

Why Oakland?

Oakland has an incredible set of assets. It's got a great walkable downtown. A diverse, eclectic and creative population. Strong transit connections to the rest of the Bay Area.  And, most of all, a passionate and involved citizenry.

We are thrilled to be working in Oakland. 

Why We Need You

After a year working in Oakland, SPUR has found the perfect home in this wonderful city at 1544 Broadway, right in the heart of downtown.  Our vision is to create a truly community-oriented space, one where Oakland residents can learn from one another and share ideas about how to improve their city.  SPUR needs your support to complete the space. Please join us in our efforts to make this city an even greater place to live, work and play.

Help us transform this space into our new Oakland home!


Ground floor - programming and event space


Upstairs - offices for Oakland based staff


Upstairs - communal co-working space


In Oakland, SPUR Aims to... 

  • Concentrate growth inside existing cities.
  • Build great neighborhoods. 
  • Make it affordable to live here.
  • Give people better ways to get where they need to go.
  • Lay the foundations of economic prosperity — for everyone.
  • Reduce our ecological footprint and prepare for climate change.
  • Support local government.

The Perks



Other Way to Get Involved


If you can't donate, there are other ways you can help out:
  • Please share our campaign on facebook and twitter: www.spur.org/spuronbroadway
  • Volunteer at our Martin Luther King Day of Service on January 18, 2016 
  • Come to our Oakland Open House on January 27, 2016

Thank You to Our Sponsors:

story:
Westward Coffee & Supply

Westward is a coffee shop different than anything Boise currently offers. We are distinguished by our commitment to providing the highest quality products prepared in the most innovative manner in an environment that is thoroughly fresh.  We will serve individually dripped artisanal coffee, the best quality espresso and serve the perfect simple breakfast. Additionally we will also provide hard to find wares for the coffee conouissers and a small, curated assortment of products. 
We are devoted to the best quality. We want Westward to be your favorite place to grab a cup on the go or stay for a hot plate of poached eggs and toast!

  • We are a multi-generation Idaho family that loves Boise. We are big fans of everything Idaho has to offer, from backpacking and kayaking to hanging out downtown. After some stints out of state, we are excited to be coming back together as a family to provide Boise with an awesome new hang out spot that provides the artisanal coffee products big cities take for granted. 
  • By donating,  you are helping us open our doors. We don't have piles of money under the mattress and have scraped together all of our pennies to make this dream a reality. For us, this is about more than just opening a shop, it's about creating a soulful and sustainable business for our family and the community for years to come.

What We Need & What You Get

For our project, we need to raise additional money to buy a laundry list of equipment including:
  • espresso machine
  •  grinders 
  • refrigerator
  • ice machine
  • hot water dispenser
  • dishwashing sink 
  • and more
We also need to totally transform and retrofit our space as well as pay the Boise city fees for sewage connections and permitting. We are more than half way there on our own, but need your help to make sure nothing is lacking!
With your funds we will be able to supplement our credit purchases so that we can put more money back into the business and keep it going strong. The more money we get from our community the less we have to rely on big bank financing and the accompanying high interest rates, fees and overall risk. 

Perks Perks Perks

  • We have some really great perks. Besides serious gratitude and cosmic good vibes - we have a selection of goodies built into our campaign.  From t-shirts and camp cups to amazing custom experiences, we want to make sure that you get your moneys worth and come see us again and again.

                  ---------------Some of our favorite perks: represent! -------------------                                     
        _____________________________________________________________________
   

                     

        _____________________________________________________________________

                               ____________________________________________________________________

        ____________________________________________________________________

The Impact

Your contribution will make a HUGE difference for us. The more funds we get, the better service and atmosphere we can provide and the more stable our business will be financially. We are coming to Boise to stay and want to ensure the best success so you always have a place to get your perfect cup.

  • Boise deserves a coffee shop that is on point with the highest end coffee and espresso experiences in America. Our guarantee to you is simple: every coffee, espresso drink or meal you get at Westward will be consistently the best, served in a totally different kind of atmosphere.
  • We will be located right in the thick of downtown. With a full cafe and walk up window service, we think it will be just right for meeting up or grabbing a cup to go.
  • Besides providing you with an excellent coffee and hang out experience, we think that this kind of business can help inform the development of Boise's downtown. We want this area to come alive, and if that's going to happen it will need businesses like ours and people like you to make it happen.

  • Risks & Challenges

We are in the process of securing a space in Boise's downtown. Our video features the spot that we are hoping to rent - but we don't have it yet. We need more financing in order to secure the location.

 If we lose out on this space, we plan to soldier on to other available locations. We are committed to making this work! With our combined backgrounds in commercial design and planning (Nicole), small business ownership (Jessye and Nicole) and barista experience (Jessye and Nicole) we feel like we have all the tools necessary to make this dream a reality! If we are unable to secure a brick and mortar, we have some seriously sweet ideas for a coffee truck that will bring you the same great experience on wheels.

  • Other Ways You Can Help
  • Anything helps! We appreciate your donations as well as your support. Please post this anywhere and everywhere. Tell your friends and family and help us make this a major community effort.
  • Indiegogo makes it easy to share. Check out the share tools here to help us spread the word.
                        Much love from our family. We hope to see you soon!

With your funds we will be able to supplement our credit purchases so that we can put more money back into the business and keep it going strong. The more money we get from our community the less we have to rely on big bank financing and the accompanying high interest rates, fees and overall risk. 

Perks Perks Perks
 We have some really great perks. Besides serious gratitude and cosmic good vibes - we have a selection of goodies built into our campaign.  From t-shirts and camp cups to amazing custom experiences, we want to make sure that you get your moneys worth and come see us again and again.



                  ---------------Some of our favorite perks: represent! -------------------                                             _____________________________________________________________________

   
                     

        _____________________________________________________________________
                               ____________________________________________________________________

        ____________________________________________________________________
The Impact
 Your contribution will make a HUGE difference for us. The more funds we get, the better service and atmosphere we can provide and the more stable our business will be financially. We are coming to Boise to stay and want to ensure the best success so you always have a place to get your perfect cup.  Boise deserves a coffee shop that is on point with the highest end coffee and espresso experiences in America. Our guarantee to you is simple: every coffee, espresso drink or meal you get at Westward will be consistently the best, served in a totally different kind of atmosphere.
We will be located right in the thick of downtown. With a full cafe and walk up window service, we think it will be just right for meeting up or grabbing a cup to go.
Besides providing you with an excellent coffee and hang out experience, we think that this kind of business can help inform the development of Boise's downtown. We want this area to come alive, and if that's going to happen it will need businesses like ours and people like you to make it happen.


Risks & Challenges

  We are in the process of securing a space in Boise's downtown. Our video features the spot that we are hoping to rent - but we don't have it yet. We need more financing in order to secure the location.
 If we lose out on this space, we plan to soldier on to other available locations. We are committed to making this work! With our combined backgrounds in commercial design and planning (Nicole), small business ownership (Jessye and Nicole) and barista experience (Jessye and Nicole) we feel like we have all the tools necessary to make this dream a reality! If we are unable to secure a brick and mortar, we have some seriously sweet ideas for a coffee truck that will bring you the same great experience on wheels.  
Other Ways You Can Help


 
Anything helps! We appreciate your donations as well as your support. Please post this anywhere and everywhere. Tell your friends and family and help us make this a major community effort.
Indiegogo makes it easy to share. Check out the share tools here to help us spread the word.

                        Much love from our family. We hope to see you soon!

story:
Hello!,
Wet Sock Interactive is a new company from The Netherlands founded on the 10th of December 2014, we want to create tools for developers, games and mobile apps. Our app division will do business as 'Intrinsic Apps'.

We have several concepts written down but we haven't managed to get enough money to sufficiently invest in things such as: licences, tools, marketing and graphic design. And we also need to eat.

We want to sell:

  • Useful and painless tools to help developers.
  • Feature rich apps which offer a full experience.
  • Enjoyable indie games.
We plan to release several apps in 2015 and possibly our first PC game if money and time is available (we have the concept but we lack the funds for things such as graphic design).
There is a long road ahead and we want to grow into a bigger company with a supportive environment for other developers. Which turns exciting ideas into enjoyable products.
We want to set ourselves apart from the competition by really focusing on what our users enjoy and by offering them a full, feature rich experience with good usability.


Behind the curtains

Mervin Koops
  • +/- 5 years of work experience as a software and web developer
  • Started programming at age 13
  • Lives in The Netherlands,  Age 22,  Male
  • Favorite programming languages: C#, PHP, C, GLSL
  • Favorite platforms: PC, Android
  • Hobbies: Gaming, Electronics Engineering, Spending time with friends, watching Anime.
Merijn Venema
  • +/- 8 years of work experience as a software and web developer
  • Started programming at age 13
  • Lives in The Netherlands,  Age 26,  Male
  • Favorite programming languages: C#, PHP, C++, Java, JS
  • Favorite platforms: I don`t like to pick favorites :)
  • Hobbies: Gaming, making music, trading cards, tinkering

What We Need & What You Get

Our expenses per category:

  • Development Hardware
  • Graphic design
  • Audio design
  • Marketing
  • Salaries
  • Security/Code signing certificates
  • Training materials
  • Server fees
  • Licenses
  • Corporate phone bills
  • Taxes
  • Indiegogo rewards
These costs need to be paid by us to design and create the tools, apps and games that we want to make.

Please note that after receiving our funds we'll have to pay a percentage of it to: Indiegogo as commision and to the Dutch government as income tax. After that we need to pay for reward fulfilment. The amount that's left over goes to Wet Sock Interactive.

Perks

T-Shirt
Sizes:         S,  M,  L,  XL  (All pre-shrunk, Unisex, Euro-Fit)
Colors:      White, Gray, Light blue, Sand
Material:   100% cotton


Coffee Mug
Colors:       White
Safety:       Microwave safe, dishwasher safe
Material:    Ceramic


The Impact

After we raise the funds that we need we plan to go full throttle on the development of our products. Your donations help us to get the tools we need and allow us to spend the time we need on development. 
We can't divulge our development plans at this stage but you will be able to follow our progress on Facebook, twitter and our website. We plan to release several (useful) mobile apps in 2015 and if funds allow it we want to work on a game concept that we have.
We can't thank you enough for your investment in our future. Because it helps us achieve our dreams and makes it possible for us to make the software we want: feature rich apps, useful and painless tools for developers and enjoyable games. All for affordable prices.
In the long run (after we have secured a reasonable income) we want to get an office in The Netherlands and make a fun, innovating and friendly environment for creative young talent to come together and work on all sorts of projects.

Without your donations we'll have to make arrangements with banks and credit suppliers to get up and running. We won't shy away from this if we absolutely need to.. but we'd rather not go down that path.


Risks & Challenges

This is the point where we tell you what worries us:

  • Finding an audience for our products; we believe in the product concepts we have but this time we have to do the marketing ourselves and get noticed.
  • Sales; after finding the people they need to be willing to purchase our products
  • Running out of money; We have to eat, invest in tools, get licences, certificates, pay taxes, invest in marketing, pay artists and many more.


Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you can't (or don't want to) contribute money; that's okay, we understand.
We'd like you to get the word out to your friends, make some noise!
You can use the Indiegogo share tools to share this campaign.

Questions & Answers 
  • We will update this section based on questions that we receive.
